29.8: and the desert tremble. And because of the LORD, the desert near Kadesh shivers and shakes.
29.9: The voice of the LORD makes deer give birth before their time. Forests are stripped of leaves, and the temple is filled with shouts of praise.
29.10: The LORD rules on his throne, king of the flood forever.
29.11: Pray that our LORD will make us strong and give us peace.

30.1: I will praise you, LORD! You saved me from the grave and kept my enemies from celebrating my death.
30.2: I prayed to you, LORD God, and you healed me,
30.3: saving me from death and the grave.
30.4: Your faithful people, LORD, will praise you with songs and honor your holy name.
30.5: Your anger lasts a little while, but your kindness lasts for a lifetime. At night we may cry, but when morning comes we will celebrate.
30.6: I was carefree and thought, "I'll never be shaken!"
30.7: You, LORD, were my friend, and you made me strong as a mighty mountain. But when you hid your face, I was crushed.
30.8: I prayed to you, LORD, and in my prayer I said,
30.9: "What good will it do you if I am in the grave? Once I have turned to dust, how can I praise you or tell how loyal you are?
30.11: You have turned my sorrow into joyful dancing. No longer am I sad and wearing sackcloth.
30.12: I thank you from my heart, and I will never stop singing your praises, my LORD and my God.

31.1: I come to you, LORD, for protection. Don't let me be ashamed. Do as you have promised and rescue me.
31.2: Listen to my prayer and hurry to save me. Be my mighty rock and the fortress where I am safe.
31.3: You, LORD God, are my mighty rock and my fortress. Lead me and guide me, so that your name will be honored.
31.4: Protect me from hidden traps and keep me safe.
31.5: You are faithful, and I trust you because you rescued me.
31.6: I hate the worshipers of worthless idols, but I trust you, LORD.
31.7: I celebrate and shout because you are kind. You saw all my suffering, and you cared for me.
31.8: You kept me from the hands of my enemies, and you set me free.
31.9: Have pity, LORD! I am hurting and almost blind. My whole body aches.
31.10: I have known only sorrow all my life long, and I suffer year after year. I am weak from sin, and my bones are limp.
31.11: My enemies insult me. Neighbors are even worse, and I disgust my friends. People meet me on the street, and they turn and run.
31.12: I am completely forgotten like someone dead. I am merely a broken dish.
31.13: I hear the crowds whisper, "Everyone is afraid!" They are plotting and scheming to murder me.
31.14: But I trust you, LORD, and I claim you as my God.
31.15: My life is in your hands. Save me from enemies who hunt me down.
31.16: Smile on me, your servant. Have pity and rescue me.
31.17: I pray only to you. Don't disappoint me. Disappoint my cruel enemies until they lie silent in their graves.
31.18: Silence those proud liars! Make them stop bragging and insulting your people.
31.19: You are wonderful, and while everyone watches, you store up blessings for all who honor and trust you.
31.20: You are their shelter from harmful plots, and you are their protection from vicious gossip.
31.21: I will praise you, LORD, for showing great kindness when I was like a city under attack.
31.22: I was terrified and thought, "They've chased me far away from you!" But you answered my prayer when I shouted for help.
31.23: All who belong to the LORD, show how you love him. The LORD protects the faithful, but he severely punishes everyone who is proud.
31.24: All who trust the LORD, be cheerful and strong.

32.1: Our God, you bless everyone whose sins you forgive and wipe away.
32.2: You bless them by saying, "You told me your sins, without trying to hide them, and now I forgive you."
32.3: Before I confessed my sins, my bones felt limp, and I groaned all day long.
32.4: Night and day your hand weighed heavily on me, and my strength was gone as in the summer heat.
32.5: So I confessed my sins and told them all to you. I said, "I'll tell the LORD each one of my sins." Then you forgave me and took away my guilt.
32.6: We worship you, Lord, and we should always pray whenever we find out that we have sinned. Then we won't be swept away by a raging flood.
32.7: You are my hiding place! You protect me from trouble, and you put songs in my heart because you have saved me.
32.8: You said to me, "I will point out the road that you should follow. I will be your teacher and watch over you.
32.9: Don't be stupid like horses and mules that must be led with ropes to make them obey."
32.10: All kinds of troubles will strike the wicked, but your kindness shields those who trust you, LORD.
32.11: And so your good people should celebrate and shout.

33.1: You are the LORD's people. Obey him and celebrate! He deserves your praise.
33.2: Praise the LORD with harps! Use harps with ten strings to make music for him.
33.3: Sing a new song. Shout! Play beautiful music.
33.4: The LORD is truthful; he can be trusted.
33.5: He loves justice and fairness, and he is kind to everyone everywhere on earth.
33.6: The LORD made the heavens and everything in them by his word.
33.7: He scooped up the ocean and stored the water.
33.8: Everyone in this world should worship and honor the LORD!
33.9: As soon as he spoke the world was created; at his command, the earth was formed.
33.10: The LORD destroys the plans and spoils the schemes of the nations.
33.11: But what the LORD has planned will stand forever. His thoughts never change.
33.12: The LORD blesses each nation that worships only him. He blesses his chosen ones.
33.13: The LORD looks at the world
33.14: from his throne in heaven, and he watches us all.
33.15: The LORD gave us each a mind, and nothing we do can be hidden from him.
33.16: Mighty armies alone cannot win wars for a king; great strength by itself cannot keep a soldier safe.
33.17: In war the strength of a horse cannot be trusted to take you to safety.
33.18: But the LORD watches over all who honor him and trust his kindness.
33.19: He protects them from death and starvation.
33.20: We depend on you, LORD, to help and protect us.
33.21: You make our hearts glad because we trust you, the only God.
33.22: Be kind and bless us! We depend on you.

34.1: I will always praise the LORD.
34.2: With all my heart, I will praise the LORD. Let all who are helpless, listen and be glad.
34.3: Honor the LORD with me! Celebrate his great name.
34.4: I asked the LORD for help, and he saved me from all my fears.
34.5: Keep your eyes on the LORD! You will shine like the sun and never blush with shame.
34.6: I was a nobody, but I prayed, and the LORD saved me from all my troubles.
34.7: If you honor the LORD, his angel will protect you.
34.8: Discover for yourself that the LORD is kind. Come to him for protection, and you will be glad.
34.9: Honor the LORD! You are his special people. No one who honors the LORD will ever be in need.
34.10: Young lions may go hungry or even starve, but if you trust the LORD, you will never miss out on anything good.
34.11: Come, my children, listen as I teach you to respect the LORD.
34.12: Do you want to live and enjoy a long life?
34.13: Then don't say cruel things and don't tell lies.
34.14: Do good instead of evil and try to live at peace.
34.15: If you obey the LORD, he will watch over you and answer your prayers.
34.16: But God despises evil people, and he will wipe them all from the earth, till they are forgotten.
34.17: When his people pray for help, he listens and rescues them from their troubles.
34.18: The LORD is there to rescue all who are discouraged and have given up hope.
34.19: The LORD's people may suffer a lot, but he will always bring them safely through.
34.20: Not one of their bones will ever be broken.
34.21: Wicked people are killed by their own evil deeds, and if you hate God's people you will be punished.
34.22: The LORD saves the lives of his servants. Run to him for protection, and you won't be punished.

35.1: Fight my enemies, LORD! Attack my attackers!
35.3: Aim your spear at everyone who hunts me down, but promise to save me.
35.4: Let all who want to kill me be disappointed and disgraced. Chase away and confuse all who plan to harm me.
35.5: Send your angel after them and let them be like straw in the wind.
35.6: Make them run in the dark on a slippery road, as your angel chases them.
35.7: I did them no harm, but they hid a net to trap me, and they dug a deep pit to catch and kill me.
35.8: Surprise them with disaster! Trap them in their own nets and let them fall and rot in the pits they have dug.
35.9: I will celebrate and be joyful because you, LORD, have saved me.
35.10: Every bone in my body will shout: "No one is like the LORD!" You protect the helpless from those in power; you save the poor and needy from those who hurt them.
35.11: Liars accuse me of crimes I know nothing about.
35.12: They repay evil for good, and I feel all alone.
35.13: When they were sick, I wore sackcloth and went without food. I truly prayed for them,
35.14: as I would for a friend or a relative. I was in sorrow and mourned, as I would for my mother.
35.15: I have stumbled, and worthless liars I don't even know surround me and sneer.
35.16: Worthless people make fun and never stop laughing.
35.17: But all you do is watch! When will you do something? Save me from the attack of those vicious lions.
35.18: And when your people meet, I will praise you and thank you, Lord, in front of them all.
35.19: Don't let my brutal enemies be glad because of me. They hate me for no reason. Don't let them wink behind my back.
35.20: They say hurtful things, and they lie to people who want to live in peace.
35.21: They are quick to accuse me. They say, "You did it! We saw you ourselves."
35.22: You see everything, LORD! Please don't keep silent or stay so far away.
35.23: Fight to defend me, Lord God,
35.24: and prove that I am right by your standards. Don't let them laugh at me
35.25: or say to each other, "Now we've got what we want! We'll gobble him down!"
35.26: Disappoint and confuse all who are glad to see me in trouble, but disgrace and embarrass my proud enemies who say to me, "You are nothing!"
35.27: Let all who want me to win be happy and joyful. From now on let them say, "The LORD is wonderful! God is glad when all goes well for his servant."
35.28: Then I will shout all day, "Praise the LORD God! He did what was right."

36.1: Sinners don't respect God; sin is all they think about.
36.2: They like themselves too much to hate their own sins or even to see them.
36.3: They tell deceitful lies, and they don't have the sense to live right.
36.4: Those people stay awake, thinking up mischief, and they follow the wrong road, refusing to turn from sin.
36.5: Your love is faithful, LORD, and even the clouds in the sky can depend on you.
36.6: Your decisions are always fair. They are firm like mountains, deep like the sea, and all people and animals are under your care.
36.7: Your love is a treasure, and everyone finds shelter in the shadow of your wings.
36.8: You give your guests a feast in your house, and you serve a tasty drink that flows like a river.
36.9: The life-giving fountain belongs to you, and your light gives light to each of us.
36.10: Our LORD, keep showing love to everyone who knows you, and use your power to save all whose thoughts please you.
36.11: Don't let those proud and merciless people kick me around or chase me away.
36.12: Look at those wicked people! They are knocked down, never to get up again.

37.1: Don't be annoyed by anyone who does wrong, and don't envy them.
37.2: They will soon disappear like grass without rain.
37.3: Trust the LORD and live right! The land will be yours, and you will be safe.
37.4: Do what the LORD wants, and he will give you your heart's desire.
37.5: Let the LORD lead you and trust him to help.
37.6: Then it will be as clear as the noonday sun that you were right.
37.7: Be patient and trust the LORD. Don't let it bother you when all goes well for those who do sinful things.
37.8: Don't be angry or furious. Anger can lead to sin.
37.9: All sinners will disappear, but if you trust the LORD, the land will be yours.
37.10: Sinners will soon disappear, never to be found,
37.11: but the poor will take the land and enjoy a big harvest.
37.12: Merciless people make plots against good people and snarl like animals,
37.13: but the Lord laughs and knows their time is coming soon.
37.14: The wicked kill with swords and shoot arrows to murder the poor and the needy and all who do right.
37.15: But they will be killed by their own swords, and their arrows will be broken.
37.16: It is better to live right and be poor than to be sinful and rich.
37.17: The wicked will lose all of their power, but the LORD gives strength to everyone who is good.
37.18: Those who obey the LORD are daily in his care, and what he has given them will be theirs forever.
37.19: They won't be in trouble when times are bad, and they will have plenty when food is scarce.
37.20: Wicked people are enemies of the LORD and will vanish like smoke from a field on fire.
37.21: An evil person borrows and never pays back; a good person is generous and never stops giving.
37.22: Everyone the LORD blesses will receive the land; everyone the LORD curses will be destroyed.
37.23: If you do what the LORD wants, he will make certain each step you take is sure.
37.24: The LORD will hold your hand, and if you stumble, you still won't fall.
37.25: As long as I can remember, good people have never been left helpless, and their children have never gone begging for food.
37.26: They gladly give and lend, and their children turn out good.
37.27: If you stop sinning and start doing right, you will keep living and be secure forever.
37.28: The LORD loves justice, and he won't ever desert his faithful people. He always protects them, but destroys the children of the wicked.
37.29: God's people will own the land and live here forever.
37.30: Words of wisdom come when good people speak for justice.
37.31: They remember God's teachings, and they never take a wrong step.
37.32: The wicked try to trap and kill good people,
37.33: but the LORD is on their side, and he will defend them when they are on trial.
37.34: Trust the LORD and follow him. He will give you the land, and you will see the wicked destroyed.
37.35: I have seen brutal people abuse others and grow strong like trees in rich soil.
37.36: Suddenly they disappeared! I looked, but they were gone and no longer there.
37.37: Think of the bright future waiting for all the families of honest and innocent and peace-loving people.
37.38: But not a trace will be left of the wicked or their families.
37.39: The LORD protects his people, and they can come to him in times of trouble.
37.40: The LORD helps them and saves them from the wicked because they run to him.

38.1: When you are angry, LORD, please don't punish me or even correct me.
38.2: You shot me with your arrows, and you struck me with your hand.
38.3: My body hurts all over because of your anger. Even my bones are in pain, and my sins
38.4: are so heavy that I am crushed.
38.5: Because of my foolishness, I am covered with sores that stink and spread.
38.6: My body is twisted and bent, and I groan all day long.
38.7: Fever has my back in flames, and I hurt all over.
38.8: I am worn out and weak, moaning and in distress.
38.9: You, Lord, know every one of my deepest desires, and my noisy groans are no secret to you.
38.10: My heart is beating fast. I feel weak all over, and my eyes are red.
38.11: Because of my sickness, no friends or neighbors will come near me.
38.12: All who want me dead set traps to catch me, and those who want to harm and destroy me plan and plot all day.
38.13: I am not able to hear or speak a word;
38.14: I am completely deaf and can't make a sound.
38.15: I trust you, LORD God, and you will do something.
38.16: I said, "Don't let them laugh or brag because I slip."
38.17: I am about to collapse from constant pain.
38.18: I told you my sins, and I am sorry for them.
38.19: Many deadly and powerful enemies hate me,
38.20: and they repay evil for good because I try to do right.
38.21: You are the LORD God! Stay nearby and don't desert me.
38.22: You are the one who saves me. Please hurry and help.

39.1: I told myself, "I'll be careful not to sin by what I say, and I'll muzzle my mouth when evil people are near."
39.2: I kept completely silent, but it did no good, and I hurt even worse.
39.3: I felt a fire burning inside, and the more I thought, the more it burned, until at last I said:
39.4: "Please, LORD, show me my future. Will I soon be gone?
39.5: You made my life short, so brief that the time means nothing to you. "Human life is but a breath,
39.6: and it disappears like a shadow. Our struggles are senseless; we store up more and more, without ever knowing who will get it all.
39.7: "What am I waiting for? I depend on you, Lord!
39.8: Save me from my sins. Don't let fools sneer at me.
39.9: You treated me like this, and I kept silent, not saying a word.
39.10: "Won't you stop punishing me? You have worn me down.
39.11: You punish us severely because of our sins. Like a moth, you destroy what we treasure most. We are as frail as a breath.
39.12: "Listen, LORD, to my prayer! My eyes are flooded with tears, as I pray to you. I am merely a stranger visiting in your home as my ancestors did.
39.13: Stop being angry with me and let me smile again before I am dead and gone."

40.1: I patiently waited, LORD, for you to hear my prayer. You listened
40.2: and pulled me from a lonely pit full of mud and mire. You let me stand on a rock with my feet firm,
40.3: and you gave me a new song, a song of praise to you. Many will see this, and they will honor and trust you, the LORD God.
40.4: You bless all of those who trust you, LORD, and refuse to worship idols or follow false gods.
40.5: You, LORD God, have done many wonderful things, and you have planned marvelous things for us. No one is like you! I would never be able to tell all you have done.
40.6: Sacrifices and offerings are not what please you; gifts and payment for sin are not what you demand. But you made me willing to listen and obey.
40.7: And so, I said, "I am here to do what is written about me in the book, where it says,
40.8: 'I enjoy pleasing you. Your Law is in my heart.'"
40.9: When your people worshiped, you know I told them, "Our LORD always helps!"
40.10: When all your people met, I did not keep silent. I said, "Our LORD is kind. He is faithful and caring, and he saves us."
40.11: You, LORD, never fail to have pity on me; your love and faithfulness always keep me secure.
40.12: I have more troubles than I can count. My sins are all around me, and I can't find my way. My sins outnumber the hairs on my head, and I feel weak.
40.13: Please show that you care and come to my rescue. Hurry and help me!
40.14: Disappoint and confuse all who want me dead; turn away and disgrace all who want to hurt me.
40.15: Embarrass and shame all of those who say, "Just look at you now!"
40.16: Our LORD, let your worshipers rejoice and be glad. They love you for saving them, so let them always say, "The LORD is wonderful!"
40.17: I am poor and needy, but, LORD God, you care about me, and you come to my rescue. Please hurry and help.

41.1: You, LORD God, bless everyone who cares for the poor, and you rescue those people in times of trouble.
41.2: You protect them and keep them alive. You make them happy here in this land, and you don't hand them over to their enemies.
41.3: You always heal them and restore their strength when they are sick.
41.4: I prayed, "Have pity, LORD! Heal me, though I have sinned against you."
41.5: My vicious enemies ask me, "When will you die and be forgotten?"
41.6: When visitors come, all they ever bring are worthless words, and when they leave, they spread gossip.
41.7: My enemies whisper about me. They think the worst,
41.8: and they say, "You have some fatal disease! You'll never get well."
41.9: My most trusted friend has turned against me, though he ate at my table.
41.10: Have pity, LORD! Heal me, so I can pay them back.
41.11: Then my enemies won't defeat me, and I will know that you really care.
41.12: You have helped me because I am innocent, and you will always be close to my side.
41.13: You, the LORD God of Israel, will be praised forever! Amen and amen.

42.1: As a deer gets thirsty for streams of water, I truly am thirsty for you, my God.
42.2: In my heart, I am thirsty for you, the living God. When will I see your face?
42.3: Day and night my tears are my only food, as everyone keeps asking, "Where is your God?"
42.4: Sorrow floods my heart, when I remember leading the worshipers to your house. I can still hear them shout their joyful praises.
42.5: Why am I discouraged? Why am I restless? I trust you! And I will praise you again because you help me,
42.6: and you are my God. I am deeply discouraged as I think about you from where the Jordan begins at Mount Hermon and from Mount Mizar.
42.7: Your vicious waves have swept over me like an angry ocean or a roaring waterfall.
42.8: Every day, you are kind, and at night you give me a song as my prayer to you, the living LORD God.
42.9: You are my mighty rock. Why have you forgotten me? Why must enemies mistreat me and make me sad?
42.10: Even my bones are in pain, while all day long my enemies sneer and ask, "Where is your God?"
42.11: Why am I discouraged? Why am I restless? I trust you! And I will praise you again because you help me, and you are my God.

43.1: Show that I am right, God! Defend me against everyone who doesn't know you; rescue me from each of those deceitful liars.
43.2: I run to you for protection. Why have you turned me away? Why must enemies mistreat me and make me sad?
43.3: Send your light and your truth to guide me. Let them lead me to your house on your sacred mountain.
43.4: Then I will worship at your altar because you make me joyful. You are my God, and I will praise you. Yes, I will praise you as I play my harp.
43.5: Why am I discouraged? Why am I restless? I trust you! And I will praise you again because you help me, and you are my God.

44.1: Our God, our ancestors told us what wonders you worked and we listened carefully.
44.2: You chased off the nations by causing them trouble with your powerful arm. Then you let our ancestors take over their land.
44.3: Their strength and weapons were not what won the land and gave them victory! You loved them and fought with your powerful arm and your shining glory.
44.4: You are my God and King, and you give victory to the people of Jacob.
44.5: By your great power, we knocked our enemies down and stomped on them.
44.6: I don't depend on my arrows or my sword to save me.
44.7: But you saved us from our hateful enemies, and you put them to shame.
44.8: We boast about you, our God, and we are always grateful.
44.9: But now you have rejected us; you don't lead us into battle, and we look foolish.
44.10: You made us retreat, and our enemies have taken everything we own.
44.11: You let us be slaughtered like sheep, and you scattered us among the nations.
44.12: You sold your people for little or nothing, and you earned no profit.
44.13: You made us look foolish to our neighbors, and people who live nearby insult us and sneer.
44.14: Foreigners joke about us and shake their heads.
44.15: I am embarrassed every day, and I blush with shame.
44.16: But others mock and sneer, as they watch my enemies take revenge on me.
44.17: All of this has happened to us, though we didn't forget you or break our agreement.
44.18: We always kept you in mind and followed your teaching.
44.19: But you crushed us, and you covered us with deepest darkness where wild animals live.
44.20: We did not forget you or lift our hands in prayer to foreign gods.
44.21: You would have known it because you discover every secret thought.
44.22: We face death all day for you. We are like sheep on their way to be slaughtered.
44.23: Wake up! Do something, Lord! Why are you sleeping? Don't desert us forever.
44.24: Why do you keep looking away? Don't forget our sufferings and all of our troubles.
44.25: We are flat on the ground, holding on to the dust.
44.26: Do something! Help us! Show how kind you are and come to our rescue.

45.1: My thoughts are filled with beautiful words for the king, and I will use my voice as a writer would use pen and ink.
45.2: No one is as handsome as you! Your words are always kind. That is why God will always bless you.
45.3: Mighty king, glorious ruler, strap on your sword
45.4: and ride out in splendor! Win victories for truth and mercy and justice. Do fearsome things with your powerful arm.
45.5: Send your sharp arrows through enemy hearts and make all nations fall at your feet.
45.6: You are God, and you will rule forever as king. Your royal power brings about justice.
45.7: You love justice and hate evil. And so, your God chose you and made you happier than any of your friends.
45.8: The sweet aroma of the spices myrrh, aloes, and cassia, covers your royal robes. You enjoy the music of harps in palaces decorated with ivory.
45.9: Daughters of kings are here, and your bride stands at your right side, wearing a wedding gown trimmed with pure gold.
45.10: Bride of the king, listen carefully to me. Forget your own people and your father's family.
45.11: The king is your husband, so do what he desires.
45.12: All of the richest people from the city of Tyre will try to influence you
45.13: with precious treasures. Your bride, my king, has inward beauty, and her wedding gown is woven with threads of gold.
45.14: Wearing the finest garments, she is brought to you, followed by her young friends, the bridesmaids.
45.15: Everyone is excited, as they follow you to the royal palace.
45.16: Your sons and your grandsons will also be kings as your ancestors were. You will make them the rulers everywhere on earth.
45.17: I will make your name famous from now on, and you will be praised forever and ever.

46.1: God is our mighty fortress, always ready to help in times of trouble.
46.2: And so, we won't be afraid! Let the earth tremble and the mountains tumble into the deepest sea.
46.3: Let the ocean roar and foam, and its raging waves shake the mountains.
46.4: A river and its streams bring joy to the city, which is the sacred home of God Most High.
46.5: God is in that city, and it won't be shaken. He will help it at dawn.
46.6: Nations rage! Kingdoms fall! But at the voice of God the earth itself melts.
46.7: The LORD All-Powerful is with us. The God of Jacob is our fortress.
46.8: Come! See the fearsome things the LORD has done on earth.
46.9: God brings wars to an end all over the world. He breaks the arrows, shatters the spears, and burns the shields.
46.10: Our God says, "Calm down, and learn that I am God! All nations on earth will honor me."
46.11: The LORD All-Powerful is with us. The God of Jacob is our fortress.

47.1: All of you nations, clap your hands and shout joyful praises to God.
47.2: The LORD Most High is fearsome, the ruler of all the earth.
47.3: God has put every nation under our power,
47.4: and he chose for us the land that was the pride of Jacob, his favorite.
47.5: God goes up to his throne, as people shout and trumpets blast.
47.6: Sing praises to God our King,
47.7: the ruler of all the earth! Praise God with songs.
47.8: God rules the nations from his sacred throne.
47.9: Their leaders come together and are now the people of Abraham's God. All rulers on earth surrender their weapons, and God is greatly praised!

48.1: The LORD God is wonderful! He deserves all praise in the city where he lives. His holy mountain,
48.2: beautiful and majestic, brings joy to all on earth. Mount Zion, truly sacred, is home for the Great King.
48.3: God is there to defend it and has proved to be its protector.
48.4: Kings joined forces to attack the city,
48.5: but when they saw it, they were terrified and ran away.
48.6: They trembled all over like women giving birth
48.7: or like seagoing ships wrecked by eastern winds.
48.8: We had heard about it, and now we have seen it in the city of our God, the LORD All-Powerful. This is the city that God will let stand forever.
48.9: Our God, here in your temple we think about your love.
48.10: You are famous and praised everywhere on earth, as you win victories with your powerful arm.
48.11: Mount Zion will celebrate, and all Judah will be glad, because you bring justice.
48.12: Let's walk around Zion and count its towers.
48.13: We will see its strong walls and visit each fortress. Then you can say to future generations,
48.14: "Our God is like this forever and will always guide us."

49.1: Everyone on this earth, now listen to what I say!
49.2: Listen, no matter who you are, rich or poor.
49.3: I speak words of wisdom, and my thoughts make sense.
49.4: I have in mind a mystery that I will explain while playing my harp.
49.5: Why should I be afraid in times of trouble, when I am surrounded by vicious enemies?
49.6: They trust in their riches and brag about all of their wealth.
49.7: You cannot buy back your life or pay off God!
49.8: It costs far too much to buy back your life. You can never pay God enough
49.9: to stay alive forever and safe from death.
49.10: We see that wise people die, and so do stupid fools. Then their money is left for someone else.
49.11: The grave will be their home forever and ever, although they once had land of their own.
49.12: Our human glory disappears, and, like animals, we die.
49.13: Here is what happens to fools and to those who trust the words of fools:
49.14: They are like sheep with death as their shepherd, leading them to the grave. In the morning God's people will walk all over them, as their bodies lie rotting in their home, the grave.
49.15: But God will rescue me from the power of death.
49.16: Don't let it bother you when others get rich and live in luxury.
49.17: Soon they will die and all of their wealth will be left behind.
49.18: We humans are praised when we do well, and all of us are glad to be alive.
49.19: But we each will go down to our ancestors, never again to see the light of day.
49.20: Our human glory disappears, and, like animals, we die.

50.1: From east to west, the powerful LORD God has been calling together everyone on earth.
50.2: God shines brightly from Zion, the most beautiful city.
50.3: Our God approaches, but not silently; a flaming fire comes first, and a storm surrounds him.
50.4: God comes to judge his people. He shouts to the heavens and to the earth,
50.5: "Call my followers together! They offered me a sacrifice, and we made an agreement."
50.6: The heavens announce, "God is the judge, and he is always honest."
50.7: My people, I am God! Israel, I am your God. Listen to my charges against you.
50.8: Although you offer sacrifices and always bring gifts,
50.9: I won't accept your offerings of bulls and goats.
50.10: Every animal in the forest belongs to me, and so do the cattle on a thousand hills.
50.11: I know all the birds in the mountains, and every wild creature is in my care.
50.12: If I were hungry, I wouldn't tell you, because I own the world and everything in it.
50.13: I don't eat the meat of bulls or drink the blood of goats.
50.14: I am God Most High! The only sacrifice I want is for you to be thankful and to keep your word.
50.15: Pray to me in time of trouble. I will rescue you, and you will honor me.
50.16: But to the wicked I say: "You don't have the right to mention my laws or claim to keep our agreement!
50.17: You refused correction and rejected my commands.
50.18: You made friends with every crook you met, and you liked people who break their wedding vows.
50.19: You talked only about violence and told nothing but lies;
50.20: you sat around gossiping, ruining the reputation of your own relatives."
50.21: When you did all of this, I didn't say a word, and you thought, "God is just like us!" But now I will accuse you.
50.22: You have ignored me! So pay close attention or I will tear you apart, and no one can help you.
50.23: The sacrifice that honors me is a thankful heart. Obey me, and I, your God, will show my power to save.

51.1: You are kind, God! Please have pity on me. You are always merciful! Please wipe away my sins.
51.2: Wash me clean from all of my sin and guilt.
51.3: I know about my sins, and I cannot forget my terrible guilt.
51.4: You are really the one I have sinned against; I have disobeyed you and have done wrong. So it is right and fair for you to correct and punish me.
51.5: I have sinned and done wrong since the day I was born.
51.6: But you want complete honesty, so teach me true wisdom.
51.7: Wash me with hyssop until I am clean and whiter than snow.
51.8: Let me be happy and joyful! You crushed my bones, now let them celebrate.
51.9: Turn your eyes from my sin and cover my guilt.
51.10: Create pure thoughts in me and make me faithful again.
51.11: Don't chase me away from you or take your Holy Spirit away from me.
51.12: Make me as happy as you did when you saved me; make me want to obey!
51.13: I will teach sinners your Law, and they will return to you.
51.14: Keep me from any deadly sin. Only you can save me! Then I will shout and sing about your power to save.
51.15: Help me to speak, and I will praise you, Lord.
51.16: Offerings and sacrifices are not what you want.
51.17: The way to please you is to feel sorrow deep in our hearts. This is the kind of sacrifice you won't refuse.
51.18: Please be willing, Lord, to help the city of Zion and to rebuild its walls.
51.19: Then you will be pleased with the proper sacrifices, and we will offer bulls on your altar once again.

52.1: You people may be strong and brag about your sins, but God can be trusted day after day.
52.2: You plan brutal crimes, and your lying words cut like a sharp razor.
52.3: You would rather do evil than good, and tell lies than speak the truth.
52.4: You love to say cruel things, and your words are a trap.
52.5: God will destroy you forever! He will grab you and drag you from your homes. You will be uprooted and left to die.
52.6: When good people see this fearsome sight, they will laugh and say,
52.7: "Just look at them now! Instead of trusting God, they trusted their wealth and their cruelty."
52.8: But I am like an olive tree growing in God's house, and I can count on his love forever and ever.
52.9: I will always thank God for what he has done; I will praise his good name when his people meet.

53.1: Only a fool would say, "There is no God!" People like that are worthless! They are heartless and cruel and never do right.
53.2: From heaven God looks down to see if anyone is wise enough to search for him.
53.3: But all of them are crooked and corrupt. Not one of them does right.
53.4: Won't you lawbreakers learn? You refuse to pray, and you gobble down the people of God.
53.5: But you will be terrified worse than ever before. God will scatter the bones of his enemies, and you will be ashamed when God rejects you.
53.6: I long for someone from Zion to come and save Israel! Our God, when you bless your people again, Jacob's family will be glad, and Israel will celebrate.

54.1: Save me, God, by your power and prove that I am right.
54.2: Listen to my prayer and hear what I say.
54.3: Cruel strangers have attacked and want me dead. Not one of them cares about you.
54.4: You will help me, Lord God, and keep me from falling;
54.5: you will punish my enemies for their evil deeds. Be my faithful friend and destroy them.
54.6: I will bring a gift and offer a sacrifice to you, LORD. I will praise your name because you are good.
54.7: You have rescued me from all of my troubles, and my own eyes have seen my enemies fall.

55.1: Listen, God, to my prayer! Don't reject my request.
55.2: Please listen and help me. My thoughts are troubled, and I keep groaning
55.3: because my loud enemies shout and attack. They treat me terribly and hold angry grudges.
55.4: My heart is racing fast, and I am afraid of dying.
55.5: I am trembling with fear, completely terrified.
55.6: I wish I had wings like a dove, so I could fly far away and be at peace.
55.7: I would go and live in some distant desert.
55.8: I would quickly find shelter from howling winds and raging storms.
55.9: Confuse my enemies, Lord! Upset their plans. Cruelty and violence are all I see in the city,
55.10: and they are like guards on patrol day and night. The city is full of trouble, evil,
55.11: and corruption. Troublemakers and liars freely roam the streets.
55.12: My enemies are not the ones who sneer and make fun. I could put up with that or even hide from them.
55.13: But it was my closest friend, the one I trusted most.
55.14: We enjoyed being together, and we went with others to your house, our God.
55.15: All who hate me are controlled by the power of evil. Sentence them to death and send them down alive to the world of the dead.
55.16: I ask for your help, LORD God, and you will keep me safe.
55.17: Morning, noon, and night you hear my concerns and my complaints.
55.18: I am attacked from all sides, but you will rescue me unharmed by the battle.
55.19: You have always ruled, and you will hear me. You will defeat my enemies because they won't turn and worship you.
55.20: My friend turned against me and broke his promise.
55.21: His words were smoother than butter, and softer than olive oil. But hatred filled his heart, and he was ready to attack with a sword.
55.22: Our LORD, we belong to you. We tell you what worries us, and you won't let us fall.
55.23: But what about those people who are cruel and brutal? You will throw them down into the deepest pit long before their time. I trust you, LORD!

56.1: Have pity, God Most High! My enemies chase me all day.
56.2: Many of them are pursuing and attacking me,
56.3: but even when I am afraid, I keep on trusting you.
56.4: I praise your promises! I trust you and am not afraid. No one can harm me.
56.5: Enemies spend the whole day finding fault with me; all they think about is how to do me harm.
56.6: They attack from ambush, watching my every step and hoping to kill me.
56.7: They won't get away with these crimes, God, because when you get angry, you destroy people.
56.8: You have kept record of my days of wandering. You have stored my tears in your bottle and counted each of them.
56.9: When I pray, LORD God, my enemies will retreat, because I know for certain that you are with me.
56.11: I trust you and am not afraid. No one can harm me.
56.12: I will keep my promises to you, my God, and bring you gifts.
56.13: You protected me from death and kept me from stumbling, so that I would please you and follow the light that leads to life.

57.1: God Most High, have pity on me! Have mercy. I run to you for safety. In the shadow of your wings, I seek protection till danger dies down.
57.2: I pray to you, my protector.
57.3: You will send help from heaven and save me, but you will bring trouble on my attackers. You are faithful, and you can be trusted.
57.4: I live among lions, who gobble down people! They have spears and arrows instead of teeth, and they have sharp swords instead of tongues.
57.5: May you, my God, be honored above the heavens; may your glory be seen everywhere on earth.
57.6: Enemies set traps for my feet and struck me down. They dug a pit in my path, but fell in it themselves.
57.7: I am faithful to you, and you can trust me. I will sing and play music for you, my God.
57.8: I feel wide awake! I will wake up my harp and wake up the sun.
57.9: I will praise you, Lord, for everyone to hear, and I will sing hymns to you in every nation.
57.10: Your love reaches higher than the heavens; your loyalty extends beyond the clouds.
57.11: May you, my God, be honored above the heavens; may your glory be seen everywhere on earth.

58.1: Do you mighty people talk only to oppose justice? Don't you ever judge fairly?
58.2: You are always planning evil, and you are brutal.
58.3: You have done wrong and lied from the day you were born.
58.4: Your words spread poison like the bite of a cobra
58.5: that refuses to listen to the snake charmer.
58.6: My enemies are fierce as lions, LORD God! Shatter their teeth. Snatch out their fangs.
58.7: Make them disappear like leaking water, and make their arrows miss.
58.8: Let them dry up like snails or be like a child that dies before seeing the sun.
58.9: Wipe them out quicker than a pot can be heated by setting thorns on fire.
58.10: Good people will be glad when they see the wicked getting what they deserve, and they will wash their feet in their enemies' blood.
58.11: Everyone will say, "It's true! Good people are rewarded. God does rule the earth with justice."

59.1: Save me, God! Protect me from enemy attacks!
59.2: Keep me safe from brutal people who want to kill me.
59.3: Merciless enemies, LORD, are hiding and plotting, hoping to kill me. I have not hurt them in any way at all.
59.4: But they are ready to attack. Do something! Help me! Look at what's happening.
59.5: LORD God All-Powerful, you are the God of Israel. Punish the other nations and don't pity those terrible and rebellious people.
59.6: My enemies return at evening, growling like dogs roaming the city.
59.7: They curse and their words cut like swords, as they say to themselves, "No one can hear us!"
59.8: You, LORD, laugh at them and sneer at the nations.
59.9: You are my mighty fortress, and I depend on you.
59.10: You love me and will let me see my enemies defeated.
59.11: Don't kill them, or everyone may forget! Just use your mighty power to make them tremble and fall. You are a shield for your people.
59.12: My enemies are liars! So let them be trapped by their boastful lies.
59.13: Get angry and destroy them. Leave them in ruin. Then all the nations will know that you rule in Israel.
59.14: Those liars return at evening, growling like dogs roaming the city.
59.15: They search for scraps of food, and they snarl until they are stuffed.
59.16: But I will sing about your strength, my God, and I will celebrate because of your love. You are my fortress, my place of protection in times of trouble.
59.17: I will sing your praises! You are my mighty fortress, and you love me.

60.1: You, God, are angry with us! We are rejected and crushed. Make us strong again!
60.2: You made the earth shake and split wide open; now heal its wounds and stop its trembling.
60.3: You brought hard times on your people, and you gave us wine that made us stagger.
60.4: You gave a signal to those who worship you, so they could escape from enemy arrows.
60.5: Answer our prayers! Use your powerful arm and give us victory. Then the people you love will be safe.
60.6: Our God, you solemnly promised, "I would gladly divide up the city of Shechem and give away Succoth Valley piece by piece.
60.7: The lands of Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is my war helmet, and Judah is the symbol of my royal power.
60.8: Moab is merely my washbasin. Edom belongs to me, and I shout in triumph over the Philistines."
60.9: Our God, who will bring me to the fortress, or lead me to Edom?
60.10: Have you rejected us and deserted our armies?
60.11: Help us defeat our enemies! No one else can rescue us.
60.12: You will give us victory and crush our enemies.

61.1: Please listen, God, and answer my prayer!
61.2: I feel hopeless, and I cry out to you from a faraway land. Lead me to the mighty rock high above me.
61.3: You are a strong tower, where I am safe from my enemies.
61.4: Let me live with you forever and find protection under your wings, my God.
61.5: You heard my promises, and you have blessed me, just as you bless everyone who worships you.
61.6: Let the king have a long and healthy life.
61.7: May he always rule with you, God, at his side; may your love and loyalty watch over him.
61.8: I will sing your praises forever and will always keep my promises.

62.1: Only God can save me, and I calmly wait for him.
62.2: God alone is the mighty rock that keeps me safe and the fortress where I am secure.
62.3: I feel like a shaky fence or a sagging wall. How long will all of you attack and assault me?
62.4: You want to bring me down from my place of honor. You love to tell lies, and when your words are kind, hatred hides in your heart.
62.5: Only God gives inward peace, and I depend on him.
62.6: God alone is the mighty rock that keeps me safe, and he is the fortress where I feel secure.
62.7: God saves me and honors me. He is that mighty rock where I find safety.
62.8: Trust God, my friends, and always tell him each one of your concerns. God is our place of safety.
62.9: We humans are only a breath; none of us are truly great. All of us together weigh less than a puff of air.
62.10: Don't trust in violence or depend on dishonesty or rely on great wealth.
62.11: I heard God say two things: "I am powerful,
62.12: and I am very kind." The Lord rewards each of us according to what we do.

63.1: You are my God. I worship you. In my heart, I long for you, as I would long for a stream in a scorching desert.
63.2: I have seen your power and your glory in the place of worship.
63.3: Your love means more than life to me, and I praise you.
63.4: As long as I live, I will pray to you.
63.5: I will sing joyful praises and be filled with excitement like a guest at a banquet.
63.6: I think about you before I go to sleep, and my thoughts turn to you during the night.
63.7: You have helped me, and I sing happy songs in the shadow of your wings.
63.8: I stay close to you, and your powerful arm supports me.
63.9: All who want to kill me will end up in the ground.
63.10: Swords will run them through, and wild dogs will eat them.
63.11: Because of you, our God, the king will celebrate with your faithful followers, but liars will be silent.

64.1: Listen to my concerns, God, and protect me from my terrible enemies.
64.2: Keep me safe from secret plots of corrupt and evil gangs.
64.3: Their words cut like swords, and their cruel remarks sting like sharp arrows.
64.4: They fearlessly ambush and shoot innocent people.
64.5: They are determined to do evil, and they tell themselves, "Let's set traps! No one can see us."
64.6: They make evil plans and say, "We'll commit a perfect crime. No one knows our thoughts."
64.7: But God will shoot his arrows and quickly wound them.
64.8: They will be destroyed by their own words, and everyone who sees them will tremble with fear.
64.9: They will be afraid and say, "Look at what God has done and keep it all in mind."
64.10: May the LORD bless his people with peace and happiness and let them celebrate.

65.1: Our God, you deserve praise in Zion, where we keep our promises to you.
65.2: Everyone will come to you because you answer prayer.
65.3: Our terrible sins get us down, but you forgive us.
65.4: You bless your chosen ones, and you invite them to live near you in your temple. We will enjoy your house, the sacred temple.
65.5: Our God, you save us, and your fearsome deeds answer our prayers for justice! You give hope to people everywhere on earth, even those across the sea.
65.6: You are strong, and your mighty power put the mountains in place.
65.7: You silence the roaring waves and the noisy shouts of the nations.
65.8: People far away marvel at your fearsome deeds, and all who live under the sun celebrate and sing because of you.
65.9: You take care of the earth and send rain to help the soil grow all kinds of crops. Your rivers never run dry, and you prepare the earth to produce much grain.
65.10: You water all of its fields and level the lumpy ground. You send showers of rain to soften the soil and help the plants sprout.
65.11: Wherever your footsteps touch the earth, a rich harvest is gathered.
65.12: Desert pastures blossom, and mountains celebrate.
65.13: Meadows are filled with sheep and goats; valleys overflow with grain and echo with joyful songs.

66.1: Tell everyone on this earth to shout praises to God!
66.2: Sing about his glorious name. Honor him with praises.
66.3: Say to God, "Everything you do is fearsome, and your mighty power makes your enemies come crawling.
66.4: You are worshiped by everyone! We all sing praises to you."
66.5: Come and see the fearsome things our God has done!
66.6: When God made the sea dry up, our people walked across, and because of him, we celebrated there.
66.7: His mighty power rules forever, and nothing the nations do can be hidden from him. So don't turn against God.
66.8: All of you people, come praise our God! Let his praises be heard.
66.9: God protects us from death and keeps us steady.
66.10: Our God, you tested us, just as silver is tested.
66.11: You trapped us in a net and gave us heavy burdens.
66.12: You sent war chariots to crush our skulls. We traveled through fire and through floods, but you brought us to a land of plenty.
66.13: I will bring sacrifices into your house, my God, and I will do what I promised
66.15: I will sacrifice my best sheep and offer bulls and goats on your altar.
66.16: All who worship God, come here and listen; I will tell you everything God has done for me.
66.17: I prayed to the Lord, and I praised him.
66.18: If my thoughts had been sinful, he would have refused to hear me.
66.19: But God did listen and answered my prayer.
66.20: Let's praise God! He listened when I prayed, and he is always kind.

67.1: Our God, be kind and bless us! Be pleased and smile.
67.2: Then everyone on earth will learn to follow you, and all nations will see your power to save us.
67.3: Make everyone praise you and shout your praises.
67.4: Let the nations celebrate with joyful songs, because you judge fairly and guide all nations.
67.5: Make everyone praise you and shout your praises.
67.6: Our God has blessed the earth with a wonderful harvest!
67.7: Pray for his blessings to continue and for everyone on earth to worship our God.

68.1: Do something, God! Scatter your hateful enemies. Make them turn and run.
68.2: Scatter them like smoke! When you come near, make them melt like wax in a fire.
68.3: But let your people be happy and celebrate because of you.
68.4: Our God, you are the one who rides on the clouds, and we praise you. Your name is the LORD, and we celebrate as we worship you.
68.5: Our God, from your sacred home you take care of orphans and protect widows.
68.6: You find families for those who are lonely. You set prisoners free and let them prosper, but all who rebel will live in a scorching desert.
68.7: You set your people free, and you led them through the desert.
68.8: God of Israel, the earth trembled, and rain poured down. You alone are the God who rules from Mount Sinai.
68.9: When your land was thirsty, you sent showers to refresh it.
68.10: Your people settled there, and you were generous to everyone in need.
68.11: You gave the command, and a chorus of women told what had happened:
68.12: "Kings and their armies retreated and ran, and everything they left is now being divided.
68.13: And for those who stayed back to guard the sheep, there are metal doves with silver-coated wings and shiny gold feathers."
68.14: God All-Powerful, you scattered the kings like snow falling on Mount Zalmon.
68.15: Our LORD and our God, Bashan is a mighty mountain covered with peaks.
68.16: Why is it jealous of Zion, the mountain you chose as your home forever?
68.17: When you, LORD God, appeared to your people at Sinai, you came with thousands of mighty chariots.
68.18: When you climbed the high mountain, you took prisoners with you and were given gifts. Your enemies didn't want you to live there, but they gave you gifts.
68.19: We praise you, Lord God! You treat us with kindness day after day, and you rescue us.
68.20: You always protect us and save us from death.
68.21: Our Lord and our God, your terrible enemies are ready for war, but you will crush their skulls.
68.22: You promised to bring them from Bashan and from the deepest sea.
68.23: Then we could stomp on their blood, and our dogs could chew on their bones.
68.24: We have seen crowds marching to your place of worship, our God and King.
68.25: The singers come first, and then the musicians, surrounded by young women playing tambourines.
68.26: They come shouting, "People of Israel, praise the LORD God!"
68.27: The small tribe of Benjamin leads the way, followed by the leaders from Judah. Then come the leaders from Zebulun and Naphtali.
68.28: Our God, show your strength! Show us once again.
68.29: Then kings will bring gifts to your temple in Jerusalem.
68.30: Punish that animal that lives in the swamp! Punish that nation whose leaders and people are like wild bulls. Make them come crawling with gifts of silver. Scatter those nations that enjoy making war.
68.31: Force the Egyptians to bring gifts of bronze; make the Ethiopians hurry to offer presents.
68.32: Now sing praises to God! Every kingdom on earth, sing to the Lord!
68.33: Praise the one who rides across the ancient skies; listen as he speaks with a mighty voice.
68.34: Tell about God's power! He is honored in Israel, and he rules the skies.
68.35: The God of Israel is fearsome in his temple, and he makes us strong. Let's praise our God!

69.1: Save me, God! I am about to drown.
69.2: I am sinking deep in the mud, and my feet are slipping. I am about to be swept under by a mighty flood.
69.3: I am worn out from crying, and my throat is dry. I have waited for you till my eyes are blurred.
69.4: There are more people who hate me for no reason than there are hairs on my head. Many terrible enemies want to destroy me, God. Am I supposed to give back something I didn't steal?
69.5: You know my foolish sins. Not one is hidden from you.
69.6: LORD God All-Powerful, ruler of Israel, don't let me embarrass anyone who trusts and worships you.
69.7: It is for your sake alone that I am insulted and blush with shame.
69.8: I am like a stranger to my relatives and like a foreigner to my own family.
69.9: My love for your house burns in me like a fire, and when others insulted you, they insulted me as well.
69.10: I cried and went without food, but they still insulted me.
69.11: They sneered at me for wearing sackcloth to show my sorrow.
69.12: Rulers and judges gossip about me, and drunkards make up songs to mock me.
69.13: But I pray to you, LORD. So when the time is right, answer me and help me with your wonderful love.
69.14: Don't let me sink in the mud, but save me from my enemies and from the deep water.
69.15: Don't let me be swept away by a flood or drowned in the ocean or swallowed by death.
69.16: Answer me, LORD! You are kind and good. Pay attention to me! You are truly merciful.
69.17: Don't turn away from me. I am your servant, and I am in trouble. Please hurry and help!
69.18: Come and save me from my enemies.
69.19: You know how I am insulted, mocked, and disgraced; you know every one of my enemies.
69.20: I am crushed by insults, and I feel sick. I had hoped for mercy and pity, but there was none.
69.21: Enemies poisoned my food, and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar.
69.22: Make their table a trap for them and their friends.
69.23: Blind them with darkness and make them tremble.
69.24: Show them how angry you are! Be furious and catch them.
69.25: Destroy their camp and don't let anyone live in their tents.
69.26: They cause trouble for people you have already punished; their gossip hurts those you have wounded.
69.27: Make them guiltier than ever and don't forgive them.
69.28: Wipe their names from the book of the living; remove them from the list of the innocent.
69.29: I am mistreated and in pain. Protect me, God, and keep me safe!
69.30: I will praise the LORD God with a song and a thankful heart.
69.31: This will please the LORD better than offering an ox or a full-grown bull.
69.32: When those in need see this, they will be happy, and the LORD's worshipers will be encouraged.
69.33: The LORD will listen when the homeless cry out, and he will never forget his people in prison.
69.34: Heaven and earth will praise our God, and so will the oceans and everything in them.
69.35: God will rescue Jerusalem, and he will rebuild the towns of Judah. His people will live there on their own land,
69.36: and when the time comes, their children will inherit the land. Then everyone who loves God will also settle there.

70.1: Save me, LORD God! Hurry and help.
70.2: Disappoint and confuse all who want to kill me. Turn away and disgrace all who want to hurt me.
70.3: Embarrass and shame those who say, "We told you so!"
70.4: Let your worshipers celebrate and be glad because of you. They love your saving power, so let them always say, "God is wonderful!"
70.5: I am poor and needy, but you, the LORD God, care about me. You are the one who saves me. Please hurry and help!

71.1: I run to you, LORD, for protection. Don't disappoint me.
71.2: You do what is right, so come to my rescue. Listen to my prayer and keep me safe.
71.3: Be my mighty rock, the place where I can always run for protection. Save me by your command! You are my mighty rock and my fortress.
71.4: Come and save me, LORD God, from vicious and cruel and brutal enemies!
71.5: I depend on you, and I have trusted you since I was young.
71.6: I have relied on you from the day I was born. You brought me safely through birth, and I always praise you.
71.7: Many people think of me as something evil. But you are my mighty protector,
71.8: and I praise and honor you all day long.
71.9: Don't throw me aside when I am old; don't desert me when my strength is gone.
71.10: My enemies are plotting because they want me dead.
71.11: They say, "Now we'll catch you! God has deserted you, and no one can save you."
71.12: Come closer, God! Please hurry and help.
71.13: Embarrass and destroy all who want me dead; disgrace and confuse all who want to hurt me.
71.14: I will never give up hope or stop praising you.
71.15: All day long I will tell the wonderful things you do to save your people. But you have done much more than I could possibly know.
71.16: I will praise you, LORD God, for your mighty deeds and your power to save.
71.17: You have taught me since I was a child, and I never stop telling about your marvelous deeds.
71.18: Don't leave me when I am old and my hair turns gray. Let me tell future generations about your mighty power.
71.19: Your deeds of kindness are known in the heavens. No one is like you!
71.20: You made me suffer a lot, but you will bring me back from this deep pit and give me new life.
71.21: You will make me truly great and take my sorrow away.
71.22: I will praise you, God, the Holy One of Israel. You are faithful. I will play the harp and sing your praises.
71.23: You have rescued me! I will celebrate and shout, singing praises to you with all my heart.
71.24: All day long I will announce your power to save. I will tell how you disgraced and disappointed those who wanted to hurt me.

72.1: Please help the king to be honest and fair just like you, our God.
72.2: Let him be honest and fair with all your people, especially the poor.
72.3: Let peace and justice rule every mountain and hill.
72.4: Let the king defend the poor, rescue the homeless, and crush everyone who hurts them.
72.5: Let the king live forever like the sun and the moon.
72.6: Let him be as helpful as rain that refreshes the meadows and the ground.
72.7: Let the king be fair with everyone, and let there be peace until the moon falls from the sky.
72.8: Let his kingdom reach from sea to sea, from the Euphrates River across all the earth.
72.9: Force the desert tribes to accept his rule, and make his enemies crawl in the dirt.
72.10: Force the rulers of Tarshish and of the islands to pay taxes to him. Make the kings of Sheba and of Seba bring gifts.
72.11: Make other rulers bow down and all nations serve him.
72.12: Do this because the king rescues the homeless when they cry out, and he helps everyone who is poor and in need.
72.13: The king has pity on the weak and the helpless and protects those in need.
72.14: He cares when they hurt, and he saves them from cruel and violent deaths.
72.15: Long live the king! Give him gold from Sheba. Always pray for the king and praise him each day.
72.16: Let cities overflow with food and hills be covered with grain, just like Mount Lebanon. Let the people in the cities prosper like wild flowers.
72.17: May the glory of the king shine brightly forever like the sun in the sky. Let him make nations prosper and learn to praise him.
72.18: LORD God of Israel, we praise you. Only you can work miracles.
72.19: We will always praise your glorious name. Let your glory be seen everywhere on earth. Amen and amen.
72.20: This ends the prayers of David, the son of Jesse.

73.1: God is truly good to Israel, especially to everyone with a pure heart.
73.2: But I almost stumbled and fell,
73.3: because it made me jealous to see proud and evil people and to watch them prosper.
73.4: They never have to suffer, they stay healthy,
73.5: and they don't have troubles like everyone else.
73.6: Their pride is like a necklace, and they commit sin more often than they dress themselves.
73.7: Their eyes poke out with fat, and their minds are flooded with foolish thoughts.
73.8: They sneer and say cruel things, and because of their pride, they make violent threats.
73.9: They dare to speak against God and to order others around.
73.10: God will bring his people back, and they will drink the water he so freely gives.
73.11: Only evil people would say, "God Most High cannot know everything!"
73.12: Yet all goes well for them, and they live in peace.
73.13: What good did it do me to keep my thoughts pure and refuse to do wrong?
73.14: I am sick all day, and I am punished each morning.
73.15: If I had said evil things, I would not have been loyal to your people.
73.16: It was hard for me to understand all this!
73.17: Then I went to your temple, and there I understood what will happen to my enemies.
73.18: You will make them stumble, never to get up again.
73.19: They will be terrified, suddenly swept away and no longer there.
73.20: They will disappear, Lord, despised like a bad dream the morning after.
73.21: Once I was bitter and brokenhearted.
73.22: I was stupid and ignorant, and I treated you as a wild animal would.
73.23: But I never really left you, and you hold my right hand.
73.24: Your advice has been my guide, and later you will welcome me in glory.
73.25: In heaven I have only you, and on this earth you are all I want.
73.26: My body and mind may fail, but you are my strength and my choice forever.
73.27: Powerful LORD God, all who stay far from you will be lost, and you will destroy those who are unfaithful.
73.28: It is good for me to be near you. I choose you as my protector, and I will tell about your wonderful deeds.

74.1: Our God, why have you completely rejected us? Why are you so angry with the ones you care for?
74.2: Remember the people you rescued long ago, the tribe you chose to be your very own. Think of Mount Zion, your home;
74.3: walk over to the temple left in ruins forever by those who hate us.
74.4: Your enemies roared like lions in your holy temple, and they have placed their banners there.
74.5: It looks like a forest chopped to pieces.
74.6: They used axes and hatchets to smash the carvings.
74.7: They burned down your temple and badly disgraced it.
74.8: They said to themselves, "We'll crush them!" Then they burned every one of your meeting places all over the country.
74.9: There are no more miracles and no more prophets. Who knows how long it will be like this?
74.10: Our God, how much longer will our enemies sneer? Won't they ever stop insulting you?
74.11: Why don't you punish them? Why are you holding back?
74.12: Our God and King, you have ruled since ancient times; you have won victories everywhere on this earth.
74.13: By your power you made a path through the sea, and you smashed the heads of sea monsters.
74.14: You crushed the heads of the monster Leviathan, then fed him to wild creatures in the desert.
74.15: You opened the ground for streams and springs and dried up mighty rivers.
74.16: You rule the day and the night, and you put the moon and the sun in place.
74.17: You made summer and winter and gave them to the earth.
74.18: Remember your enemies, LORD! They foolishly sneer and won't respect you.
74.19: You treat us like pet doves, but they mistreat us. Don't keep forgetting us and letting us be fed to those wild animals.
74.20: Remember the agreement you made with us. Violent enemies are hiding in every dark corner of the earth.
74.21: Don't disappoint those in need or make them turn from you, but help the poor and homeless to shout your praises.
74.22: Do something, God! Defend yourself. Remember how those fools sneer at you all day long.
74.23: Don't forget the loud shouts of your enemies.

75.1: Our God, we thank you for being so near to us! Everyone celebrates your wonderful deeds.
75.2: You have set a time to judge with fairness.
75.3: The earth trembles, and its people shake; you alone keep its foundations firm.
75.4: You tell every bragger, "Stop bragging!" And to the wicked you say, "Don't boast of your power!
75.5: Stop bragging! Quit telling me how great you are."
75.6: Our LORD and our God, victory doesn't come from the east or the west or from the desert.
75.7: You are the one who judges. You can take away power and give it to others.
75.8: You hold in your hand a cup filled with wine, strong and foaming. You will pour out some for every sinful person on this earth, and they will have to drink until it is gone.
75.9: But I will always tell about you, the God of Jacob, and I will sing your praise.
75.10: Our Lord, you will destroy the power of evil people, but you will give strength to those who are good.

76.1: You, our God, are famous in Judah and honored in Israel.
76.2: Your home is on Mount Zion in the city of peace.
76.3: There you destroyed fiery arrows, shields, swords, and all the other weapons.
76.4: You are more glorious than the eternal mountains.
76.5: Brave warriors were robbed of what they had taken, and now they lie dead, unable to lift an arm.
76.6: God of Jacob, when you roar, enemy chariots and horses drop dead in their tracks.
76.7: Our God, you are fearsome, and no one can oppose you when you are angry.
76.8: From heaven you announced your decisions as judge! And all who live on this earth were terrified and silent
76.9: when you took over as judge, ready to rescue everyone in need.
76.10: Even the most angry people will praise you when you are furious.
76.11: Everyone, make your promises to the LORD your God and do what you promise. The LORD is fearsome, and all of his servants should bring him gifts.
76.12: God destroys the courage of rulers and kings and makes cowards of them.

77.1: I pray to you, Lord God, and I beg you to listen.
77.2: In days filled with trouble, I search for you. And at night I tirelessly lift my hands in prayer, refusing comfort.
77.3: When I think of you, I feel restless and weak.
77.4: Because of you, Lord God, I can't sleep. I am restless and can't even talk.
77.5: I think of times gone by, of those years long ago.
77.6: Each night my mind is flooded with questions:
77.7: "Have you rejected me forever? Won't you be kind again?
77.8: Is this the end of your love and your promises?
77.9: Have you forgotten how to have pity? Do you refuse to show mercy because of your anger?"
77.10: Then I said, "God Most High, what hurts me most is that you no longer help us with your mighty arm."
77.11: Our LORD, I will remember the things you have done, your miracles of long ago.
77.12: I will think about each one of your mighty deeds.
77.13: Everything you do is right, and no other god compares with you.
77.14: You alone work miracles, and you have let nations see your mighty power.
77.15: With your own arm you rescued your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph.
77.16: The ocean looked at you, God, and it trembled deep down with fear.
77.17: Water flowed from the clouds. Thunder was heard above as your arrows of lightning flashed about.
77.18: Your thunder roared like chariot wheels. The world was made bright by lightning, and all the earth trembled.
77.19: You walked through the water of the mighty sea, but your footprints were never seen.
77.20: You guided your people like a flock of sheep, and you chose Moses and Aaron to be their leaders.

78.1: My friends, I beg you to listen as I teach.
78.2: I will give instruction and explain the mystery of what happened long ago.
78.3: These are things we learned from our ancestors,
78.4: and we will tell them to the next generation. We won't keep secret the glorious deeds and the mighty miracles of the LORD.
78.5: God gave his Law to Jacob's descendants, the people of Israel. And he told our ancestors to teach their children,
78.6: so that each new generation would know his Law and tell it to the next.
78.7: Then they would trust God and obey his teachings, without forgetting anything God had done.
78.8: They would be different from their ancestors, who were stubborn, rebellious, and unfaithful to God.
78.9: The warriors from Ephraim were armed with arrows, but they ran away when the battle began.
78.10: They broke their agreement with God, and they turned their backs on his teaching.
78.11: They forgot all he had done, even the mighty miracles
78.12: he did for their ancestors near Zoan in Egypt.
78.13: God made a path in the sea and piled up the water as he led them across.
78.14: He guided them during the day with a cloud, and each night he led them with a flaming fire.
78.15: God made water flow from rocks he split open in the desert, and his people drank freely, as though from a lake.
78.16: He made streams gush out like rivers from rocks.
78.17: But in the desert, the people of God Most High kept sinning and rebelling.
78.18: They stubbornly tested God and demanded from him what they wanted to eat.
78.19: They challenged God by saying, "Can God provide food out here in the desert?
78.20: It's true God struck the rock and water gushed out like a river, but can he give his people bread and meat?"
78.21: When the LORD heard this, he was angry and furious with Jacob's descendants, the people of Israel.
78.22: They had refused to trust him, and they had doubted his saving power.
78.23: But God gave a command to the clouds, and he opened the doors in the skies.
78.24: From heaven he sent grain that they called manna.
78.25: He gave them more than enough, and each one of them ate this special food.
78.26: God's mighty power brought a strong wind from the southeast,
78.27: and it brought birds that covered the ground, like sand on the beach.
78.28: Then God made the birds fall in the camp of his people near their tents.
78.29: God gave his people all they wanted, and each of them ate until they were full.
78.30: But before they had swallowed the last bite,
78.31: God became angry and killed the strongest and best from the families of Israel.
78.32: But the rest kept on sinning and would not trust God's miracles.
78.33: So he cut their lives short and made them terrified.
78.34: After he killed some of them, the others turned to him with all their hearts.
78.35: They remembered God Most High, the mighty rock that kept them safe.
78.36: But they tried to flatter God, and they told him lies;
78.37: they were unfaithful and broke their promises.
78.38: Yet God was kind. He kept forgiving their sins and didn't destroy them. He often became angry, but never lost his temper.
78.39: God remembered that they were made of flesh and were like a wind that blows once and then dies down.
78.40: While they were in the desert, they often rebelled and made God sad.
78.41: They kept testing him and caused terrible pain for the Holy One of Israel.
78.42: They forgot about his power and how he had rescued them from their enemies.
78.43: God showed them all kinds of wonderful miracles near Zoan in Egypt.
78.44: He turned the rivers of Egypt into blood, and no one could drink from the streams.
78.45: He sent swarms of flies to pester the Egyptians, and he sent frogs to cause them trouble.
78.46: God let worms and grasshoppers eat their crops.
78.47: He destroyed their grapevines and their fig trees with hail and floods.
78.48: Then he killed their cattle with hail and their other animals with lightning.
78.49: God was so angry and furious that he went into a rage and caused them great trouble by sending swarms of destroying angels.
78.50: God gave in to his anger and slaughtered them in a terrible way.
78.51: He killed the first-born son of each Egyptian family.
78.52: Then God led his people out of Egypt and guided them in the desert like a flock of sheep.
78.53: He led them safely along, and they were not afraid, but their enemies drowned in the sea.
78.54: God brought his people to the sacred mountain that he had taken by his own power.
78.55: He made nations run from the tribes of Israel, and he let the tribes take over their land.
78.56: But the people tested God Most High, and they refused to obey his laws.
78.57: They were as unfaithful as their ancestors, and they were as crooked as a twisted arrow.
78.58: God demanded all their love, but they made him angry by worshiping idols.
78.59: So God became furious and completely rejected the people of Israel.
78.60: Then he deserted his home at Shiloh, where he lived here on earth.
78.61: He let enemies capture the sacred chest and let them dishonor him.
78.62: God took out his anger on his chosen ones and let them be killed by enemy swords.
78.63: Fire destroyed the young men, and the young women were left with no one to marry.
78.64: Priests died violent deaths, but their widows were not allowed to mourn.
78.65: Finally the Lord woke up, and he shouted like a drunken soldier.
78.66: God scattered his enemies and made them ashamed forever.
78.67: Then the Lord decided not to make his home with Joseph's descendants in Ephraim.
78.68: Instead he chose the tribe of Judah, and he chose Mount Zion, the place he loves.
78.69: There he built his temple as lofty as the mountains and as solid as the earth that he had made to last forever.
78.70: The Lord God chose David to be his servant and took him from tending sheep
78.71: and from caring for lambs. Then God made him the leader of Israel, his own nation.
78.72: David treated the people fairly and guided them with wisdom.

79.1: Our God, foreign nations have taken your land, disgraced your temple, and left Jerusalem in ruins.
79.2: They have fed the bodies of your servants to flesh-eating birds; your loyal people are food for savage animals.
79.3: All Jerusalem is covered with their blood, and there is no one left to bury them.
79.4: Every nation around us sneers and makes fun.
79.5: Our LORD, will you keep on being angry? Will your angry feelings keep flaming up like fire?
79.6: Get angry with those nations that don't know you and won't worship you!
79.7: They have gobbled down Jacob's descendants and left the land in ruins.
79.8: Don't make us pay for the sins of our ancestors. Have pity and come quickly! We are completely helpless.
79.9: Our God, you keep us safe. Now help us! Rescue us. Forgive our sins and bring honor to yourself.
79.10: Why should nations ask us, "Where is your God?" Let us and the other nations see you take revenge for your servants who died a violent death.
79.11: Listen to the prisoners groan! Let your mighty power save all who are sentenced to die.
79.12: Each of those nations sneered at you, our Lord. Now let others sneer at them, seven times as much.
79.13: Then we, your people, will always thank you. We are like sheep with you as our shepherd, and all generations will hear us praise you.

80.1: Shepherd of Israel, you lead the descendants of Joseph, and you sit on your throne above the winged creatures. Listen to our prayer and let your light shine
80.2: for the tribes of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh. Save us by your power.
80.3: Our God, make us strong again! Smile on us and save us.
80.4: LORD God All-Powerful, how much longer will the prayers of your people make you angry?
80.5: You gave us tears for food, and you made us drink them by the bowlful.
80.6: Because of you, our enemies who live nearby laugh and joke about us.
80.7: But if you smile on us, we will be saved.
80.8: We were like a grapevine you brought out of Egypt. You chased other nations away and planted us here.
80.9: Then you cleared the ground, and we put our roots deep, spreading over the land.
80.10: Shade from this vine covered the mountains. Its branches climbed the mighty cedars
80.11: and stretched to the sea; its new growth reached to the river.
80.12: Our Lord, why have you torn down the wall from around the vineyard? You let everyone who walks by pick the grapes.
80.13: Now the vine is gobbled down by pigs from the forest and other wild animals.
80.14: God All-Powerful, please do something! Look down from heaven and see what's happening to this vine.
80.15: With your own hands you planted its roots, and you raised it as your very own.
80.16: Enemies chopped the vine down and set it on fire. Now show your anger and destroy them.
80.17: But help the one who sits at your right side, the one you raised to be your own.
80.18: Then we will never turn away. Put new life into us, and we will worship you.
80.19: LORD God All-Powerful, make us strong again! Smile on us and save us.

81.1: Be happy and shout to God who makes us strong! Shout praises to the God of Jacob.
81.2: Sing as you play tambourines and the lovely sounding stringed instruments.
81.3: Sound the trumpets and start the New Moon Festival. We must also celebrate when the moon is full.
81.4: This is the law in Israel, and it was given to us by the God of Jacob.
81.5: The descendants of Joseph were told to obey it, when God led them out from the land of Egypt. In a language unknown to me, I heard someone say:
81.6: "I lifted the burden from your shoulder and took the heavy basket from your hands.
81.7: When you were in trouble, I rescued you, and from the thunderclouds, I answered your prayers. Later I tested you at Meribah Spring.
81.8: "Listen, my people, while I, the Lord, correct you! Israel, if you would only pay attention to me!
81.9: Don't worship foreign gods or bow down to gods you know nothing about.
81.10: I am the LORD your God. I rescued you from Egypt. Just ask, and I will give you whatever you need.
81.11: "But, my people, Israel, you refused to listen, and you would have nothing to do with me!
81.12: So I let you be stubborn and keep on following your own advice.
81.13: "My people, Israel, if only you would listen and do as I say!
81.14: I, the LORD, would quickly defeat your enemies with my mighty power.
81.15: Everyone who hates me would come crawling, and that would be the end of them.
81.16: But I would feed you with the finest bread and with the best honey until you were full."

82.1: When all of the other gods have come together, the Lord God judges them and says:
82.2: "How long will you keep judging unfairly and favoring evil people?
82.3: Be fair to the poor and to orphans. Defend the helpless and everyone in need.
82.4: Rescue the weak and homeless from the powerful hands of heartless people.
82.5: "None of you know or understand a thing. You live in darkness, while the foundations of the earth tremble.
82.6: "I, the Most High God, say that all of you are gods and also my own children.
82.7: But you will die, just like everyone else, including powerful rulers."
82.8: Do something, God! Judge the nations of the earth; they belong to you.

83.1: Our God, don't just sit there, silently doing nothing!
83.2: Your hateful enemies are turning against you and rebelling.
83.3: They are sly, and they plot against those you treasure.
83.4: They say, "Let's wipe out the nation of Israel and make sure that no one remembers its name!"
