83.5: All of them fully agree in their plans against you, and among them are
83.6: Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab and the Hagrites;
83.7: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia and Phoenicia.
83.8: Even Assyria has joined forces with Moab and Ammon.
83.9: Our Lord, punish all of them as you punished Midian. Destroy them, as you destroyed Sisera and Jabin at Kishon Creek
83.10: near Endor, and let their bodies rot.
83.11: Treat their leaders as you did Oreb and Zeeb, Zebah and Zalmunna.
83.12: All of them said, "We'll take God's valuable land!"
83.13: Our God, scatter them around like dust in a whirlwind.
83.14: Just as flames destroy forests on the mountains,
83.15: pursue and terrify them with storms of your own.
83.16: Make them blush with shame, until they turn and worship you, our LORD.
83.17: Let them be forever ashamed and confused. Let them die in disgrace.
83.18: Make them realize that you are the LORD Most High, the only ruler of earth!

84.1: LORD God All-Powerful, your temple is so lovely!
84.2: Deep in my heart I long for your temple, and with all that I am I sing joyful songs to you.
84.3: LORD God All-Powerful, my King and my God, sparrows find a home near your altars; swallows build nests there to raise their young.
84.4: You bless everyone who lives in your house, and they sing your praises.
84.5: You bless all who depend on you for their strength and all who deeply desire to visit your temple.
84.6: When they reach Dry Valley, springs start flowing, and the autumn rain fills it with pools of water.
84.7: Your people grow stronger, and you, the God of gods, will be seen in Zion.
84.8: LORD God All-Powerful, the God of Jacob, please answer my prayer!
84.9: You are the shield that protects your people, and I am your chosen one. Won't you smile on me?
84.10: One day in your temple is better than a thousand anywhere else. I would rather serve in your house, than live in the homes of the wicked.
84.11: Our LORD and our God, you are like the sun and also like a shield. You treat us with kindness and with honor, never denying any good thing to those who live right.
84.12: LORD God All-Powerful, you bless everyone who trusts you.

85.1: Our LORD, you have blessed your land and made all go well for Jacob's descendants.
85.2: You have forgiven the sin and taken away the guilt of your people.
85.3: Your fierce anger is no longer aimed at us.
85.4: Our LORD and our God, you save us! Please bring us back home and don't be angry.
85.5: Will you always be angry with us and our families?
85.6: Won't you give us fresh life and let your people be glad because of you?
85.7: Show us your love and save us!
85.8: I will listen to you, LORD God, because you promise peace to those who are faithful and no longer foolish.
85.9: You are ready to rescue everyone who worships you, so that you will live with us in all of your glory.
85.10: Love and loyalty will come together; goodness and peace will unite.
85.11: Loyalty will sprout from the ground; justice will look down from the sky above.
85.12: Our LORD, you will bless us; our land will produce wonderful crops.
85.13: Justice will march in front, making a path for you to follow.

86.1: Please listen, LORD, and answer my prayer! I am poor and helpless.
86.2: Protect me and save me because you are my God. I am your faithful servant, and I trust you.
86.3: Be kind to me! I pray to you all day.
86.4: Make my heart glad! I serve you, and my prayer is sincere.
86.5: You willingly forgive, and your love is always there for those who pray to you.
86.6: Please listen, LORD! Answer my prayer for help.
86.7: When I am in trouble, I pray, knowing you will listen.
86.8: No other gods are like you; only you work miracles.
86.9: You created each nation, and they will all bow down to worship and honor you.
86.10: You perform great wonders because you alone are God.
86.11: Teach me to follow you, and I will obey your truth. Always keep me faithful.
86.12: With all my heart I thank you. I praise you, LORD God.
86.13: Your love for me is so great that you protected me from death and the grave.
86.14: Proud and violent enemies, who don't care about you, have ganged up to attack and kill me.
86.15: But you, the Lord God, are kind and merciful. You don't easily get angry, and your love can always be trusted.
86.16: I serve you, LORD, and I am the child of one of your servants. Look on me with kindness. Make me strong and save me.
86.17: Show that you approve of me! Then my hateful enemies will feel like fools, because you have helped and comforted me.

87.1: Zion was built by the LORD on the holy mountain,
87.2: and he loves that city more than any other place in all of Israel.
87.3: Zion, you are the city of God, and wonderful things are told about you.
87.4: Egypt, Babylonia, Philistia, Phoenicia, and Ethiopia are some of those nations that know you, and their people all say, "I was born in Zion."
87.5: God Most High will strengthen the city of Zion. Then everyone will say, "We were born here too."
87.6: The LORD will make a list of his people, and all who were born here will be included.
87.7: All who sing or dance will say, "I too am from Zion."

88.1: You keep me safe, LORD God. So when I pray at night,
88.2: please listen carefully to each of my concerns.
88.3: I am deeply troubled and close to death;
88.4: I am as good as dead and completely helpless.
88.5: I am no better off than those in the grave, those you have forgotten and no longer help.
88.6: You have put me in the deepest and darkest grave;
88.7: your anger rolls over me like ocean waves.
88.8: You have made my friends turn in horror from me. I am a prisoner who cannot escape,
88.9: and I am almost blind because of my sorrow. Each day I lift my hands in prayer to you, LORD.
88.10: Do you work miracles for the dead? Do they stand up and praise you?
88.11: Are your love and loyalty announced in the world of the dead?
88.12: Do they know of your miracles or your saving power in the dark world below where all is forgotten?
88.13: Each morning I pray to you, LORD.
88.14: Why do you reject me? Why do you turn from me?
88.15: Ever since I was a child, I have been sick and close to death. You have terrified me and made me helpless.
88.16: Your anger is like a flood! And I am shattered by your furious attacks
88.17: that strike each day and from every side.
88.18: My friends and neighbors have turned against me because of you, and now darkness is my only companion.

89.1: Our LORD, I will sing of your love forever. Everyone yet to be born will hear me praise your faithfulness.
89.2: I will tell them, "God's love can always be trusted, and his faithfulness lasts as long as the heavens."
89.3: You said, "David, my servant, is my chosen one, and this is the agreement I made with him:
89.4: David, one of your descendants will always be king."
89.5: Our LORD, let the heavens now praise your miracles, and let all of your angels praise your faithfulness.
89.6: None who live in the heavens can compare with you.
89.7: You are the most fearsome of all who live in heaven; all the others fear and greatly honor you.
89.8: You are LORD God All-Powerful! No one is as loving and faithful as you are.
89.9: You rule the roaring sea and calm its waves.
89.10: You crushed the monster Rahab, and with your powerful arm you scattered your enemies.
89.11: The heavens and the earth belong to you. And so does the world with all its people because you created them
89.12: and everything else. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon gladly praise you.
89.14: Your kingdom is ruled by justice and fairness with love and faithfulness leading the way.
89.15: Our LORD, you bless those who join in the festival and walk in the brightness of your presence.
89.16: We are happy all day because of you, and your saving power brings honor to us.
89.17: Your own glorious power makes us strong, and because of your kindness, our strength increases.
89.18: Our LORD and our King, the Holy One of Israel, you are truly our shield.
89.19: In a vision, you once said to your faithful followers: "I have helped a mighty hero. I chose him from my people and made him famous.
89.20: David, my servant, is the one I chose to be king,
89.21: and I will always be there to help and strengthen him.
89.22: "No enemy will outsmart David, and he won't be defeated by any hateful people.
89.23: I will strike down and crush his troublesome enemies.
89.24: He will always be able to depend on my love, and I will make him strong with my own power.
89.25: I will let him rule the lands across the rivers and seas.
89.26: He will say to me, 'You are my Father and my God, as well as the mighty rock where I am safe.'
89.27: "I have chosen David as my first-born son, and he will be the ruler of all kings on earth.
89.28: My love for him will last, and my agreement with him will never be broken.
89.29: "One of David's descendants will always be king, and his family will rule until the sky disappears.
89.30: Suppose some of his children should reject my Law and refuse my instructions.
89.31: Or suppose they should disobey all of my teachings.
89.32: Then I will correct and punish them because of their sins.
89.33: But I will always love David and faithfully keep all of my promises to him.
89.34: "I won't break my agreement or go back on my word.
89.35: I have sworn once and for all by my own holy name, and I won't lie to David.
89.36: His family will always rule. I will let his kingdom last as long as the sun
89.37: and moon appear in the sky."
89.38: You are now angry, God, and you have turned your back on your chosen king.
89.39: You broke off your agreement with your servant, the king, and you completely destroyed his kingdom.
89.40: The walls of his city have been broken through, and every fortress now lies in ruin.
89.41: All who pass by take what they want, and nations everywhere joke about the king.
89.42: You made his enemies powerful and let them celebrate.
89.43: But you forced him to retreat because you did not fight on his side.
89.44: You took his crown and threw his throne in the dirt.
89.45: You made an old man of him and put him to shame.
89.46: How much longer, LORD? Will you hide forever? How long will your anger keep burning like fire?
89.47: Remember, life is short! Why did you empty our lives of all meaning?
89.48: No one can escape the power of death and the grave.
89.49: Our Lord, where is the love you have always shown and that you promised so faithfully to David?
89.50: Remember your servant, Lord! People make jokes about me, and I suffer many insults.
89.51: I am your chosen one, but your enemies chase and make fun of me.
89.52: Our LORD, we praise you forever. Amen and amen.

90.1: Our Lord, in all generations you have been our home.
90.2: You have always been God-- long before the birth of the mountains, even before you created the earth and the world.
90.3: At your command we die and turn back to dust,
90.4: but a thousand years mean nothing to you! They are merely a day gone by or a few hours in the night.
90.5: You bring our lives to an end just like a dream. We are merely tender grass
90.6: that sprouts and grows in the morning, but dries up by evening.
90.7: Your furious anger frightens and destroys us,
90.8: and you know all of our sins, even those we do in secret.
90.9: Your anger is a burden each day we live, then life ends like a sigh.
90.10: We can expect seventy years, or maybe eighty, if we are healthy, but even our best years bring trouble and sorrow. Suddenly our time is up, and we disappear.
90.11: No one knows the full power of your furious anger, but it is as great as the fear that we owe to you.
90.12: Teach us to use wisely all the time we have.
90.13: Help us, LORD! Don't wait! Pity your servants.
90.14: When morning comes, let your love satisfy all our needs. Then we can celebrate and be glad for what time we have left.
90.15: Make us happy for as long as you caused us trouble and sorrow.
90.16: Do wonderful things for us, your servants, and show your mighty power to our children.
90.17: Our Lord and our God, treat us with kindness and let all go well for us. Please let all go well!

91.1: Live under the protection of God Most High and stay in the shadow of God All-Powerful.
91.2: Then you will say to the LORD, "You are my fortress, my place of safety; you are my God, and I trust you."
91.3: The Lord will keep you safe from secret traps and deadly diseases.
91.4: He will spread his wings over you and keep you secure. His faithfulness is like a shield or a city wall.
91.5: You won't need to worry about dangers at night or arrows during the day.
91.6: And you won't fear diseases that strike in the dark or sudden disaster at noon.
91.7: You will not be harmed, though thousands fall all around you.
91.8: And with your own eyes you will see the punishment of the wicked.
91.9: The LORD Most High is your fortress. Run to him for safety,
91.10: and no terrible disasters will strike you or your home.
91.11: God will command his angels to protect you wherever you go.
91.12: They will carry you in their arms, and you won't hurt your feet on the stones.
91.13: You will overpower the strongest lions and the most deadly snakes.
91.14: The Lord says, "If you love me and truly know who I am, I will rescue you and keep you safe.
91.15: When you are in trouble, call out to me. I will answer and be there to protect and honor you.
91.16: You will live a long life and see my saving power."

92.1: It is wonderful to be grateful and to sing your praises, LORD Most High!
92.2: It is wonderful each morning to tell about your love and at night to announce how faithful you are.
92.3: I enjoy praising your name to the music of harps,
92.4: because everything you do makes me happy, and I sing joyful songs.
92.5: You do great things, LORD. Your thoughts are too deep
92.6: for an ignorant fool to know or understand.
92.7: Though the wicked sprout and spread like grass, they will be pulled up by their roots.
92.8: But you will rule over all of us forever,
92.9: and your hateful enemies will be scattered and then destroyed.
92.10: You have given me the strength of a wild ox, and you have chosen me to be your very own.
92.11: My eyes have seen, and my ears have heard the doom and destruction of my terrible enemies.
92.12: Good people will prosper like palm trees, and they will grow strong like the cedars of Lebanon.
92.13: They will take root in your house, LORD God, and they will do well.
92.14: They will be like trees that stay healthy and fruitful, even when they are old.
92.15: And they will say about you, "The LORD always does right! God is our mighty rock."

93.1: Our LORD, you are King! Majesty and power are your royal robes. You put the world in place, and it will never be moved.
93.2: You have always ruled, and you are eternal.
93.3: The ocean is roaring, LORD! The sea is pounding hard.
93.4: Its mighty waves are majestic, but you are more majestic, and you rule over all.
93.5: Your decisions are firm, and your temple will always be beautiful and holy.

94.1: LORD God, you punish the guilty. Show what you are like and punish them now.
94.2: You judge the earth. Come and help us! Pay back those proud people for what they have done.
94.3: How long will the wicked celebrate and be glad?
94.4: All of those cruel people strut and boast,
94.5: and they crush and wound your chosen nation, LORD.
94.6: They murder widows, foreigners, and orphans.
94.7: Then they say, "The LORD God of Jacob doesn't see or know."
94.8: Can't you fools see? Won't you ever learn?
94.9: God gave us ears and eyes! Can't he hear and see?
94.10: God instructs the nations and gives knowledge to us all. Won't he also correct us?
94.11: The LORD knows how useless our plans really are.
94.12: Our LORD, you bless everyone that you instruct and teach by using your Law.
94.13: You give them rest from their troubles, until a pit can be dug for the wicked.
94.14: You won't turn your back on your chosen nation.
94.15: Justice and fairness will go hand in hand, and all who do right will follow along.
94.16: Who will stand up for me against those cruel people?
94.17: If you had not helped me, LORD, I would soon have gone to the land of silence.
94.18: When I felt my feet slipping, you came with your love and kept me steady.
94.19: And when I was burdened with worries, you comforted me and made me feel secure.
94.20: But you are opposed to dishonest lawmakers
94.21: who gang up to murder innocent victims.
94.22: You, LORD God, are my fortress, that mighty rock where I am safe.
94.23: You will pay back my enemies, and you will wipe them out for the evil they did.

95.1: Sing joyful songs to the LORD! Praise the mighty rock where we are safe.
95.2: Come to worship him with thankful hearts and songs of praise.
95.3: The LORD is the greatest God, king over all other gods.
95.4: He holds the deepest part of the earth in his hands, and the mountain peaks belong to him.
95.5: The ocean is the Lord's because he made it, and with his own hands he formed the dry land.
95.6: Bow down and worship the LORD our Creator!
95.7: The LORD is our God, and we are his people, the sheep he takes care of in his own pasture. Listen to God's voice today!
95.8: Don't be stubborn and rebel as your ancestors did at Meribah and Massah out in the desert.
95.9: For forty years they tested God and saw the things he did.
95.10: Then God got tired of them and said, "You never show good sense, and you don't understand what I want you to do."
95.11: In his anger, God told them, "You people will never enter my place of rest."

96.1: Sing a new song to the LORD! Everyone on this earth, sing praises to the LORD,
96.2: sing and praise his name. Day after day announce, "The LORD has saved us!"
96.3: Tell every nation on earth, "The LORD is wonderful and does marvelous things!
96.4: The LORD is great and deserves our greatest praise! He is the only God worthy of our worship.
96.5: Other nations worship idols, but the LORD created the heavens.
96.6: Give honor and praise to the LORD, whose power and beauty fill his holy temple."
96.7: Tell everyone of every nation, "Praise the glorious power of the LORD.
96.8: He is wonderful! Praise him and bring an offering into his temple.
96.9: Everyone on earth, now tremble and worship the LORD, majestic and holy."
96.10: Announce to the nations, "The LORD is King! The world stands firm, never to be shaken, and he will judge its people with fairness."
96.11: Tell the heavens and the earth to be glad and celebrate! Command the ocean to roar with all of its creatures
96.12: and the fields to rejoice with all of their crops. Then every tree in the forest will sing joyful songs
96.13: to the LORD. He is coming to judge all people on earth with fairness and truth.

97.1: The LORD is King! Tell the earth to celebrate and all islands to shout.
97.2: Dark clouds surround him, and his throne is supported by justice and fairness.
97.3: Fire leaps from his throne, destroying his enemies,
97.4: and his lightning is so bright that the earth sees it and trembles.
97.5: Mountains melt away like wax in the presence of the LORD of all the earth.
97.6: The heavens announce, "The LORD brings justice!" Everyone sees God's glory.
97.7: Those who brag about the useless idols they worship are terribly ashamed, and all the false gods bow down to the LORD.
97.8: When the people of Zion and of the towns of Judah hear that God brings justice, they will celebrate.
97.9: The LORD rules the whole earth, and he is more glorious than all the false gods.
97.10: Love the LORD and hate evil! God protects his loyal people and rescues them from violence.
97.11: If you obey and do right, a light will show you the way and fill you with happiness.
97.12: You are the LORD's people! So celebrate and praise the only God.

98.1: Sing a new song to the LORD! He has worked miracles, and with his own powerful arm, he has won the victory.
98.2: The LORD has shown the nations that he has the power to save and to bring justice.
98.3: God has been faithful in his love for Israel, and his saving power is seen everywhere on earth.
98.4: Tell everyone on this earth to sing happy songs in praise of the LORD.
98.5: Make music for him on harps. Play beautiful melodies!
98.6: Sound the trumpets and horns and celebrate with joyful songs for our LORD and King!
98.7: Command the ocean to roar with all of its creatures, and the earth to shout with all of its people.
98.8: Order the rivers to clap their hands, and all of the hills to sing together.
98.9: Let them worship the LORD! He is coming to judge everyone on the earth, and he will be honest and fair.

99.1: Our LORD, you are King! You rule from your throne above the winged creatures, as people tremble and the earth shakes.
99.2: You are praised in Zion, and you control all nations.
99.3: Only you are God! And your power alone, so great and fearsome, is worthy of praise.
99.4: You are our mighty King, a lover of fairness, who sees that justice is done everywhere in Israel.
99.5: Our LORD and our God, we praise you and kneel down to worship you, the God of holiness!
99.6: Moses and Aaron were two of your priests. Samuel was also one of those who prayed in your name, and you, our LORD, answered their prayers.
99.7: You spoke to them from a thick cloud, and they obeyed your laws.
99.8: Our LORD and our God, you answered their prayers and forgave their sins, but when they did wrong, you punished them.
99.9: We praise you, LORD God, and we worship you at your sacred mountain. Only you are God!

100.1: Shout praises to the LORD, everyone on this earth.
100.2: Be joyful and sing as you come in to worship the LORD!
100.3: You know the LORD is God! He created us, and we belong to him; we are his people, the sheep in his pasture.
100.4: Be thankful and praise the LORD as you enter his temple.
100.5: The LORD is good! His love and faithfulness will last forever.

101.1: I will sing to you, LORD! I will celebrate your kindness and your justice.
101.2: Please help me learn to do the right thing, and I will be honest and fair in my own kingdom.
101.3: I refuse to be corrupt or to take part in anything crooked,
101.4: and I won't be dishonest or deceitful.
101.5: Anyone who spreads gossip will be silenced, and no one who is conceited will be my friend.
101.6: I will find trustworthy people to serve as my advisors, and only an honest person will serve as an official.
101.7: No one who cheats or lies will have a position in my royal court.
101.8: Each morning I will silence any lawbreakers I find in the countryside or in the city of the LORD.

102.1: I pray to you, LORD! Please listen.
102.2: Don't hide from me in my time of trouble. Pay attention to my prayer and quickly give an answer.
102.3: My days disappear like smoke, and my bones are burning as though in a furnace.
102.4: I am wasting away like grass, and my appetite is gone.
102.5: My groaning never stops, and my bones can be seen through my skin.
102.6: I am like a lonely owl in the desert
102.7: or a restless sparrow alone on a roof.
102.8: My enemies insult me all day, and they use my name for a curse word.
102.9: Instead of food, I have ashes to eat and tears to drink,
102.10: because you are furious and have thrown me aside.
102.11: My life fades like a shadow at the end of day and withers like grass.
102.12: Our LORD, you are King forever and will always be famous.
102.13: You will show pity to Zion because the time has come.
102.14: We, your servants, love each stone in the city, and we are sad to see them lying in the dirt.
102.15: Our LORD, the nations will honor you, and all kings on earth will praise your glory.
102.16: You will rebuild the city of Zion. Your glory will be seen,
102.17: and the prayers of the homeless will be answered.
102.18: Future generations must also praise the LORD, so write this for them:
102.19: "From his holy temple, the LORD looked down at the earth.
102.20: He listened to the groans of prisoners, and he rescued everyone who was doomed to die."
102.21: All Jerusalem should praise you, our LORD,
102.22: when people from every nation meet to worship you.
102.23: I should still be strong, but you, LORD, have made an old person of me.
102.24: You will live forever! Years mean nothing to you. Don't cut my life in half!
102.25: In the beginning, LORD, you laid the earth's foundation and created the heavens.
102.26: They will all disappear and wear out like clothes. You change them, as you would a coat, but you last forever.
102.27: You are always the same. Years cannot change you.
102.28: Every generation of those who serve you will live in your presence.

103.1: With all my heart I praise the LORD, and with all that I am I praise his holy name!
103.2: With all my heart I praise the LORD! I will never forget how kind he has been.
103.3: The LORD forgives our sins, heals us when we are sick,
103.4: and protects us from death. His kindness and love are a crown on our heads.
103.5: Each day that we live, he provides for our needs and gives us the strength of a young eagle.
103.6: For all who are mistreated, the LORD brings justice.
103.7: He taught his Law to Moses and showed all Israel what he could do.
103.8: The LORD is merciful! He is kind and patient, and his love never fails.
103.9: The LORD won't always be angry and point out our sins;
103.10: he doesn't punish us as our sins deserve.
103.11: How great is God's love for all who worship him? Greater than the distance between heaven and earth!
103.12: How far has the LORD taken our sins from us? Farther than the distance from east to west!
103.13: Just as parents are kind to their children, the LORD is kind to all who worship him,
103.14: because he knows we are made of dust.
103.15: We humans are like grass or wild flowers that quickly bloom.
103.16: But a scorching wind blows, and they quickly wither to be forever forgotten.
103.17: The LORD is always kind to those who worship him, and he keeps his promises to their descendants
103.19: God has set up his kingdom in heaven, and he rules the whole creation.
103.20: All of you mighty angels, who obey God's commands, come and praise your LORD!
103.21: All of you thousands who serve and obey God, come and praise your LORD!
103.22: All of God's creation and all that he rules, come and praise your LORD! With all my heart I praise the LORD!

104.1: I praise you, LORD God, with all my heart. You are glorious and majestic, dressed in royal robes
104.2: and surrounded by light. You spread out the sky like a tent,
104.3: and you built your home over the mighty ocean. The clouds are your chariot with the wind as its wings.
104.4: The winds are your messengers, and flames of fire are your servants.
104.5: You built foundations for the earth, and it will never be shaken.
104.6: You covered the earth with the ocean that rose above the mountains.
104.7: Then your voice thundered! And the water flowed
104.8: down the mountains and through the valleys to the place you prepared.
104.9: Now you have set boundaries, so that the water will never flood the earth again.
104.10: You provide streams of water in the hills and valleys,
104.11: so that the donkeys and other wild animals can satisfy their thirst.
104.12: Birds build their nests nearby and sing in the trees.
104.13: From your home above you send rain on the hills and water the earth.
104.14: You let the earth produce grass for cattle, plants for our food,
104.15: wine to cheer us up, olive oil for our skin, and grain for our health.
104.16: Our LORD, your trees always have water, and so do the cedars you planted in Lebanon.
104.17: Birds nest in those trees, and storks make their home in the fir trees.
104.18: Wild goats find a home in the tall mountains, and small animals can hide between the rocks.
104.19: You created the moon to tell us the seasons. The sun knows when to set,
104.20: and you made the darkness, so the animals in the forest could come out at night.
104.21: Lions roar as they hunt for the food you provide.
104.22: But when morning comes, they return to their dens,
104.23: then we go out to work until the end of day.
104.24: Our LORD, by your wisdom you made so many things; the whole earth is covered with your living creatures.
104.25: But what about the ocean so big and wide? It is alive with creatures, large and small.
104.26: And there are the ships, as well as Leviathan, the monster you created to splash in the sea.
104.27: All of these depend on you to provide them with food,
104.28: and you feed each one with your own hand, until they are full.
104.29: But when you turn away, they are terrified; when you end their life, they die and rot.
104.30: You created all of them by your Spirit, and you give new life to the earth.
104.31: Our LORD, we pray that your glory will last forever and that you will be pleased with what you have done.
104.32: You look at the earth, and it trembles. You touch the mountains, and smoke goes up.
104.33: As long as I live, I will sing and praise you, the LORD God.
104.34: I hope my thoughts will please you, because you are the one who makes me glad.
104.35: Destroy all wicked sinners from the earth once and for all. With all my heart I praise you, LORD! I praise you!

105.1: Praise the LORD and pray in his name! Tell everyone what he has done.
105.2: Sing praises to the LORD! Tell about his miracles.
105.3: Celebrate and worship his holy name with all your heart.
105.4: Trust the LORD and his mighty power.
105.5: Remember his miracles and all his wonders and his fair decisions.
105.6: You belong to the family of Abraham, his servant; you are his chosen ones, the descendants of Jacob.
105.7: The LORD is our God, bringing justice everywhere on earth.
105.8: He will never forget his agreement or his promises, not in thousands of years.
105.11: when he said, "I'll give you the land of Canaan."
105.12: At the time there were only a few of us, and we were homeless.
105.13: We wandered from nation to nation, from one country to another.
105.14: God did not let anyone mistreat our people. Instead he protected us by punishing rulers
105.15: and telling them, "Don't touch my chosen leaders or harm my prophets!"
105.16: God kept crops from growing until food was scarce everywhere in the land.
105.17: But he had already sent Joseph, sold as a slave into Egypt,
105.18: with chains of iron around his legs and neck.
105.19: Joseph remained a slave until his own words had come true, and the LORD had finished testing him.
105.20: Then the king of Egypt set Joseph free
105.21: and put him in charge of everything he owned.
105.22: Joseph was in command of the officials, and he taught the leaders how to use wisdom.
105.23: Jacob and his family came and settled in Egypt as foreigners.
105.24: They were the LORD's people, so he let them grow stronger than their enemies.
105.25: They served the LORD, and he made the Egyptians plan hateful things against them.
105.26: God sent his servant Moses. He also chose and sent Aaron
105.27: to his people in Egypt, and they worked miracles and wonders there.
105.28: Moses and Aaron obeyed God, and he sent darkness to cover Egypt.
105.29: God turned their rivers into streams of blood, and the fish all died.
105.30: Frogs were everywhere, even in the royal palace.
105.31: When God gave the command, flies and gnats swarmed all around.
105.32: In place of rain, God sent hailstones and flashes of lightning.
105.33: He destroyed their grapevines and their fig trees, and he made splinters of all the other trees.
105.34: God gave the command, and more grasshoppers came than could be counted.
105.35: They ate every green plant and all the crops that grew in the land of Egypt.
105.36: Then God took the life of every first-born son.
105.37: When God led Israel from Egypt, they took silver and gold, and no one was left behind.
105.38: The Egyptians were afraid and gladly let them go.
105.39: God hid them under a cloud and guided them by fire during the night.
105.40: When they asked for food, he sent more birds than they could eat.
105.41: God even split open a rock, and streams of water gushed into the desert.
105.42: God never forgot his sacred promise to his servant Abraham.
105.43: When the Lord rescued his chosen people from Egypt, they celebrated with songs.
105.44: The Lord gave them the land and everything else the nations had worked for.
105.45: He did this so that his people would obey all of his laws. Shout praises to the LORD!

106.1: We will celebrate and praise you, LORD! You are good to us, and your love never fails.
106.2: No one can praise you enough for all of the mighty things you have done.
106.3: You bless those people who are honest and fair in everything they do.
106.4: Remember me, LORD, when you show kindness by saving your people.
106.5: Let me prosper with the rest of your chosen ones, as they celebrate with pride because they belong to you.
106.6: We and our ancestors have sinned terribly.
106.7: When they were in Egypt, they paid no attention to your marvelous deeds or your wonderful love. And they turned against you at the Red Sea.
106.8: But you were true to your name, and you rescued them to prove how mighty you are.
106.9: You said to the Red Sea, "Dry up!" Then you led your people across on land as dry as a desert.
106.11: and drowned every one of their enemies.
106.12: Then your people trusted you and sang your praises.
106.13: But they soon forgot what you had done and rejected your advice.
106.14: They became greedy for food and tested you there in the desert.
106.15: So you gave them what they wanted, but later you destroyed them with a horrible disease.
106.16: Everyone in camp was jealous of Moses and of Aaron, your chosen priest.
106.17: Dathan and Abiram rebelled, and the earth opened up and swallowed them.
106.18: Then fire broke out and destroyed all of their followers.
106.19: At Horeb your people made and worshiped the statue
106.20: of a bull, instead of you, their glorious God.
106.21: You worked powerful miracles to save them from Egypt, but they forgot about you
106.22: and the fearsome things you did at the Red Sea.
106.23: You were angry and started to destroy them, but Moses, your chosen leader, begged you not to do it.
106.24: They would not trust you, LORD, and they did not like the promised land.
106.25: They would not obey you, and they grumbled in their tents.
106.26: So you threatened them by saying, "I'll kill you out here in the desert!
106.27: I'll scatter your children everywhere in the world."
106.28: Your people became followers of a god named Baal Peor, and they ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
106.29: They did such terrible things that you punished them with a deadly disease.
106.30: But Phinehas helped them, and the sickness stopped.
106.31: Now he will always be highly honored.
106.32: At Meribah Spring they turned against you and made you furious.
106.33: Then Moses got into trouble for speaking in anger.
106.34: Our LORD, they disobeyed you by refusing to destroy the nations.
106.35: Instead they were friendly with those foreigners and followed their customs.
106.36: Then they fell into the trap of worshiping idols.
106.37: They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons
106.38: and to the gods of Canaan. Then they poured out the blood of these innocent children and made the land filthy.
106.39: By doing such gruesome things, they also became filthy.
106.40: Finally, LORD, you were angry and terribly disgusted with your people.
106.41: So you put them in the power of nations that hated them.
106.42: They were mistreated and abused by their enemies,
106.43: but you saved them time after time. They were determined to rebel, and their sins caused their downfall.
106.44: You answered their prayers when they were in trouble.
106.45: You kept your agreement and were so merciful
106.46: that their enemies had pity on them.
106.47: Save us, LORD God! Bring us back from among the nations. Let us celebrate and shout in praise of your holy name.
106.48: LORD God of Israel, you deserve to be praised forever and ever. Let everyone say, "Amen! Shout praises to the LORD!"

107.1: Shout praises to the LORD! He is good to us, and his love never fails.
107.2: Everyone the LORD has rescued from trouble should praise him,
107.3: everyone he has brought from the east and the west, the north and the south.
107.4: Some of you were lost in the scorching desert, far from a town.
107.5: You were hungry and thirsty and about to give up.
107.6: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.
107.7: Right away he brought you to a town.
107.8: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.
107.9: To everyone who is thirsty, he gives something to drink; to everyone who is hungry, he gives good things to eat.
107.10: Some of you were prisoners suffering in deepest darkness and bound by chains,
107.11: because you had rebelled against God Most High and refused his advice.
107.12: You were worn out from working like slaves, and no one came to help.
107.13: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.
107.14: He brought you out of the deepest darkness and broke your chains.
107.15: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.
107.16: He breaks down bronze gates and shatters iron locks.
107.17: Some of you had foolishly committed a lot of sins and were in terrible pain.
107.18: The very thought of food was disgusting to you, and you were almost dead.
107.19: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.
107.20: By the power of his own word, he healed you and saved you from destruction.
107.21: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.
107.22: You should celebrate by offering sacrifices and singing joyful songs to tell what he has done.
107.23: Some of you made a living by sailing the mighty sea,
107.24: and you saw the miracles the LORD performed there.
107.25: At his command a storm arose, and waves covered the sea.
107.26: You were tossed to the sky and to the ocean depths, until things looked so bad that you lost your courage.
107.27: You staggered like drunkards and gave up all hope.
107.28: You were in serious trouble, but you prayed to the LORD, and he rescued you.
107.29: He made the storm stop and the sea be quiet.
107.30: You were happy because of this, and he brought you to the port where you wanted to go.
107.31: You should praise the LORD for his love and for the wonderful things he does for all of us.
107.32: Honor the LORD when you and your leaders meet to worship.
107.33: If you start doing wrong, the LORD will turn rivers into deserts,
107.34: flowing streams into scorched land, and fruitful fields into beds of salt.
107.35: But the LORD can also turn deserts into lakes and scorched land into flowing streams.
107.36: If you are hungry, you can settle there and build a town.
107.37: You can plant fields and vineyards that produce a good harvest.
107.38: The LORD will bless you with many children and with herds of cattle.
107.39: Sometimes you may be crushed by troubles and sorrows, until only a few of you are left to survive.
107.40: But the LORD will take revenge on those who conquer you, and he will make them wander across desert sands.
107.41: When you are suffering and in need, he will come to your rescue, and your families will grow as fast as a herd of sheep.
107.42: You will see this because you obey the LORD, but everyone who is wicked will be silenced.
107.43: Be wise! Remember this and think about the kindness of the LORD.

108.1: Our God, I am faithful to you with all my heart, and you can trust me. I will sing and play music for you with all that I am.
108.2: I will start playing my harps before the sun rises.
108.3: I will praise you, LORD, for everyone to hear; I will sing hymns to you in every nation.
108.4: Your love reaches higher than the heavens, and your loyalty extends beyond the clouds.
108.5: Our God, may you be honored above the heavens; may your glory be seen everywhere on earth.
108.6: Answer my prayers and use your powerful arm to give us victory. Then the people you love will be safe.
108.7: Our God, from your holy place you made this promise: "I will gladly divide up the city of Shechem and give away Succoth Valley piece by piece.
108.8: The lands of Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is my war helmet, and Judah is my symbol of royal power.
108.9: Moab is merely my washbasin, and Edom belongs to me. I shout with victory over the Philistines."
108.10: Our God, who will bring me to the fortress or lead me to Edom?
108.11: Have you rejected us? You don't lead our armies.
108.12: Help us defeat our enemies! No one else can rescue us.
108.13: You are the one who gives us victory and crushes our enemies.

109.1: I praise you, God! Don't keep silent.
109.2: Destructive and deceitful lies are told about me,
109.3: and hateful things are said for no reason.
109.4: I had pity and prayed for my enemies, but their words to me were harsh and cruel.
109.5: For being friendly and kind, they paid me back with meanness and hatred.
109.6: My enemies said, "Find some worthless fools to accuse him of a crime.
109.7: Try him and find him guilty! Consider his prayers a lie.
109.8: Cut his life short and let someone else have his job.
109.9: Make orphans of his children and a widow of his wife;
109.10: make his children beg for food and live in the slums.
109.11: "Let the people he owes take everything he owns. Give it all to strangers.
109.12: Don't let anyone be kind to him or have pity on the children he leaves behind.
109.13: Bring an end to his family, and from now on let him be a forgotten man.
109.14: "Don't let the LORD forgive the sins of his parents and his ancestors.
109.15: Don't let the LORD forget the sins of his family, or let anyone remember his family ever lived.
109.16: He was so cruel to the poor, homeless, and discouraged that they died young.
109.17: "He cursed others. Now place a curse on him! He never wished others well. Wish only trouble for him!
109.18: He cursed others more often than he dressed himself. Let his curses strike him deep, just as water and olive oil soak through to our bones.
109.19: Let his curses surround him, just like the clothes he wears each day."
109.20: Those are the cruel things my enemies wish for me. Let it all happen to them!
109.21: Be true to your name, LORD God! Show your great kindness and rescue me.
109.22: I am poor and helpless, and I have lost all hope.
109.23: I am fading away like an evening shadow; I am tossed aside like a crawling insect.
109.24: I have gone without eating, until my knees are weak, and my body is bony.
109.25: When my enemies see me, they say cruel things and shake their heads.
109.26: Please help me, LORD God! Come and save me because of your love.
109.27: Let others know that you alone have saved me.
109.28: I don't care if they curse me, as long as you bless me. You will make my enemies fail when they attack, and you will make me glad to be your servant.
109.29: You will cover them with shame, just as their bodies are covered with clothes.
109.30: I will sing your praises and thank you, LORD, when your people meet.
109.31: You help everyone in need, and you defend them when they are on trial.

110.1: The LORD said to my Lord, "Sit at my right side, until I make your enemies into a footstool for you."
110.2: The LORD will let your power reach out from Zion, and you will rule over your enemies.
110.3: Your glorious power will be seen on the day you begin to rule. You will wear the sacred robes and shine like the morning sun in all of your strength.
110.4: The LORD has made a promise that will never be broken: "You will be a priest forever, just like Melchizedek."
110.5: My Lord is at your right side, and when he gets angry he will crush the other kings.
110.6: He will judge the nations and crack their skulls, leaving piles of dead bodies all over the earth.
110.7: He will drink from any stream that he chooses, while winning victory after victory.

111.1: Shout praises to the LORD! With all my heart I will thank the LORD when his people meet.
111.2: The LORD has done many wonderful things! Everyone who is pleased with God's marvelous deeds will keep them in mind.
111.3: Everything the LORD does is glorious and majestic, and his power to bring justice will never end.
111.4: The LORD God is famous for his wonderful deeds, and he is kind and merciful.
111.5: He gives food to his worshipers and always keeps his agreement with them.
111.6: He has shown his mighty power to his people and has given them the lands of other nations.
111.7: God is always honest and fair, and his laws can be trusted.
111.8: They are true and right and will stand forever.
111.9: God rescued his people, and he will never break his agreement with them. He is fearsome and holy.
111.10: Respect and obey the LORD! This is the first step to wisdom and good sense. God will always be respected.

112.1: Shout praises to the LORD! The LORD blesses everyone who worships him and gladly obeys his teachings.
112.2: Their descendants will have great power in the land, because the LORD blesses all who do right.
112.3: They will get rich and prosper and will always be remembered for their fairness.
112.4: They will be so kind and merciful and good, that they will be a light in the dark for others who do the right thing.
112.5: Life will go well for those who freely lend and are honest in business.
112.6: They won't ever be troubled, and the kind things they do will never be forgotten.
112.7: Bad news won't bother them; they have decided to trust the LORD.
112.8: They are dependable and not afraid, and they will live to see their enemies defeated.
112.9: They will always be remembered and greatly praised, because they were kind and freely gave to the poor.
112.10: When evil people see this, they angrily bite their tongues and disappear. They will never get what they really want.

113.1: Shout praises to the LORD! Everyone who serves him, come and praise his name.
113.2: Let the name of the LORD be praised now and forever.
113.3: From dawn until sunset the name of the LORD deserves to be praised.
113.4: The LORD is far above all of the nations; he is more glorious than the heavens.
113.5: No one can compare with the LORD our God. His throne is high above,
113.6: and he looks down to see the heavens and the earth.
113.7: God lifts the poor and needy from dust and ashes,
113.8: and he lets them take part in ruling his people.
113.9: When a wife has no children, he blesses her with some, and she is happy. Shout praises to the LORD!

114.1: God brought his people out of Egypt, that land with a strange language.
114.2: He made Judah his holy place and ruled over Israel.
114.3: When the sea looked at God, it ran away, and the Jordan River flowed upstream.
114.4: The mountains and the hills skipped around like goats.
114.5: Ask the sea why it ran away or ask the Jordan why it flowed upstream.
114.6: Ask the mountains and the hills why they skipped like goats!
114.7: Earth, you will tremble, when the Lord God of Jacob comes near,
114.8: because he turns solid rock into flowing streams and pools of water.

115.1: We don't deserve praise! The LORD alone deserves all of the praise, because of his love and faithfulness.
115.2: Why should the nations ask, "Where is your God?"
115.3: Our God is in the heavens, doing as he chooses.
115.4: The idols of the nations are made of silver and gold.
115.5: They have a mouth and eyes, but they can't speak or see.
115.6: Their ears can't hear, and their noses can't smell.
115.7: Their hands have no feeling, their legs don't move, and they can't make a sound.
115.8: Everyone who made the idols and all who trust them are just as helpless as those useless gods.
115.9: People of Israel, you must trust the LORD to help and protect you.
115.10: Family of Aaron the priest, you must trust the LORD to help and protect you.
115.11: All of you worship the LORD, so you must trust him to help and protect you.
115.12: The LORD will not forget to give us his blessing; he will bless all of Israel and the family of Aaron.
115.13: All who worship the LORD, no matter who they are, will receive his blessing.
115.14: I pray that the LORD will let your family and your descendants always grow strong.
115.15: May the LORD who created the heavens and the earth give you his blessing.
115.16: The LORD has kept the heavens for himself, but he has given the earth to us humans.
115.17: The dead are silent and cannot praise the LORD,
115.18: but we will praise him now and forevermore. Shout praises to the LORD!

116.1: I love you, LORD! You answered my prayers.
116.2: You paid attention to me, and so I will pray to you as long as I live.
116.3: Death attacked from all sides, and I was captured by its painful chains. But when I was really hurting,
116.4: I prayed and said, "LORD, please don't let me die!"
116.5: You are kind, LORD, so good and merciful.
116.6: You protect ordinary people, and when I was helpless, you saved me
116.7: and treated me so kindly that I don't need to worry anymore.
116.8: You, LORD, have saved my life from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.
116.9: Now I will walk at your side in this land of the living.
116.10: I was faithful to you when I was suffering,
116.11: though in my confusion I said, "I can't trust anyone!"
116.12: What must I give you, LORD, for being so good to me?
116.13: I will pour out an offering of wine to you, and I will pray in your name because you have saved me.
116.14: I will keep my promise to you when your people meet.
116.15: You are deeply concerned when one of your loyal people faces death.
116.16: I worship you, LORD, just as my mother did, and you have rescued me from the chains of death.
116.17: I will offer you a sacrifice to show how grateful I am, and I will pray.
116.18: I will keep my promise to you when your people
116.19: gather at your temple in Jerusalem. Shout praises to the LORD!

117.1: All of you nations, come praise the LORD! Let everyone praise him.
117.2: His love for us is wonderful; his faithfulness never ends. Shout praises to the LORD!

118.1: Tell the LORD how thankful you are, because he is kind and always merciful.
118.2: Let Israel shout, "God is always merciful!"
118.3: Let the family of Aaron the priest shout, "God is always merciful!"
118.4: Let every true worshiper of the LORD shout, "God is always merciful!"
118.5: When I was really hurting, I prayed to the LORD. He answered my prayer, and took my worries away.
118.6: The LORD is on my side, and I am not afraid of what others can do to me.
118.7: With the LORD on my side, I will defeat all of my hateful enemies.
118.8: It is better to trust the LORD for protection than to trust anyone else,
118.10: Nations surrounded me, but I got rid of them by the power of the LORD.
118.11: They attacked from all sides, but I got rid of them by the power of the LORD.
118.12: They swarmed around like bees, but by the power of the LORD, I got rid of them and their fiery sting.
118.13: Their attacks were so fierce that I nearly fell, but the LORD helped me.
118.14: My power and my strength come from the LORD, and he has saved me.
118.15: From the tents of God's people come shouts of victory: "The LORD is powerful!
118.16: With his mighty arm the LORD wins victories! The LORD is powerful!"
118.17: And so my life is safe, and I will live to tell what the LORD has done.
118.18: He punished me terribly, but he did not let death lay its hands on me.
118.19: Open the gates of justice! I will enter and tell the LORD how thankful I am.
118.20: Here is the gate of the LORD! Everyone who does right may enter this gate.
118.21: I praise the LORD for answering my prayers and saving me.
118.22: The stone that the builders tossed aside has now become the most important stone.
118.23: The LORD has done this, and it is amazing to us.
118.24: This day belongs to the LORD! Let's celebrate and be glad today.
118.25: We'll ask the LORD to save us! We'll sincerely ask the LORD to let us win.
118.26: God bless the one who comes in the name of the LORD! We praise you from here in the house of the LORD.
118.27: The LORD is our God, and he has given us light! Start the celebration! March with palm branches all the way to the altar.
118.28: The LORD is my God! I will praise him and tell him how thankful I am.
118.29: Tell the LORD how thankful you are, because he is kind and always merciful.

119.1: Our LORD, you bless everyone who lives right and obeys your Law.
119.2: You bless all of those who follow your commands from deep in their hearts
119.3: and who never do wrong or turn from you.
119.4: You have ordered us always to obey your teachings;
119.5: I don't ever want to stray from your laws.
119.6: Thinking about your commands will keep me from doing some foolish thing.
119.7: I will do right and praise you by learning to respect your perfect laws.
119.8: I will obey all of them! Don't turn your back on me.
119.9: Young people can live a clean life by obeying your word.
119.10: I worship you with all my heart. Don't let me walk away from your commands.
119.11: I treasure your word above all else; it keeps me from sinning against you.
119.12: I praise you, LORD! Teach me your laws.
119.13: With my own mouth, I tell others the laws that you have spoken.
119.14: Obeying your instructions brings as much happiness as being rich.
119.15: I will study your teachings and follow your footsteps.
119.16: I will take pleasure in your laws and remember your words.
119.17: Treat me with kindness, LORD, so that I may live and do what you say.
119.18: Open my mind and let me discover the wonders of your Law.
119.19: I live here as a stranger. Don't keep me from knowing your commands.
119.20: What I want most of all and at all times is to honor your laws.
119.21: You punish those boastful, worthless nobodies who turn from your commands.
119.22: Don't let them sneer and insult me for following you.
119.23: I keep thinking about your teachings, LORD, even if rulers plot against me.
119.24: Your laws are my greatest joy! I follow their advice.
119.25: I am at the point of death. Let your teachings breathe new life into me.
119.26: When I told you my troubles, you answered my prayers. Now teach me your laws.
119.27: Help me to understand your teachings, and I will think about your marvelous deeds.
119.28: I am overcome with sorrow. Encourage me, as you have promised to do.
119.29: Keep me from being deceitful, and be kind enough to teach me your Law.
119.30: I am determined to be faithful and to respect your laws.
119.31: I follow your rules, LORD. Don't let me be ashamed.
119.32: I am eager to learn all that you want me to do; help me to understand more and more.
119.33: Point out your rules to me, and I won't disobey even one of them.
119.34: Help me to understand your Law; I promise to obey it with all my heart.
119.35: Direct me by your commands! I love to do what you say.
119.36: Make me want to obey you, rather than to be rich.
119.37: Take away my foolish desires, and let me find life by walking with you.
119.38: I am your servant! Do for me what you promised to those who worship you.
119.39: Your wonderful teachings protect me from the insults that I hate so much.
119.40: I long for your teachings. Be true to yourself and let me live.
119.41: Show me your love and save me, LORD, as you have promised.
119.42: Then I will have an answer for everyone who insults me for trusting your word.
119.43: I rely on your laws! Don't take away my chance to speak your truth.
119.44: I will keep obeying your Law forever and ever.
119.45: I have gained perfect freedom by following your teachings,
119.46: and I trust them so much that I tell them to kings.
119.47: I love your commands! They bring me happiness.
119.48: I love and respect them and will keep them in mind.
119.49: Don't forget your promise to me, your servant. I depend on it.
119.50: When I am hurting, I find comfort in your promise that leads to life.
119.51: Conceited people sneer at me, but I obey your Law.
119.52: I find true comfort, LORD, because your laws have stood the test of time.
119.53: I get furious when evil people turn against your Law.
119.54: No matter where I am, your teachings fill me with songs.
119.55: Even in the night I think about you, LORD, and I obey your Law.
119.56: You have blessed me because I have always followed your teachings.
119.57: You, LORD, are my choice, and I will obey you.
119.58: With all my heart I beg you to be kind to me, just as you have promised.
119.59: I pay careful attention as you lead me, and I follow closely.
119.60: As soon as you command, I do what you say.
119.61: Evil people may set a trap, but I obey your Law.
119.62: Your laws are so fair that I wake up and praise you in the middle of the night.
119.63: I choose as my friends everyone who worships you and follows your teachings.
119.64: Our LORD, your love is seen all over the world. Teach me your laws.
119.65: I am your servant, LORD, and you have kept your promise to treat me with kindness.
119.66: Give me wisdom and good sense. I trust your commands.
119.67: Once you corrected me for not obeying you, but now I obey.
119.68: You are kindhearted, and you do good things, so teach me your laws.
119.69: My reputation is being ruined by conceited liars, but with all my heart I follow your teachings.
119.70: Those liars have no sense, but I find happiness in your Law.
119.71: When you corrected me, it did me good because it taught me to study your laws.
119.72: I would rather obey you than to have a thousand pieces of silver and gold.
119.73: You created me and put me together. Make me wise enough to learn what you have commanded.
119.74: Your worshipers will see me, and they will be glad that I trust your word.
119.75: Your decisions are correct, and you were right to punish me.
119.76: I serve you, LORD. Comfort me with your love, just as you have promised.
119.77: I love to obey your Law! Have mercy and let me live.
119.78: Put down those proud people who hurt me with their lies, because I have chosen to study your teachings.
119.79: Let your worshipers come to me, so they will learn to obey your rules.
119.80: Let me truly respect your laws, so I won't be ashamed.
119.81: I long for you to rescue me! Your word is my only hope.
119.82: I am worn out from waiting for you to keep your word. When will you have mercy?
119.83: My life is wasting away like a dried-up wineskin, but I have not forgotten your teachings.
119.84: I am your servant! How long must I suffer? When will you punish those troublemakers?
119.85: Those proud people reject your teachings, and they dig pits for me to fall in.
119.86: Your laws can be trusted! Protect me from cruel liars.
119.87: They have almost killed me, but I have been faithful to your teachings.
119.88: Show that you love me and let me live, so that I may obey all of your commands.
119.89: Our LORD, you are eternal! Your word will last as long as the heavens.
119.90: You remain faithful in every generation, and the earth you created will keep standing firm.
119.91: All things are your servants, and the laws you made are still in effect today.
119.92: If I had not found happiness in obeying your Law, I would have died in misery.
119.93: I won't ever forget your teachings, because you give me new life by following them.
119.94: I belong to you, and I have respected your laws, so keep me safe.
119.95: Brutal enemies are waiting to ambush and destroy me, but I obey your rules.
119.96: Nothing is completely perfect, except your teachings.
119.97: I deeply love your Law! I think about it all day.
119.98: Your laws never leave my mind, and they make me much wiser than my enemies.
119.99: Thinking about your teachings gives me better understanding than my teachers,
119.100: and obeying your laws makes me wiser than those who have lived a long time.
119.101: I obey your word instead of following a way that leads to trouble.
119.102: You have been my teacher, and I won't reject your instructions.
119.103: Your teachings are sweeter than honey.
119.104: They give me understanding and make me hate all lies.
119.105: Your word is a lamp that gives light wherever I walk.
119.106: Your laws are fair, and I have given my word to respect them all.
119.107: I am in terrible pain! Save me, LORD, as you said you would.
119.108: Accept my offerings of praise and teach me your laws.
119.109: I never forget your teachings, although my life is always in danger.
119.110: Some merciless people are trying to trap me, but I never turn my back on your teachings.
119.111: They will always be my most prized possession and my source of joy.
119.112: I have made up my mind to obey your laws forever, no matter what.
119.113: I hate anyone whose loyalty is divided, but I love your Law.
119.114: You are my place of safety and my shield. Your word is my only hope.
119.115: All of you worthless people, get away from me! I am determined to obey the commands of my God.
119.116: Be true to your word, LORD. Keep me alive and strong; don't let me be ashamed because of my hope.
119.117: Keep me safe and secure, so that I will always respect your laws.
119.118: You reject all deceitful liars because they refuse your teachings.
119.119: As far as you are concerned, all evil people are garbage, and so I follow your rules.
119.120: I tremble all over when I think of you and the way you judge.
119.121: I did what was fair and right! Don't hand me over to those who want to mistreat me.
119.122: Take good care of me, your servant, and don't let me be harmed by those conceited people.
119.123: My eyes are weary from waiting to see you keep your promise to come and save me.
119.124: Show your love for me, your servant, and teach me your laws.
119.125: I serve you, so let me understand your teachings.
119.126: Do something, LORD! They have broken your Law.
119.127: Your laws mean more to me than the finest gold.
119.128: I follow all of your commands, but I hate anyone who leads me astray.
119.129: Your teachings are wonderful, and I respect them all.
119.130: Understanding your word brings light to the minds of ordinary people.
119.131: I honestly want to know everything you teach.
119.132: Think about me and be kind, just as you are to everyone who loves your name.
119.133: Keep your promise and don't let me stumble or let sin control my life.
119.134: Protect me from abuse, so I can obey your laws.
119.135: Smile on me, your servant, and teach me your laws.
119.136: When anyone disobeys you, my eyes overflow with tears.
119.137: Our LORD, you always do right, and your decisions are fair.
119.138: All of your teachings are true and trustworthy.
119.139: It upsets me greatly when my enemies neglect your teachings.
119.140: Your word to me, your servant, is like pure gold; I treasure what you say.
119.141: Everyone calls me a nobody, but I remember your laws.
119.142: You will always do right, and your teachings are true.
119.143: I am in deep distress, but I love your teachings.
119.144: Your rules are always fair. Help me to understand them and live.
119.145: I pray to you, LORD! Please answer me. I promise to obey your laws.
119.146: I beg you to save me, so I can follow your rules.
119.147: Even before sunrise, I pray for your help, and I put my hope in what you have said.
119.148: I lie awake at night, thinking of your promises.
119.149: Show that you love me, LORD, and answer my prayer. Please do the right thing and save my life.
119.150: People who disobey your Law have made evil plans and want to hurt me,
119.151: but you are with me, and all of your commands can be trusted.
119.152: From studying your laws, I found out long ago that you made them to last forever.
119.153: I have not forgotten your Law! Look at the trouble I am in, and rescue me.
119.154: Be my defender and protector! Keep your promise and save my life.
119.155: Evil people won't obey you, and so they have no hope of being saved.
119.156: You are merciful, LORD! Please do the right thing and save my life.
119.157: I have a lot of brutal enemies, but still I never turn from your laws.
119.158: All of those unfaithful people who refuse to obey you are disgusting to me.
119.159: Remember how I love your laws, and show your love for me by keeping me safe.
119.160: All you say can be trusted; your teachings are true and will last forever.
119.161: Rulers are cruel to me for no reason. But with all my heart I respect your words,
119.162: because they bring happiness like treasures taken in war.
119.163: I can't stand liars, but I love your Law.
119.164: I praise you seven times a day because your laws are fair.
119.165: You give peace of mind to all who love your Law. Nothing can make them fall.
119.166: You are my only hope for being saved, LORD, and I do all you command.
119.167: I love and obey your laws with all my heart.
119.168: You know everything I do. You know I respect every law you have given.
119.169: Please, LORD, hear my prayer and give me the understanding that comes from your word.
119.170: Listen to my concerns and keep me safe, just as you have promised.
119.171: If you will teach me your laws, I will praise you
119.172: and sing about your promise, because all of your teachings are what they ought to be.
119.173: Be ready to protect me because I have chosen to obey your laws.
119.174: I am waiting for you to save me, LORD. Your Law makes me happy.
119.175: Keep me alive, so I can praise you, and let me find help in your teachings.
119.176: I am your servant, but I have wandered away like a lost sheep. Please come after me, because I have not forgotten your teachings.

120.1: When I am in trouble, I pray,
120.2: "Come and save me, LORD, from deceitful liars!"
120.3: What punishment is fitting for you deceitful liars?
120.4: Your reward should be sharp and flaming arrows!
120.5: But I must live as a foreigner among the people of Meshech and in the tents of Kedar.
120.6: I have spent too much time living among people who hate peace.
120.7: I am in favor of peace, but when I speak of it, all they want is war.

121.1: I look to the hills! Where will I find help?
121.2: It will come from the LORD, who created the heavens and the earth.
121.3: The LORD is your protector, and he won't go to sleep or let you stumble.
121.4: The protector of Israel doesn't doze or ever get drowsy.
121.5: The LORD is your protector, there at your right side to shade you from the sun.
121.6: You won't be harmed by the sun during the day or by the moon at night.
121.7: The LORD will protect you and keep you safe from all dangers.
121.8: The LORD will protect you now and always wherever you go.

122.1: It made me glad to hear them say, "Let's go to the house of the LORD!"
122.2: Jerusalem, we are standing inside your gates.
122.3: Jerusalem, what a strong and beautiful city you are!
122.4: Every tribe of the LORD obeys him and comes to you to praise his name.
122.5: David's royal throne is here where justice rules.
122.6: Jerusalem, we pray that you will have peace, and that all will go well for those who love you.
122.7: May there be peace inside your city walls and in your palaces.
122.8: Because of my friends and my relatives, I will pray for peace.
122.9: And because of the house of the LORD our God, I will work for your good.

123.1: Our LORD and our God, I turn my eyes to you, on your throne in heaven.
123.2: Servants look to their master, but we will look to you, until you have mercy on us.
123.3: Please have mercy, LORD! We have been insulted more than we can stand,
123.4: and we can't take more abuse from those proud, conceited people.

124.1: The LORD was on our side! Let everyone in Israel say:
124.2: "The LORD was on our side! Otherwise, the enemy attack
124.3: would have killed us all, because it was furious.
124.4: We would have been swept away in a violent flood
124.6: Let's praise the LORD! He protected us from enemies who were like wild animals,
124.7: and we escaped like birds from a hunter's torn net.
124.8: The LORD made heaven and earth, and he is the one who sends us help.

125.1: Everyone who trusts the LORD is like Mount Zion that cannot be shaken and will stand forever.
125.2: Just as Jerusalem is protected by mountains on every side, the LORD protects his people by holding them in his arms now and forever.
125.3: He won't let the wicked rule his people or lead them to do wrong.
125.4: Let's ask the LORD to be kind to everyone who is good and completely obeys him.
125.5: When the LORD punishes the wicked, he will punish everyone else who lives a crooked life. Pray for peace in Israel!

126.1: It seemed like a dream when the LORD brought us back to the city of Zion.
126.2: We celebrated with laughter and joyful songs. In foreign nations it was said, "The LORD has worked miracles for his people."
126.3: And so we celebrated because the LORD had indeed worked miracles for us.
126.4: Our LORD, we ask you to bless our people again, and let us be like streams in the Southern Desert.
126.5: We cried as we went out to plant our seeds. Now let us celebrate as we bring in the crops.
126.6: We cried on the way to plant our seeds, but we will celebrate and shout as we bring in the crops.

127.1: Without the help of the LORD it is useless to build a home or to guard a city.
127.2: It is useless to get up early and stay up late in order to earn a living. God takes care of his own, even while they sleep.
127.3: Children are a blessing and a gift from the LORD.
127.4: Having a lot of children to take care of you in your old age is like a warrior with a lot of arrows.
127.5: The more you have, the better off you will be, because they will protect you when your enemies attack with arguments.

128.1: The LORD will bless you if you respect him and obey his laws.
128.2: Your fields will produce, and you will be happy and all will go well.
128.3: Your wife will be as fruitful as a grapevine, and just as an olive tree is rich with olives, your home will be rich with healthy children.
128.4: That is how the LORD will bless everyone who respects him.
128.5: I pray that the LORD will bless you from Zion and let Jerusalem prosper as long as you live.
128.6: May you live long enough to see your grandchildren. Let's pray for peace in Israel!

129.1: Since the time I was young, enemies have often attacked! Let everyone in Israel say:
129.2: "Since the time I was young, enemies have often attacked! But they have not defeated me,
129.3: though my back is like a field that has just been plowed."
129.4: The LORD always does right, and he has set me free from the ropes of those cruel people.
129.5: I pray that all who hate the city of Zion will be made ashamed and forced to turn and run.
129.6: May they be like grass on the flat roof of a house, grass that dries up as soon as it sprouts.
129.7: Don't let them be like wheat gathered in bundles.
129.8: And don't let anyone who passes by say to them, "The LORD bless you! I give you my blessing in the name of the LORD."

130.1: From a sea of troubles I call out to you, LORD.
130.2: Won't you please listen as I beg for mercy?
130.3: If you kept record of our sins, no one could last long.
130.4: But you forgive us, and so we will worship you.
130.5: With all my heart, I am waiting, LORD, for you! I trust your promises.
130.6: I wait for you more eagerly than a soldier on guard duty waits for the dawn. Yes, I wait more eagerly than a soldier on guard duty waits for the dawn.
130.7: Israel, trust the LORD! He is always merciful, and he has the power to save you.
130.8: Israel, the LORD will save you from all of your sins.

131.1: I am not conceited, LORD, and I don't waste my time on impossible schemes.
131.2: But I have learned to feel safe and satisfied, just like a young child on its mother's lap.
131.3: People of Israel, you must trust the LORD now and forever.

132.1: Our LORD, don't forget David and how he suffered.
132.2: Mighty God of Jacob, remember how he promised:
132.3: "I won't go home or crawl into bed
132.5: until I find a home for you, the mighty LORD God of Jacob."
132.6: When we were in Ephrath, we heard that the sacred chest was somewhere near Jaar.
132.7: Then we said, "Let's go to the throne of the LORD and worship at his feet."
132.8: Come to your new home, LORD, you and the sacred chest with all of its power.
132.9: Let victory be like robes for the priests; let your faithful people celebrate and shout.
132.10: David is your chosen one, so don't reject him.
132.11: You made a solemn promise to David, when you said, "I, the LORD, promise that someone in your family will always be king.
132.12: If they keep our agreement and follow my teachings, then someone in your family will rule forever."
132.13: You have gladly chosen Zion as your home, our LORD.
132.14: You said, "This is my home! I will live here forever.
132.15: I will bless Zion with food, and even the poor will eat until they are full.
132.16: Victory will be like robes for the priests, and its faithful people will celebrate and shout.
132.17: I will give mighty power to the kingdom of David. Each one of my chosen kings will shine like a lamp
132.18: and wear a sparkling crown. But I will disgrace their enemies."

133.1: It is truly wonderful when relatives live together in peace.
133.2: It is as beautiful as olive oil poured on Aaron's head and running down his beard and the collar of his robe.
133.3: It is like the dew from Mount Hermon, falling on Zion's mountains, where the LORD has promised to bless his people with life forevermore.

134.1: Everyone who serves the LORD, come and offer praises. Everyone who has gathered in his temple tonight,
134.2: lift your hands in prayer toward his holy place and praise the LORD.
134.3: The LORD is the Creator of heaven and earth, and I pray that the LORD will bless you from Zion.

135.1: Shout praises to the LORD! You are his servants, so praise his name.
135.2: All who serve in the temple of the LORD our God,
135.3: come and shout praises. Praise the name of the LORD! He is kind and good.
135.4: He chose the family of Jacob and the people of Israel for his very own.
135.5: The LORD is much greater than any other god.
135.6: He does as he chooses in heaven and on earth and deep in the sea.
135.7: The LORD makes the clouds rise from far across the earth, and he makes lightning to go with the rain. Then from his secret place he sends out the wind.
135.8: The LORD killed the first-born of people and animals in the land of Egypt.
135.9: God used miracles and wonders to fight the king of Egypt and all of his officials.
135.10: He destroyed many nations and killed powerful kings,
135.11: including King Sihon of the Amorites and King Og of Bashan. He conquered every kingdom in the land of Canaan
135.12: and gave their property to his people Israel.
135.13: The name of the LORD will be remembered forever, and he will be famous for all time to come.
135.14: The LORD will bring justice and show mercy to all who serve him.
135.15: Idols of silver and gold are made and worshiped in other nations.
135.16: They have a mouth and eyes, but they can't speak or see.
135.17: They are completely deaf, and they can't breathe.
135.18: Everyone who makes idols and all who trust them will end up as helpless as their idols.
135.19: Everyone in Israel, come praise the LORD! All the family of Aaron
135.20: and all the tribe of Levi, come praise the LORD! All of his worshipers, come praise the LORD.
135.21: Praise the LORD from Zion! He lives here in Jerusalem. Shout praises to the LORD!

136.1: Praise the LORD! He is good. God's love never fails.
136.2: Praise the God of all gods. God's love never fails.
136.3: Praise the Lord of lords. God's love never fails.
136.4: Only God works great miracles. God's love never fails.
136.5: With wisdom he made the sky. God's love never fails.
136.6: The Lord stretched the earth over the ocean. God's love never fails.
136.7: He made the bright lights in the sky. God's love never fails.
136.8: He lets the sun rule each day. God's love never fails.
136.9: He lets the moon and the stars rule each night. God's love never fails.
136.10: God struck down the first-born in every Egyptian family. God's love never fails.
136.11: He rescued Israel from Egypt. God's love never fails.
136.12: God used his great strength and his powerful arm. God's love never fails.
136.13: He split the Red Sea apart. God's love never fails.
136.14: The Lord brought Israel safely through the sea. God's love never fails.
136.15: He destroyed the Egyptian king and his army there. God's love never fails.
136.16: The Lord led his people through the desert. God's love never fails.
136.17: Our God defeated mighty kings. God's love never fails.
136.18: And he killed famous kings. God's love never fails.
136.19: One of them was Sihon, king of the Amorites. God's love never fails.
136.20: Another was King Og of Bashan. God's love never fails.
136.21: God took away their land. God's love never fails.
136.22: He gave their land to Israel, the people who serve him. God's love never fails.
136.23: God saw the trouble we were in. God's love never fails.
136.24: He rescued us from our enemies. God's love never fails.
136.25: He gives food to all who live. God's love never fails.
136.26: Praise God in heaven! God's love never fails.

137.1: Beside the rivers of Babylon we thought about Jerusalem, and we sat down and cried.
137.2: We hung our small harps on the willow trees.
137.3: Our enemies had brought us here as their prisoners, and now they wanted us to sing and entertain them. They insulted us and shouted, "Sing about Zion!"
137.4: Here in a foreign land, how can we sing about the LORD?
137.5: Jerusalem, if I forget you, let my right hand go limp.
137.6: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth, if I don't think about you above all else.
137.7: Our LORD, punish the Edomites! Because the day Jerusalem fell, they shouted, "Completely destroy the city! Tear down every building!"
137.8: Babylon, you are doomed! I pray the Lord's blessings on anyone who punishes you for what you did to us.
137.9: May the Lord bless everyone who beats your children against the rocks!

138.1: With all my heart I praise you, LORD. In the presence of angels I sing your praises.
138.2: I worship at your holy temple and praise you for your love and your faithfulness. You were true to your word and made yourself more famous than ever before.
138.3: When I asked for your help, you answered my prayer and gave me courage.
138.4: All kings on this earth have heard your promises, LORD, and they will praise you.
138.5: You are so famous that they will sing about the things you have done.
138.6: Though you are above us all, you care for humble people, and you keep a close watch on everyone who is proud.
138.7: I am surrounded by trouble, but you protect me against my angry enemies. With your own powerful arm you keep me safe.
138.8: You, LORD, will always treat me with kindness. Your love never fails. You have made us what we are. Don't give up on us now!

139.1: You have looked deep into my heart, LORD, and you know all about me.
139.2: You know when I am resting or when I am working, and from heaven you discover my thoughts.
139.3: You notice everything I do and everywhere I go.
139.4: Before I even speak a word, you know what I will say,
139.5: and with your powerful arm you protect me from every side.
139.6: I can't understand all of this! Such wonderful knowledge is far above me.
139.7: Where could I go to escape from your Spirit or from your sight?
139.8: If I were to climb up to the highest heavens, you would be there. If I were to dig down to the world of the dead you would also be there.
