4.24: All of this has another meaning as well. Each of the two women stands for one of the agreements God made with his people. Hagar, the slave woman, stands for the agreement that was made at Mount Sinai. Everyone born into her family is a slave.
4.25: Hagar also stands for Mount Sinai in Arabia and for the present city of Jerusalem. She and her children are slaves.
4.26: But our mother is the city of Jerusalem in heaven above, and she isn't a slave.
4.27: The Scriptures say about her, "You have never had children, but now you can be glad. You have never given birth, but now you can shout. Once you had no children, but now you will have more children than a woman who has been married for a long time."
4.28: My friends, you were born because of this promise, just as Isaac was.
4.29: But the child who was born in the natural way made trouble for the child who was born because of the Spirit. The same thing is happening today.
4.30: The Scriptures say, "Get rid of the slave woman and her son! He won't be given anything. The son of the free woman will receive everything."
4.31: My friends, we are children of the free woman and not of the slave.

5.1: Christ has set us free! This means we are really free. Now hold on to your freedom and don't ever become slaves of the Law again.
5.2: I, Paul, promise you that Christ won't do you any good if you get circumcised.
5.3: If you do, you must obey the whole Law.
5.4: And if you try to please God by obeying the Law, you have cut yourself off from Christ and his wonderful kindness.
5.5: But the Spirit makes us sure that God will accept us because of our faith in Christ.
5.6: If you are a follower of Christ Jesus, it makes no difference whether you are circumcised or not. All that matters is your faith that makes you love others.
5.7: You were doing so well until someone made you turn from the truth.
5.8: And that person was certainly not sent by the one who chose you.
5.9: A little yeast can change a whole batch of dough,
5.10: but you belong to the Lord. That makes me certain that you will do what I say, instead of what someone else tells you to do. Whoever is causing trouble for you will be punished.
5.11: My friends, if I still preach that people need to be circumcised, why am I in so much trouble? The message about the cross would no longer be a problem, if I told people to be circumcised.
5.12: I wish that everyone who is upsetting you would not only get circumcised, but would cut off much more!
5.13: My friends, you were chosen to be free. So don't use your freedom as an excuse to do anything you want. Use it as an opportunity to serve each other with love.
5.14: All that the Law says can be summed up in the command to love others as much as you love yourself.
5.15: But if you keep attacking each other like wild animals, you had better watch out or you will destroy yourselves. God's Spirit and Our Own Desires
5.16: If you are guided by the Spirit, you won't obey your selfish desires.
5.17: The Spirit and your desires are enemies of each other. They are always fighting each other and keeping you from doing what you feel you should.
5.18: But if you obey the Spirit, the Law of Moses has no control over you.
5.19: People's desires make them give in to immoral ways, filthy thoughts, and shameful deeds.
5.20: They worship idols, practice witchcraft, hate others, and are hard to get along with. People become jealous, angry, and selfish. They not only argue and cause trouble, but they are
5.21: envious. They get drunk, carry on at wild parties, and do other evil things as well. I told you before, and I am telling you again: No one who does these things will share in the blessings of God's kingdom.
5.22: God's Spirit makes us loving, happy, peaceful, patient, kind, good, faithful,
5.23: gentle, and self-controlled. There is no law against behaving in any of these ways.
5.24: And because we belong to Christ Jesus, we have killed our selfish feelings and desires.
5.25: God's Spirit has given us life, and so we should follow the Spirit.
5.26: But don't be conceited or make others jealous by claiming to be better than they are.

6.1: My friends, you are spiritual. So if someone is trapped in sin, you should gently lead that person back to the right path. But watch out, and don't be tempted yourself.
6.2: You obey the law of Christ when you offer each other a helping hand.
6.3: If you think you are better than others, when you really aren't, you are wrong.
6.4: Do your own work well, and then you will have something to be proud of. But don't compare yourself with others.
6.5: We each must carry our own load.
6.6: Share every good thing you have with anyone who teaches you what God has said.
6.7: You cannot fool God, so don't make a fool of yourself! You will harvest what you plant.
6.8: If you follow your selfish desires, you will harvest destruction, but if you follow the Spirit, you will harvest eternal life.
6.9: Don't get tired of helping others. You will be rewarded when the time is right, if you don't give up.
6.10: We should help people whenever we can, especially if they are followers of the Lord. Final Warnings
6.11: You can see what big letters I make when I write with my own hand.
6.12: Those people who are telling you to get circumcised are only trying to show how important they are. And they don't want to get into trouble for preaching about the cross of Christ.
6.13: They are circumcised, but they don't obey the Law of Moses. All they want is to brag about having you circumcised.
6.14: But I will never brag about anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ. Because of his cross, the world is dead as far as I am concerned, and I am dead as far as the world is concerned.
6.15: It doesn't matter if you are circumcised or not. All that matters is that you are a new person.
6.16: If you follow this rule, you will belong to God's true people. God will treat you with undeserved kindness and will bless you with peace.
6.17: On my own body are scars that prove I belong to Christ Jesus. So I don't want anyone to bother me anymore.
6.18: My friends, I pray that the Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you! Amen.

1.1: From Paul, chosen by God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus. To God's people who live in Ephesus and are faithful followers of Christ Jesus.
1.2: I pray that God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you and will bless you with peace! Christ Brings Spiritual Blessings
1.3: Praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ for the spiritual blessings that Christ has brought us from heaven!
1.4: Before the world was created, God had Christ choose us to live with him and to be his holy and innocent and loving people.
1.5: God was kind and decided that Christ would choose us to be God's own adopted children.
1.6: God was very kind to us because of the Son he dearly loves, and so we should praise God.
1.7: Christ sacrificed his life's blood to set us free, which means that our sins are now forgiven. Christ did this because God was so kind to us. God has great wisdom and understanding,
1.9: and by what Christ has done, God has shown us his own mysterious ways.
1.10: Then when the time is right, God will do all that he has planned, and Christ will bring together everything in heaven and on earth.
1.11: God always does what he plans, and that's why he appointed Christ to choose us.
1.12: He did this so that we Jews would bring honor to him and be the first ones to have hope because of him.
1.13: Christ also brought you the truth, which is the good news about how you can be saved. You put your faith in Christ and were given the promised Holy Spirit to show that you belong to God.
1.14: The Spirit also makes us sure that we will be given what God has stored up for his people. Then we will be set free, and God will be honored and praised. Paul's Prayer
1.15: I have heard about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all of God's people.
1.16: So I never stop being grateful for you, as I mention you in my prayers.
1.17: I ask the glorious Father and God of our Lord Jesus Christ to give you his Spirit. The Spirit will make you wise and let you understand what it means to know God.
1.18: My prayer is that light will flood your hearts and that you will understand the hope that was given to you when God chose you. Then you will discover the glorious blessings that will be yours together with all of God's people.
1.19: I want you to know about the great and mighty power that God has for us followers. It is the same wonderful power he used
1.20: when he raised Christ from death and let him sit at his right side in heaven.
1.21: There Christ rules over all forces, authorities, powers, and rulers. He rules over all beings in this world and will rule in the future world as well.
1.22: God has put all things under the power of Christ, and for the good of the church he has made him the head of everything.
1.23: The church is Christ's body and is filled with Christ who completely fills everything.

2.1: In the past you were dead because you sinned and fought against God.
2.2: You followed the ways of this world and obeyed the devil. He rules the world, and his spirit has power over everyone who doesn't obey God.
2.3: Once we were also ruled by the selfish desires of our bodies and minds. We had made God angry, and we were going to be punished like everyone else.
2.4: But God was merciful! We were dead because of our sins, but God loved us so much that he made us alive with Christ, and God's wonderful kindness is what saves you.
2.6: God raised us from death to life with Christ Jesus, and he has given us a place beside Christ in heaven.
2.7: God did this so that in the future world he could show how truly good and kind he is to us because of what Christ Jesus has done.
2.8: You were saved by faith in God, who treats us much better than we deserve. This is God's gift to you, and not anything you have done on your own.
2.9: It isn't something you have earned, so there is nothing you can brag about.
2.10: God planned for us to do good things and to live as he has always wanted us to live. That's why he sent Christ to make us what we are. United by Christ
2.11: Don't forget that you are Gentiles. In fact, you used to be called "uncircumcised" by those who take pride in being circumcised.
2.12: At that time you did not know about Christ. You were foreigners to the people of Israel, and you had no part in the promises that God had made to them. You were living in this world without hope and without God,
2.13: and you were far from God. But Christ offered his life's blood as a sacrifice and brought you near God.
2.14: Christ has made peace between Jews and Gentiles, and he has united us by breaking down the wall of hatred that separated us. Christ gave his own body
2.15: to destroy the Law of Moses with all its rules and commands. He even brought Jews and Gentiles together as though we were only one person, when he united us in peace.
2.16: On the cross Christ did away with our hatred for each other. He also made peace between us and God by uniting Jews and Gentiles in one body.
2.17: Christ came and preached peace to you Gentiles, who were far from God, and peace to us Jews, who were near God.
2.18: And because of Christ, all of us can come to the Father by the same Spirit.
2.19: You Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners. You are citizens with everyone else who belongs to the family of God.
2.20: You are like a building with the apostles and prophets as the foundation and with Christ as the most important stone.
2.21: Christ is the one who holds the building together and makes it grow into a holy temple for the Lord.
2.22: And you are part of that building Christ has built as a place for God's own Spirit to live.

3.1: Christ Jesus made me his prisoner, so that I could help you Gentiles.
3.2: You have surely heard about God's kindness in choosing me to help you.
3.3: In fact, this letter tells you a little about how God has shown me his mysterious ways.
3.4: As you read the letter, you will also find out how well I really do understand the mystery about Christ.
3.5: No one knew about this mystery until God's Spirit told it to his holy apostles and prophets.
3.6: And the mystery is this: Because of Christ Jesus, the good news has given the Gentiles a share in the promises that God gave to the Jews. God has also let the Gentiles be part of the same body.
3.7: God treated me with kindness. His power worked in me, and it became my job to spread the good news.
3.8: I am the least important of all God's people. But God was kind and chose me to tell the Gentiles that because of Christ there are blessings that cannot be measured.
3.9: God, who created everything, wanted me to help everyone understand the mysterious plan that had always been hidden in his mind.
3.10: Then God would use the church to show the powers and authorities in the spiritual world that he has many different kinds of wisdom.
3.11: God did this according to his eternal plan. And he was able to do what he had planned because of all that Christ Jesus our Lord had done.
3.12: Christ now gives us courage and confidence, so that we can come to God by faith.
3.13: That's why you should not be discouraged when I suffer for you. After all, it will bring honor to you. Christ's Love for Us
3.14: I kneel in prayer to the Father.
3.15: All beings in heaven and on earth receive their life from him.
3.16: God is wonderful and glorious. I pray that his Spirit will make you become strong followers
3.17: and that Christ will live in your hearts because of your faith. Stand firm and be deeply rooted in his love.
3.18: I pray that you and all of God's people will understand what is called wide or long or high or deep.
3.19: I want you to know all about Christ's love, although it is too wonderful to be measured. Then your lives will be filled with all that God is.
3.20: I pray that Christ Jesus and the church will forever bring praise to God. His power at work in us can do far more than we dare ask or imagine. Amen.

4.1: As a prisoner of the Lord, I beg you to live in a way that is worthy of the people God has chosen to be his own.
4.2: Always be humble and gentle. Patiently put up with each other and love each other.
4.3: Try your best to let God's Spirit keep your hearts united. Do this by living at peace.
4.4: All of you are part of the same body. There is only one Spirit of God, just as you were given one hope when you were chosen to be God's people.
4.5: We have only one Lord, one faith, and one baptism.
4.6: There is one God who is the Father of all people. Not only is God above all others, but he works by using all of us, and he lives in all of us.
4.7: Christ has generously divided out his gifts to us.
4.8: As the Scriptures say, "When he went up to the highest place, he led away many prisoners and gave gifts to people."
4.9: When it says, "he went up," it means that Christ had been deep in the earth.
4.10: This also means that the one who went deep into the earth is the same one who went into the highest heaven, so that he would fill the whole universe.
4.11: Christ chose some of us to be apostles, prophets, missionaries, pastors, and teachers,
4.12: so that his people would learn to serve and his body would grow strong.
4.13: This will continue until we are united by our faith and by our understanding of the Son of God. Then we will be mature, just as Christ is, and we will be completely like him.
4.14: We must stop acting like children. We must not let deceitful people trick us by their false teachings, which are like winds that toss us around from place to place.
4.15: Love should always make us tell the truth. Then we will grow in every way and be more like Christ, the head
4.16: of the body. Christ holds it together and makes all of its parts work perfectly, as it grows and becomes strong because of love. The Old Life and the New Life
4.17: As a follower of the Lord, I order you to stop living like stupid, godless people.
4.18: Their minds are in the dark, and they are stubborn and ignorant and have missed out on the life that comes from God. They no longer have any feelings about what is right,
4.19: and they are so greedy that they do all kinds of indecent things.
4.20: But that isn't what you were taught about Jesus Christ. He is the truth, and you heard about him and learned about him.
4.22: You were told that your foolish desires will destroy you and that you must give up your old way of life with all its bad habits.
4.23: Let the Spirit change your way of thinking
4.24: and make you into a new person. You were created to be like God, and so you must please him and be truly holy. Rules for the New Life
4.25: We are part of the same body. Stop lying and start telling each other the truth.
4.26: Don't get so angry that you sin. Don't go to bed angry
4.27: and don't give the devil a chance.
4.28: If you are a thief, quit stealing. Be honest and work hard, so you will have something to give to people in need.
4.29: Stop all your dirty talk. Say the right thing at the right time and help others by what you say.
4.30: Don't make God's Spirit sad. The Spirit makes you sure that someday you will be free from your sins.
4.31: Stop being bitter and angry and mad at others. Don't yell at one another or curse each other or ever be rude.
4.32: Instead, be kind and merciful, and forgive others, just as God forgave you because of Christ.

5.1: Do as God does. After all, you are his dear children.
5.2: Let love be your guide. Christ loved us and offered his life for us as a sacrifice that pleases God.
5.3: You are God's people, so don't let it be said that any of you are immoral or indecent or greedy.
5.4: Don't use dirty or foolish or filthy words. Instead, say how thankful you are.
5.5: Being greedy, indecent, or immoral is just another way of worshiping idols. You can be sure that people who behave in this way will never be part of the kingdom that belongs to Christ and to God. Living as People of Light
5.6: Don't let anyone trick you with foolish talk. God punishes everyone who disobeys him and says foolish things.
5.7: So don't have anything to do with anyone like that.
5.8: You used to be like people living in the dark, but now you are people of the light because you belong to the Lord. So act like people of the light
5.9: and make your light shine. Be good and honest and truthful,
5.10: as you try to please the Lord.
5.11: Don't take part in doing those worthless things that are done in the dark. Instead, show how wrong they are.
5.12: It is disgusting even to talk about what is done in the dark.
5.13: But the light will show what these things are really like.
5.14: Light shows up everything, just as the Scriptures say, "Wake up from your sleep and rise from death. Then Christ will shine on you."
5.15: Act like people with good sense and not like fools.
5.16: These are evil times, so make every minute count.
5.17: Don't be stupid. Instead, find out what the Lord wants you to do.
5.18: Don't destroy yourself by getting drunk, but let the Spirit fill your life.
5.19: When you meet together, sing psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, as you praise the Lord with all your heart.
5.20: Always use the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to thank God the Father for everything. Wives and Husbands
5.21: Honor Christ and put others first.
5.22: A wife should put her husband first, as she does the Lord.
5.23: A husband is the head of his wife, as Christ is the head and the Savior of the church, which is his own body.
5.24: Wives should always put their husbands first, as the church puts Christ first.
5.25: A husband should love his wife as much as Christ loved the church and gave his life for it.
5.26: He made the church holy by the power of his word, and he made it pure by washing it with water.
5.27: Christ did this, so that he would have a glorious and holy church, without faults or spots or wrinkles or any other flaws.
5.28: In the same way, a husband should love his wife as much as he loves himself. A husband who loves his wife shows that he loves himself.
5.29: None of us hate our own bodies. We provide for them and take good care of them, just as Christ does for the church,
5.30: because we are each part of his body.
5.31: As the Scriptures say, "A man leaves his father and mother to get married, and he becomes like one person with his wife."
5.32: This is a great mystery, but I understand it to mean Christ and his church.
5.33: So each husband should love his wife as much as he loves himself, and each wife should respect her husband.

6.1: Children, you belong to the Lord, and you do the right thing when you obey your parents. The first commandment with a promise says,
6.2: "Obey your father and your mother,
6.3: and you will have a long and happy life."
6.4: Parents, don't be hard on your children. Raise them properly. Teach them and instruct them about the Lord. Slaves and Masters
6.5: Slaves, you must obey your earthly masters. Show them great respect and be as loyal to them as you are to Christ.
6.6: Try to please them at all times, and not just when you think they are watching. You are slaves of Christ, so with your whole heart you must do what God wants you to do.
6.7: Gladly serve your masters, as though they were the Lord himself, and not simply people.
6.8: You know that you will be rewarded for any good things you do, whether you are slaves or free.
6.9: Slave owners, you must treat your slaves with this same respect. Don't threaten them. They have the same Master in heaven that you do, and he doesn't have any favorites. The Fight against Evil
6.10: Finally, let the mighty strength of the Lord make you strong.
6.11: Put on all the armor that God gives, so you can defend yourself against the devil's tricks.
6.12: We are not fighting against humans. We are fighting against forces and authorities and against rulers of darkness and powers in the spiritual world.
6.13: So put on all the armor that God gives. Then when that evil day comes, you will be able to defend yourself. And when the battle is over, you will still be standing firm.
6.14: Be ready! Let the truth be like a belt around your waist, and let God's justice protect you like armor.
6.15: Your desire to tell the good news about peace should be like shoes on your feet.
6.16: Let your faith be like a shield, and you will be able to stop all the flaming arrows of the evil one.
6.17: Let God's saving power be like a helmet, and for a sword use God's message that comes from the Spirit.
6.18: Never stop praying, especially for others. Always pray by the power of the Spirit. Stay alert and keep praying for God's people.
6.19: Pray that I will be given the message to speak and that I may fearlessly explain the mystery about the good news.
6.20: I was sent to do this work, and that's the reason I am in jail. So pray that I will be brave and will speak as I should. Final Greetings
6.21: I want you to know how I am getting along and what I am doing. That's why I am sending Tychicus to you. He is a dear friend, as well as a faithful servant of the Lord. He will tell you how I am doing, and he will cheer you up.
6.23: I pray that God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ will give peace, love, and faith to every follower!
6.24: May God be kind to everyone who keeps on loving our Lord Jesus Christ.

1.1: From Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus. To all of God's people who belong to Christ Jesus at Philippi and to all of your church officials and officers.
1.2: I pray that God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you and will bless you with peace! Paul's Prayer for the Church in Philippi
1.3: Every time I think of you, I thank my God.
1.4: And whenever I mention you in my prayers, it makes me happy.
1.5: This is because you have taken part with me in spreading the good news from the first day you heard about it.
1.6: God is the one who began this good work in you, and I am certain that he won't stop before it is complete on the day that Christ Jesus returns.
1.7: You have a special place in my heart. So it is only natural for me to feel the way I do. All of you have helped in the work that God has given me, as I defend the good news and tell about it here in jail.
1.8: God himself knows how much I want to see you. He knows that I care for you in the same way that Christ Jesus does.
1.9: I pray that your love will keep on growing and that you will fully know and understand
1.10: how to make the right choices. Then you will still be pure and innocent when Christ returns. And until that day,
1.11: Jesus Christ will keep you busy doing good deeds that bring glory and praise to God. What Life Means to Paul
1.12: My dear friends, I want you to know that what has happened to me has helped to spread the good news.
1.13: The Roman guards and all the others know that I am here in jail because I serve Christ.
1.14: Now most of the Lord's followers have become brave and are fearlessly telling the message.
1.15: Some are preaching about Christ because they are jealous and envious of us. Others are preaching because they want to help.
1.16: They love Christ and know that I am here to defend the good news about him.
1.17: But the ones who are jealous of us are not sincere. They just want to cause trouble for me while I am in jail.
1.18: But that doesn't matter. All that matters is that people are telling about Christ, whether they are sincere or not. That is what makes me glad. I will keep on being glad,
1.19: because I know that your prayers and the help that comes from the Spirit of Christ Jesus will keep me safe.
1.20: I honestly expect and hope that I will never do anything to be ashamed of. Whether I live or die, I always want to be as brave as I am now and bring honor to Christ.
1.21: If I live, it will be for Christ, and if I die, I will gain even more.
1.22: I don't know what to choose. I could keep on living and doing something useful.
1.23: It is a hard choice to make. I want to die and be with Christ, because that would be much better.
1.24: But I know that all of you still need me. That's why I am sure I will stay on to help you grow and be happy in your faith.
1.26: Then, when I visit you again, you will have good reason to take great pride in Christ Jesus because of me.
1.27: Above all else, you must live in a way that brings honor to the good news about Christ. Then, whether I visit you or not, I will hear that all of you think alike. I will know that you are working together and that you are struggling side by side to get others to believe the good news.
1.28: Be brave when you face your enemies. Your courage will show them that they are going to be destroyed, and it will show you that you will be saved. God will make all of this happen,
1.29: and he has blessed you. Not only do you have faith in Christ, but you suffer for him.
1.30: You saw me suffer, and you still hear about my troubles. Now you must suffer in the same way.

2.1: Christ encourages you, and his love comforts you. God's Spirit unites you, and you are concerned for others.
2.2: Now make me completely happy! Live in harmony by showing love for each other. Be united in what you think, as if you were only one person.
2.3: Don't be jealous or proud, but be humble and consider others more important than yourselves.
2.4: Care about them as much as you care about yourselves
2.5: and think the same way that Christ Jesus thought:
2.6: Christ was truly God. But he did not try to remain equal with God.
2.7: Instead he gave up everything and became a slave, when he became like one of us.
2.8: Christ was humble. He obeyed God and even died on a cross.
2.9: Then God gave Christ the highest place and honored his name above all others.
2.10: So at the name of Jesus everyone will bow down, those in heaven, on earth, and under the earth.
2.11: And to the glory of God the Father everyone will openly agree, "Jesus Christ is Lord!" Lights in the World
2.12: My dear friends, you always obeyed when I was with you. Now that I am away, you should obey even more. So work with fear and trembling to discover what it really means to be saved.
2.13: God is working in you to make you willing and able to obey him.
2.14: Do everything without grumbling or arguing.
2.15: Then you will be the pure and innocent children of God. You live among people who are crooked and evil, but you must not do anything that they can say is wrong. Try to shine as lights among the people of this world,
2.16: as you hold firmly to the message that gives life. Then on the day when Christ returns, I can take pride in you. I can also know that my work and efforts were not useless.
2.17: Your faith in the Lord and your service are like a sacrifice offered to him. And my own blood may have to be poured out with the sacrifice. If this happens, I will be glad and rejoice with you.
2.18: In the same way, you should be glad and rejoice with me. Timothy and Epaphroditus
2.19: I want to be encouraged by news about you. So I hope the Lord Jesus will soon let me send Timothy to you.
2.20: I don't have anyone else who cares about you as much as he does.
2.21: The others think only about what interests them and not about what concerns Christ Jesus.
2.22: But you know what kind of person Timothy is. He has worked with me like a son in spreading the good news.
2.23: I hope to send him to you, as soon as I find out what is going to happen to me.
2.24: And I feel sure that the Lord will also let me come soon.
2.25: I think I ought to send my dear friend Epaphroditus back to you. He is a follower and a worker and a soldier of the Lord, just as I am. You sent him to look after me,
2.26: but now he is eager to see you. He is worried, because you heard he was sick.
2.27: In fact, he was very sick and almost died. But God was kind to him, and also to me, and he kept me from being burdened down with sorrow.
2.28: Now I am more eager than ever to send Epaphroditus back again. You will be glad to see him, and I won't have to worry any longer.
2.29: Be sure to give him a cheerful welcome, just as people who serve the Lord deserve.
2.30: He almost died working for Christ, and he risked his own life to do for me what you could not.

3.1: Finally, my dear friends, be glad that you belong to the Lord. It doesn't bother me to write the same things to you that I have written before. In fact, it is for your own good.
3.2: Watch out for those people who behave like dogs! They are evil and want to do more than just circumcise you.
3.3: But we are the ones who are truly circumcised, because we worship by the power of God's Spirit and take pride in Christ Jesus. We don't brag about what we have done,
3.4: although I could. Others may brag about themselves, but I have more reason to brag than anyone else.
3.5: I was circumcised when I was eight days old, and I am from the nation of Israel and the tribe of Benjamin. I am a true Hebrew. As a Pharisee, I strictly obeyed the Law of Moses.
3.6: And I was so eager that I even made trouble for the church. I did everything the Law demands in order to please God.
3.7: But Christ has shown me that what I once thought was valuable is worthless.
3.8: Nothing is as wonderful as knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. I have given up everything else and count it all as garbage. All I want is Christ
3.9: and to know that I belong to him. I could not make myself acceptable to God by obeying the Law of Moses. God accepted me simply because of my faith in Christ.
3.10: All I want is to know Christ and the power that raised him to life. I want to suffer and die as he did,
3.11: so that somehow I also may be raised to life. Running toward the Goal
3.12: I have not yet reached my goal, and I am not perfect. But Christ has taken hold of me. So I keep on running and struggling to take hold of the prize.
3.13: My friends, I don't feel that I have already arrived. But I forget what is behind, and I struggle for what is ahead.
3.14: I run toward the goal, so that I can win the prize of being called to heaven. This is the prize that God offers because of what Christ Jesus has done.
3.15: All of us who are mature should think in this same way. And if any of you think differently, God will make it clear to you.
3.16: But we must keep going in the direction that we are now headed.
3.17: My friends, I want you to follow my example and learn from others who closely follow the example we set for you.
3.18: I often warned you that many people are living as enemies of the cross of Christ. And now with tears in my eyes, I warn you again
3.19: that they are headed for hell! They worship their stomachs and brag about the disgusting things they do. All they can think about are the things of this world.
3.20: But we are citizens of heaven and are eagerly waiting for our Savior to come from there. Our Lord Jesus Christ
3.21: has power over everything, and he will make these poor bodies of ours like his own glorious body.

4.1: Dear friends, I love you and long to see you. Please keep on being faithful to the Lord. You are my pride and joy. Paul Encourages the Lord's Followers
4.2: Euodia and Syntyche, you belong to the Lord, so I beg you to stop arguing with each other.
4.3: And, my true partner, I ask you to help them. These women have worked together with me and with Clement and with the others in spreading the good news. Their names are now written in the book of life.
4.4: Always be glad because of the Lord! I will say it again: Be glad.
4.5: Always be gentle with others. The Lord will soon be here.
4.6: Don't worry about anything, but pray about everything. With thankful hearts offer up your prayers and requests to God.
4.7: Then, because you belong to Christ Jesus, God will bless you with peace that no one can completely understand. And this peace will control the way you think and feel.
4.8: Finally, my friends, keep your minds on whatever is true, pure, right, holy, friendly, and proper. Don't ever stop thinking about what is truly worthwhile and worthy of praise.
4.9: You know the teachings I gave you, and you know what you heard me say and saw me do. So follow my example. And God, who gives peace, will be with you. Paul Gives Thanks for the Gifts He Was Given
4.10: The Lord has made me very grateful that at last you have thought about me once again. Actually, you were thinking about me all along, but you didn't have any chance to show it.
4.11: I am not complaining about having too little. I have learned to be satisfied with whatever I have.
4.12: I know what it is to be poor or to have plenty, and I have lived under all kinds of conditions. I know what it means to be full or to be hungry, to have too much or too little.
4.13: Christ gives me the strength to face anything.
4.14: It was good of you to help me when I was having such a hard time.
4.15: My friends at Philippi, you remember what it was like when I started preaching the good news in Macedonia. After I left there, you were the only church that became my partner by giving blessings and by receiving them in return.
4.16: Even when I was in Thessalonica, you helped me more than once.
4.17: I am not trying to get something from you, but I want you to receive the blessings that come from giving.
4.18: I have been paid back everything, and with interest. I am completely satisfied with the gifts that you had Epaphroditus bring me. They are like a sweet-smelling offering or like the right kind of sacrifice that pleases God.
4.19: I pray that God will take care of all your needs with the wonderful blessings that come from Christ Jesus!
4.20: May God our Father be praised forever and ever. Amen. Final Greetings
4.21: Give my greetings to all who are God's people because of Christ Jesus. The Lord's followers here with me send you their greetings.
4.22: All of God's people send their greetings, especially those in the service of the Emperor.
4.23: I pray that our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you and will bless your life!

1.1: From Paul, Silas, and Timothy. To the church in Thessalonica, the people of God the Father and of the Lord Jesus Christ. I pray that God will be kind to you and will bless you with peace!
1.2: We thank God for you and always mention you in our prayers. Each time we pray,
1.3: we tell God our Father about your faith and loving work and about your firm hope in our Lord Jesus Christ. The Thessalonians' Faith and Example
1.4: My dear friends, God loves you, and we know he has chosen you to be his people.
1.5: When we told you the good news, it was with the power and assurance that come from the Holy Spirit, and not simply with words. You knew what kind of people we were and how we helped you.
1.6: So, when you accepted the message, you followed our example and the example of the Lord. You suffered, but the Holy Spirit made you glad.
1.7: You became an example for all the Lord's followers in Macedonia and Achaia.
1.8: And because of you, the Lord's message has spread everywhere in those regions. Now the news of your faith in God is known all over the world, and we don't have to say a thing about it.
1.9: Everyone is talking about how you welcomed us and how you turned away from idols to serve the true and living God.
1.10: They also tell how you are waiting for his Son Jesus to come from heaven. God raised him from death, and on the day of judgment Jesus will save us from God's anger.

2.1: My friends, you know that our time with you wasn't wasted.
2.2: As you remember, we had been mistreated and insulted at Philippi. But God gave us the courage to tell you the good news about him, even though many people caused us trouble.
2.3: We didn't have any hidden motives when we won you over, and we didn't try to fool or trick anyone.
2.4: God was pleased to trust us with his message. We didn't speak to please people, but to please God who knows our motives.
2.5: You also know that we didn't try to flatter anyone. God himself knows that what we did wasn't a cover-up for greed.
2.6: We were not trying to get you or anyone else to praise us.
2.7: But as apostles, we could have demanded help from you. After all, Christ is the one who sent us. We chose to be like children or like a mother nursing her baby.
2.8: We cared so much for you, and you became so dear to us, that we were willing to give our lives for you when we gave you God's message.
2.9: My dear friends, you surely haven't forgotten our hard work and hardships. You remember how night and day we struggled to make a living, so that we could tell you God's message without being a burden to anyone.
2.10: Both you and God are witnesses that we were pure and honest and innocent in our dealings with you followers of the Lord.
2.11: You also know we did everything for you that parents would do for their own children.
2.12: We begged, encouraged, and urged each of you to live in a way that would honor God. He is the one who chose you to share in his own kingdom and glory.
2.13: We always thank God that you believed the message we preached. It came from him, and it isn't something made up by humans. You accepted it as God's message, and now he is working in you.
2.14: My friends, you did just like God's churches in Judea and like the other followers of Christ Jesus there. And so, you were mistreated by your own people, in the same way they were mistreated by their people.
2.15: Those Jews killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and they even chased us away. God doesn't like what they do and neither does anyone else.
2.16: They keep us from speaking his message to the Gentiles and from leading them to be saved. The Jews have always gone too far with their sins. Now God has finally become angry and will punish them. Paul Wants To Visit the Church Again
2.17: My friends, we were kept from coming to you for a while, but we never stopped thinking about you. We were eager to see you and tried our best to visit you in person.
2.18: We really wanted to come. I myself tried several times, but Satan always stopped us.
2.19: After all, when the Lord Jesus appears, who else but you will give us hope and joy and be like a glorious crown for us?
2.20: You alone are our glory and joy!

3.1: Finally, we couldn't stand it any longer. We decided to stay in Athens by ourselves
3.2: and send our friend Timothy to you. He works with us as God's servant and preaches the good news about Christ. We wanted him to make you strong in your faith and to encourage you.
3.3: We didn't want any of you to be discouraged by all these troubles. You knew we would have to suffer,
3.4: because when we were with you, we told you this would happen. And we did suffer, as you well know.
3.5: At last, when I could not wait any longer, I sent Timothy to find out about your faith. I hoped that Satan had not tempted you and made all our work useless.
3.6: Timothy has come back from his visit with you and has told us about your faith and love. He also said that you always have happy memories of us and that you want to see us as much as we want to see you.
3.7: My friends, even though we have a lot of trouble and suffering, your faith makes us feel better about you.
3.8: Your strong faith in the Lord is like a breath of new life.
3.9: How can we possibly thank God enough for all the happiness you have brought us?
3.10: Day and night we sincerely pray that we will see you again and help you to have an even stronger faith.
3.11: We pray that God our Father and our Lord Jesus will let us visit you.
3.12: May the Lord make your love for each other and for everyone else grow by leaps and bounds. That's how our love for you has grown.
3.13: And when our Lord comes with all of his people, I pray that he will make your hearts pure and innocent in the sight of God the Father.

4.1: Finally, my dear friends, since you belong to the Lord Jesus, we beg and urge you to live as we taught you. Then you will please God. You are already living that way, but try even harder.
4.2: Remember the instructions we gave you as followers of the Lord Jesus.
4.3: God wants you to be holy, so don't be immoral in matters of sex.
4.4: Respect and honor your wife.
4.5: Don't be a slave of your desires or live like people who don't know God.
4.6: You must not cheat any of the Lord's followers in matters of sex. Remember, we warned you that he punishes everyone who does such things.
4.7: God didn't choose you to be filthy, but to be pure.
4.8: So if you don't obey these rules, you are not really disobeying us. You are disobeying God, who gives you his Holy Spirit.
4.9: We don't have to write you about the need to love each other. God has taught you to do this,
4.10: and you already have shown your love for all of his people in Macedonia. But, my dear friends, we ask you to do even more.
4.11: Try your best to live quietly, to mind your own business, and to work hard, just as we taught you to do.
4.12: Then you will be respected by people who are not followers of the Lord, and you won't have to depend on anyone. The Lord's Coming
4.13: My friends, we want you to understand how it will be for those followers who have already died. Then you won't grieve over them and be like people who don't have any hope.
4.14: We believe that Jesus died and was raised to life. We also believe that when God brings Jesus back again, he will bring with him all who had faith in Jesus before they died.
4.15: Our Lord Jesus told us that when he comes, we won't go up to meet him ahead of his followers who have already died.
4.16: With a loud command and with the shout of the chief angel and a blast of God's trumpet, the Lord will return from heaven. Then those who had faith in Christ before they died will be raised to life.
4.17: Next, all of us who are still alive will be taken up into the clouds together with them to meet the Lord in the sky. From that time on we will all be with the Lord forever.
4.18: Encourage each other with these words.

5.1: I don't need to write you about the time or date when all this will happen.
5.2: You surely know that the Lord's return will be as a thief coming at night.
5.3: People will think they are safe and secure. But destruction will suddenly strike them like the pains of a woman about to give birth. And they won't escape.
5.4: My dear friends, you don't live in darkness, and so that day won't surprise you like a thief.
5.5: You belong to the light and live in the day. We don't live in the night or belong to the dark.
5.6: Others may sleep, but we should stay awake and be alert.
5.7: People sleep during the night, and some even get drunk.
5.8: But we belong to the day. So we must stay sober and let our faith and love be like a suit of armor. Our firm hope that we will be saved is our helmet.
5.9: God doesn't intend to punish us, but wants us to be saved by our Lord Jesus Christ.
5.10: Christ died for us, so that we could live with him, whether we are alive or dead when he comes.
5.11: That's why you must encourage and help each other, just as you are already doing. Final Instructions and Greetings
5.12: My friends, we ask you to be thoughtful of your leaders who work hard and tell you how to live for the Lord.
5.13: Show them great respect and love because of their work. Try to get along with each other.
5.14: My friends, we beg you to warn anyone who isn't living right. Encourage anyone who feels left out, help all who are weak, and be patient with everyone.
5.15: Don't be hateful to people, just because they are hateful to you. Rather, be good to each other and to everyone else.
5.16: Always be joyful
5.17: and never stop praying.
5.18: Whatever happens, keep thanking God because of Jesus Christ. This is what God wants you to do.
5.19: Don't turn away God's Spirit
5.20: or ignore prophecies.
5.21: Put everything to the test. Accept what is good
5.22: and don't have anything to do with evil.
5.23: I pray that God, who gives peace, will make you completely holy. And may your spirit, soul, and body be kept healthy and faultless until our Lord Jesus Christ returns.
5.24: The one who chose you can be trusted, and he will do this.
5.25: Friends, please pray for us.
5.26: Give the Lord's followers a warm greeting.
5.27: In the name of the Lord I beg you to read this letter to all his followers.
5.28: I pray that our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you!

1.1: From Paul, Silas, and Timothy. To the church in Thessalonica, the people of God our Father and of the Lord Jesus Christ.
1.2: I pray that God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you and will bless you with peace! When Christ Returns
1.3: My dear friends, we always have good reason to thank God for you, because your faith in God and your love for each other keep growing all the time.
1.4: That's why we brag about you to all of God's churches. We tell them how patient you are and how you keep on having faith, even though you are going through a lot of trouble and suffering.
1.5: All of this shows that God judges fairly and that he is making you fit to share in his kingdom for which you are suffering.
1.6: It is only right for God to punish everyone who is causing you trouble,
1.7: but he will give you relief from your troubles. He will do the same for us, when the Lord Jesus comes from heaven with his powerful angels
1.8: and with a flaming fire. Our Lord Jesus will punish anyone who doesn't know God and won't obey his message.
1.9: Their punishment will be eternal destruction, and they will be kept far from the presence of our Lord and his glorious strength.
1.10: This will happen on that day when the Lord returns to be praised and honored by all who have faith in him and belong to him. This includes you, because you believed what we said.
1.11: God chose you, and we keep praying that God will make you worthy of being his people. We pray for God's power to help you do all the good things that you hope to do and that your faith makes you want to do.
1.12: Then, because God and our Lord Jesus Christ are so kind, you will bring honor to the name of our Lord Jesus, and he will bring honor to you.

2.1: When our Lord Jesus returns, we will be gathered up to meet him. So I ask you, my friends,
2.2: not to be easily upset or disturbed by people who claim that the Lord has already come. They may say that they heard this directly from the Holy Spirit, or from someone else, or even that they read it in one of our letters.
2.3: But don't be fooled! People will rebel against God. Then before the Lord returns, the wicked one who is doomed to be destroyed will appear.
2.4: He will brag and oppose everything that is holy or sacred. He will even sit in God's temple and claim to be God.
2.5: Don't you remember that I told you this while I was still with you?
2.6: You already know what is holding this wicked one back until it is time for him to come.
2.7: His mysterious power is already at work, but someone is holding him back. And the wicked one won't appear until that someone is out of the way.
2.8: Then he will appear, but the Lord Jesus will kill him simply by breathing on him. He will be completely destroyed by the Lord's glorious return.
2.9: When the wicked one appears, Satan will pretend to work all kinds of miracles, wonders, and signs.
2.10: Lost people will be fooled by his evil deeds. They could be saved, but they will refuse to love the truth and accept it.
2.11: So God will make sure that they are fooled into believing a lie.
2.12: All of them will be punished, because they would rather do evil than believe the truth. Be Faithful
2.13: My friends, the Lord loves you, and it is only natural for us to thank God for you. God chose you to be the first ones to be saved. His Spirit made you holy, and you put your faith in the truth.
2.14: God used our preaching as his way of inviting you to share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
2.15: My friends, that's why you must remain faithful and follow closely what we taught you in person and by our letters.
2.16: God our Father loves us. He is kind and has given us eternal comfort and a wonderful hope. We pray that our Lord Jesus Christ and God our Father
2.17: will encourage you and help you always to do and say the right thing.

3.1: Finally, our friends, please pray for us. This will help the message about the Lord to spread quickly, and others will respect it, just as you do.
3.2: Pray that we may be kept safe from worthless and evil people. After all, not everyone has faith.
3.3: But the Lord can be trusted to make you strong and protect you from harm.
3.4: He has made us sure that you are obeying what we taught you and that you will keep on obeying.
3.5: I pray that the Lord will guide you to be as loving as God and as patient as Christ. Warnings against Laziness
3.6: My dear friends, in the name of the Lord Jesus, I beg you not to have anything to do with any of your people who loaf around and refuse to obey the instructions we gave you.
3.7: You surely know that you should follow our example. We didn't waste our time loafing,
3.8: and we didn't accept food from anyone without paying for it. We didn't want to be a burden to any of you, so night and day we worked as hard as we could.
3.9: We had the right not to work, but we wanted to set an example for you.
3.10: We also gave you the rule that if you don't work, you don't eat.
3.11: Now we learn that some of you just loaf around and won't do any work, except the work of a busybody.
3.12: So, for the sake of our Lord Jesus Christ, we ask and beg these people to settle down and start working for a living.
3.13: Dear friends, you must never become tired of doing right.
3.14: Be on your guard against any followers who refuse to obey what we have written in this letter. Put them to shame by not having anything to do with them.
3.15: Don't consider them your enemies, but speak kindly to them as you would to any other follower. Final Prayer
3.16: I pray that the Lord, who gives peace, will always bless you with peace. May the Lord be with all of you.
3.17: I always sign my letters as I am now doing: PAUL.
3.18: I pray that our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to all of you.

1.1: From Paul. God our Savior and Christ Jesus commanded me to be an apostle of Christ Jesus, who gives us hope.
1.2: Timothy, because of our faith, you are like a son to me. I pray that God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind and merciful to you. May they bless you with peace! Warning against False Teaching
1.3: When I was leaving for Macedonia, I asked you to stay on in Ephesus and warn certain people there to stop spreading their false teachings.
1.4: You needed to warn them to stop wasting their time on senseless stories and endless lists of ancestors. Such things only cause arguments. They don't help anyone to do God's work that can only be done by faith.
1.5: You must teach people to have genuine love, as well as a good conscience and true faith.
1.6: There are some who have given up these for nothing but empty talk.
1.7: They want to be teachers of the Law of Moses. But they don't know what they are talking about, even though they think they do.
1.8: We know that the Law is good, if it is used in the right way.
1.9: We also understand that it wasn't given to control people who please God, but to control lawbreakers, criminals, godless people, and sinners. It is for wicked and evil people, and for murderers, who would even kill their own parents.
1.10: The Law was written for people who are sexual perverts or who live as homosexuals or are kidnappers or liars or won't tell the truth in court. It is for anything else that opposes the correct teaching
1.11: of the good news that the glorious and wonderful God has given me. Being Thankful for God's Kindness
1.12: I thank Christ Jesus our Lord. He has given me the strength for my work because he knew that he could trust me.
1.13: I used to say terrible and insulting things about him, and I was cruel. But he had mercy on me because I didn't know what I was doing, and I had not yet put my faith in him.
1.14: Christ Jesus our Lord was very kind to me. He has greatly blessed my life with faith and love just like his own.
1.15: "Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners." This saying is true, and it can be trusted. I was the worst sinner of all!
1.16: But since I was worse than anyone else, God had mercy on me and let me be an example of the endless patience of Christ Jesus. He did this so that others would put their faith in Christ and have eternal life.
1.17: I pray that honor and glory will always be given to the only God, who lives forever and is the invisible and eternal King! Amen.
1.18: Timothy, my son, the instructions I am giving you are based on what some prophets once said about you. If you follow these instructions, you will fight like a good soldier.
1.19: You will be faithful and have a clear conscience. Some people have made a mess of their faith because they didn't listen to their consciences.
1.20: Two of them are Hymenaeus and Alexander. I have given these men over to the power of Satan, so they will learn not to oppose God.

2.1: First of all, I ask you to pray for everyone. Ask God to help and bless them all, and tell God how thankful you are for each of them.
2.2: Pray for kings and others in power, so that we may live quiet and peaceful lives as we worship and honor God.
2.3: This kind of prayer is good, and it pleases God our Savior.
2.4: God wants everyone to be saved and to know the whole truth, which is,
2.5: There is only one God, and Christ Jesus is the only one who can bring us to God. Jesus was truly human, and he gave himself to rescue all of us.
2.6: God showed us this at the right time.
2.7: This is why God chose me to be a preacher and an apostle of the good news. I am telling the truth. I am not lying. God sent me to teach the Gentiles about faith and truth.
2.8: I want everyone everywhere to lift innocent hands toward heaven and pray, without being angry or arguing with each other.
2.9: I would like for women to wear modest and sensible clothes. They should not have fancy hairdos, or wear expensive clothes, or put on jewelry made of gold or pearls.
2.10: Women who claim to love God should do helpful things for others,
2.11: and they should learn by being quiet and paying attention.
2.12: They should be silent and not be allowed to teach or to tell men what to do.
2.13: After all, Adam was created before Eve,
2.14: and the man Adam wasn't the one who was fooled. It was the woman Eve who was completely fooled and sinned.
2.15: But women will be saved by having children, if they stay faithful, loving, holy, and modest.

3.1: It is true that anyone who desires to be a church official wants to be something worthwhile.
3.2: That's why officials must have a good reputation and be faithful in marriage. They must be self-controlled, sensible, well-behaved, friendly to strangers, and able to teach.
3.3: They must not be heavy drinkers or troublemakers. Instead, they must be kind and gentle and not love money.
3.4: Church officials must be in control of their own families, and they must see that their children are obedient and always respectful.
3.5: If they don't know how to control their own families, how can they look after God's people?
3.6: They must not be new followers of the Lord. If they are, they might become proud and be doomed along with the devil.
3.7: Finally, they must be well-respected by people who are not followers. Then they won't be trapped and disgraced by the devil. Church Officers
3.8: Church officers should be serious. They must not be liars, heavy drinkers, or greedy for money.
3.9: And they must have a clear conscience and hold firmly to what God has shown us about our faith.
3.10: They must first prove themselves. Then if no one has anything against them, they can serve as officers.
3.11: Women must also be serious. They must not gossip or be heavy drinkers, and they must be faithful in everything they do.
3.12: Church officers must be faithful in marriage. They must be in full control of their children and everyone else in their home.
3.13: Those who serve well as officers will earn a good reputation and will be highly respected for their faith in Christ Jesus. The Mystery of Our Religion
3.14: I hope to visit you soon. But I am writing these instructions,
3.15: so that if I am delayed, you will know how everyone who belongs to God's family ought to behave. After all, the church of the living God is the strong foundation of truth.
3.16: Here is the great mystery of our religion: Christ came as a human. The Spirit proved that he pleased God, and he was seen by angels. Christ was preached to the nations. People in this world put their faith in him, and he was taken up to glory.

4.1: God's Spirit clearly says that in the last days many people will turn from their faith. They will be fooled by evil spirits and by teachings that come from demons.
4.2: They will also be fooled by the false claims of liars whose consciences have lost all feeling. These liars
4.3: will forbid people to marry or to eat certain foods. But God created these foods to be eaten with thankful hearts by his followers who know the truth.
4.4: Everything God created is good. And if you give thanks, you may eat anything.
4.5: What God has said and your prayer will make it fit to eat. Paul's Advice to Timothy
4.6: If you teach these things to other followers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus. You will show that you have grown up on the teachings about our faith and on the good instructions you have obeyed.
4.7: Don't have anything to do with worthless, senseless stories. Work hard to be truly religious.
4.8: As the saying goes, "Exercise is good for your body, but religion helps you in every way. It promises life now and forever." These words are worthwhile and should not be forgotten.
4.10: We have put our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of everyone, but especially of those who have faith. That's why we work and struggle so hard.
4.11: Teach these things and tell everyone to do what you say.
4.12: Don't let anyone make fun of you, just because you are young. Set an example for other followers by what you say and do, as well as by your love, faith, and purity.
4.13: Until I arrive, be sure to keep on reading the Scriptures in worship, and don't stop preaching and teaching.
4.14: Use the gift you were given when the prophets spoke and the group of church leaders blessed you by placing their hands on you.
4.15: Remember these things and think about them, so everyone can see how well you are doing.
4.16: Be careful about the way you live and about what you teach. Keep on doing this, and you will save not only yourself, but the people who hear you.

5.1: Don't correct an older man. Encourage him, as you would your own father. Treat younger men as you would your own brother,
5.2: and treat older women as you would your own mother. Show the same respect to younger women that you would to your sister.
5.3: Take care of any widow who is really in need.
5.4: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, they should learn to serve God by taking care of her, as she once took care of them. This is what God wants them to do.
5.5: A widow who is really in need is one who doesn't have any relatives. She has faith in God, and she keeps praying to him night and day, asking for his help.
5.6: A widow who thinks only about having a good time is already dead, even though she is still alive.
5.7: Tell all of this to everyone, so they will do the right thing.
5.8: People who don't take care of their relatives, and especially their own families, have given up their faith. They are worse than someone who doesn't have faith in the Lord.
5.9: For a widow to be put on the list of widows, she must be at least sixty years old, and she must have been faithful in marriage.
5.10: She must also be well-known for doing all sorts of good things, such as raising children, giving food to strangers, welcoming God's people into her home, helping people in need, and always making herself useful.
5.11: Don't put young widows on the list. They may later have a strong desire to get married. Then they will turn away from Christ
5.12: and become guilty of breaking their promise to him.
5.13: Besides, they will become lazy and get into the habit of going from house to house. Next, they will start gossiping and become busybodies, talking about things that are none of their business.
5.14: I would prefer that young widows get married, have children, and look after their families. Then the enemy won't have any reason to say insulting things about us.
5.15: Look what's already happened to some of the young widows! They have turned away to follow Satan.
5.16: If a woman who is a follower has any widows in her family, she should help them. This will keep the church from having that burden, and then the church can help widows who are really in need. Church Leaders
5.17: Church leaders who do their job well deserve to be paid twice as much, especially if they work hard at preaching and teaching.
5.18: It is just as the Scriptures say, "Don't muzzle an ox when you are using it to grind grain." You also know the saying, "Workers are worth their pay."
5.19: Don't listen to any charge against a church leader, unless at least two or three people bring the same charges.
5.20: But if any of the leaders should keep on sinning, they must be corrected in front of the whole group, as a warning to everyone else.
5.21: In the presence of God and Christ Jesus and their chosen angels, I order you to follow my instructions! Be fair with everyone, and don't have any favorites.
5.22: Don't be too quick to accept people into the service of the Lord by placing your hands on them. Don't sin because others do, but stay close to God.
5.23: Stop drinking only water. Take a little wine to help your stomach trouble and the other illnesses you always have.
5.24: Some people get caught in their sins right away, even before the time of judgment. But other people's sins don't show up until later.
5.25: It is the same with good deeds. Some are easily seen, but none of them can be hidden.

6.1: If you are a slave, you should respect and honor your owner. This will keep people from saying bad things about God and about our teaching.
6.2: If any of you slaves have owners who are followers, you should show them respect. After all, they are also followers of Christ, and he loves them. So you should serve and help them the best you can. These are the things you must teach and tell the people to do. False Teaching and True Wealth
6.3: Anyone who teaches something different disagrees with the correct and godly teaching of our Lord Jesus Christ.
6.4: Those people who disagree are proud of themselves, but they don't really know a thing. Their minds are sick, and they like to argue over words. They cause jealousy, disagreements, unkind words, evil suspicions,
6.5: and nasty quarrels. They have wicked minds and have missed out on the truth. These people think religion is supposed to make you rich.
6.6: And religion does make your life rich, by making you content with what you have.
6.7: We didn't bring anything into this world, and we won't take anything with us when we leave.
6.8: So we should be satisfied just to have food and clothes.
6.9: People who want to be rich fall into all sorts of temptations and traps. They are caught by foolish and harmful desires that drag them down and destroy them.
6.10: The love of money causes all kinds of trouble. Some people want money so much that they have given up their faith and caused themselves a lot of pain. Fighting a Good Fight for the Faith
6.11: Timothy, you belong to God, so keep away from all these evil things. Try your best to please God and to be like him. Be faithful, loving, dependable, and gentle.
6.12: Fight a good fight for the faith and claim eternal life. God offered it to you when you clearly told about your faith, while so many people listened.
6.13: Now I ask you to make a promise. Make it in the presence of God, who gives life to all, and in the presence of Jesus Christ, who openly told Pontius Pilate about his faith.
6.14: Promise to obey completely and fully all that you have been told until our Lord Jesus Christ returns.
6.15: The glorious God is the only Ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords. At the time that God has already decided, he will send Jesus Christ back again.
6.16: Only God lives forever! And he lives in light that no one can come near. No human has ever seen God or ever can see him. God will be honored, and his power will last forever. Amen.
6.17: Warn the rich people of this world not to be proud or to trust in wealth that is easily lost. Tell them to have faith in God, who is rich and blesses us with everything we need to enjoy life.
6.18: Instruct them to do as many good deeds as they can and to help everyone. Remind the rich to be generous and share what they have.
6.19: This will lay a solid foundation for the future, so that they will know what true life is like.
6.20: Timothy, guard what God has placed in your care! Don't pay any attention to that godless and stupid talk that sounds smart but really isn't.
6.21: Some people have even lost their faith by believing this talk. I pray that the Lord will be kind to all of you!

1.1: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus. God himself chose me to be an apostle, and he gave me the promised life that Jesus Christ makes possible.
1.2: Timothy, you are like a dear child to me. I pray that God our Father and our Lord Christ Jesus will be kind and merciful to you and will bless you with peace! Do Not Be Ashamed of the Lord
1.3: Night and day I mention you in my prayers. I am always grateful for you, as I pray to the God my ancestors and I have served with a clear conscience.
1.4: I remember how you cried, and I want to see you, because that will make me truly happy.
1.5: I also remember the genuine faith of your mother Eunice. Your grandmother Lois had the same sort of faith, and I am sure that you have it as well.
1.6: So I ask you to make full use of the gift that God gave you when I placed my hands on you. Use it well.
1.7: God's Spirit doesn't make cowards out of us. The Spirit gives us power, love, and self-control.
1.8: Don't be ashamed to speak for our Lord. And don't be ashamed of me, just because I am in jail for serving him. Use the power that comes from God and join with me in suffering for telling the good news.
1.9: God saved us and chose us to be his holy people. We did nothing to deserve this, but God planned it because he is so kind. Even before time began God planned for Christ Jesus to show kindness to us.
1.10: Now Christ Jesus has come to show us the kindness of God. Christ our Savior defeated death and brought us the good news. It shines like a light and offers life that never ends.
1.11: My work is to be a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher.
1.12: That's why I am suffering now. But I am not ashamed! I know the one I have faith in, and I am sure that he can guard until the last day what he has trusted me with.
1.13: Now follow the example of the correct teaching I gave you, and let the faith and love of Christ Jesus be your model.
1.14: You have been trusted with a wonderful treasure. Guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit, who lives within you.
1.15: You know that everyone in Asia has turned against me, especially Phygelus and Hermogenes.
1.16: I pray that the Lord will be kind to the family of Onesiphorus. He often cheered me up and wasn't ashamed of me when I was put in jail.
1.17: Then after he arrived in Rome, he searched everywhere until he found me.
1.18: I pray that the Lord Jesus will ask God to show mercy to Onesiphorus on the day of judgment. You know how much he helped me in Ephesus.

2.1: Timothy, my child, Christ Jesus is kind, and you must let him make you strong.
2.2: You have often heard me teach. Now I want you to tell these same things to followers who can be trusted to tell others.
2.3: As a good soldier of Christ Jesus you must endure your share of suffering.
2.4: Soldiers on duty don't work at outside jobs. They try only to please their commanding officer.
2.5: No one wins an athletic contest without obeying the rules.
2.6: And farmers who work hard are the first to eat what grows in their field.
2.7: If you keep in mind what I have told you, the Lord will help you understand completely.
2.8: Keep your mind on Jesus Christ! He was from the family of David and was raised from death, just as my good news says.
2.9: And because of this message, I am locked up in jail and treated like a criminal. But God's good news isn't locked in jail,
2.10: and so I am willing to put up with anything. Then God's special people will be saved. They will be given eternal glory because they belong to Christ Jesus.
2.11: Here is a true message: "If we died with Christ, we will live with him.
2.12: If we don't give up, we will rule with him. If we deny that we know him, he will deny that he knows us.
2.13: If we are not faithful, he will still be faithful. Christ cannot deny who he is." An Approved Worker
2.14: Don't let anyone forget these things. And with God as your witness, you must warn them not to argue about words. These arguments don't help anyone. In fact, they ruin everyone who listens to them.
2.15: Do your best to win God's approval as a worker who doesn't need to be ashamed and who teaches only the true message.
2.16: Keep away from worthless and useless talk. It only leads people farther away from God.
2.17: That sort of talk is like a sore that won't heal. And Hymenaeus and Philetus have been talking this way
2.18: by teaching that the dead have already been raised to life. This is far from the truth, and it is destroying the faith of some people.
2.19: But the foundation that God has laid is solid. On it is written, "The Lord knows who his people are. So everyone who worships the Lord must turn away from evil."
2.20: In a large house some dishes are made of gold or silver, while others are made of wood or clay. Some of these are special, and others are not.
2.21: That's also how it is with people. The ones who stop doing evil and make themselves pure will become special. Their lives will be holy and pleasing to their Master, and they will be able to do all kinds of good deeds.
2.22: Run from temptations that capture young people. Always do the right thing. Be faithful, loving, and easy to get along with. Worship with people whose hearts are pure.
2.23: Stay away from stupid and senseless arguments. These only lead to trouble,
2.24: and God's servants must not be troublemakers. They must be kind to everyone, and they must be good teachers and very patient.
2.25: Be humble when you correct people who oppose you. Maybe God will lead them to turn to him and learn the truth.
2.26: They have been trapped by the devil, and he makes them obey him, but God may help them escape.

3.1: You can be certain that in the last days there will be some very hard times.
3.2: People will love only themselves and money. They will be proud, stuck-up, rude, and disobedient to their parents. They will also be ungrateful, godless,
3.3: heartless, and hateful. Their words will be cruel, and they will have no self-control or pity. These people will hate everything that is good.
3.4: They will be sneaky, reckless, and puffed up with pride. Instead of loving God, they will love pleasure.
3.5: Even though they will make a show of being religious, their religion won't be real. Don't have anything to do with such people.
3.6: Some men fool whole families, just to get power over those women who are slaves of sin and are controlled by all sorts of desires.
3.7: These women always want to learn something new, but they never can discover the truth.
3.8: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, these people are enemies of the truth. Their minds are sick, and their faith isn't real.
3.9: But they won't get very far with their foolishness. Soon everyone will know the truth about them, just as Jannes and Jambres were found out. Paul's Last Instructions to Timothy
3.10: Timothy, you know what I teach and how I live. You know what I want to do and what I believe. You have seen how patient and loving I am, and how in the past I put up with
3.11: trouble and suffering in the cities of Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. Yet the Lord rescued me from all those terrible troubles.
3.12: Anyone who belongs to Christ Jesus and wants to live right will have trouble from others.
3.13: But evil people who pretend to be what they are not will become worse than ever, as they fool others and are fooled themselves.
3.14: Keep on being faithful to what you were taught and to what you believed. After all, you know who taught you these things.
3.15: Since childhood, you have known the Holy Scriptures that are able to make you wise enough to have faith in Christ Jesus and be saved.
3.16: Everything in the Scriptures is God's Word. All of it is useful for teaching and helping people and for correcting them and showing them how to live.
3.17: The Scriptures train God's servants to do all kinds of good deeds.

4.1: When Christ Jesus comes as king, he will be the judge of everyone, whether they are living or dead. So with God and Christ as witnesses, I command you
4.2: to preach God's message. Do it willingly, even if it isn't the popular thing to do. You must correct people and point out their sins. But also cheer them up, and when you instruct them, always be patient.
4.3: The time is coming when people won't listen to good teaching. Instead, they will look for teachers who will please them by telling them only what they are itching to hear.
4.4: They will turn from the truth and eagerly listen to senseless stories.
4.5: But you must stay calm and be willing to suffer. You must work hard to tell the good news and to do your job well.
4.6: Now the time has come for me to die. My life is like a drink offering being poured out on the altar.
4.7: I have fought well. I have finished the race, and I have been faithful.
4.8: So a crown will be given to me for pleasing the Lord. He judges fairly, and on the day of judgment he will give a crown to me and to everyone else who wants him to appear with power. Personal Instructions
4.9: Come to see me as soon as you can.
4.10: Demas loves the things of this world so much that he left me and went to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus has gone to Dalmatia.
4.11: Only Luke has stayed with me. Mark can be very helpful to me, so please find him and bring him with you.
4.12: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
4.13: When you come, bring the coat I left at Troas with Carpus. Don't forget to bring the scrolls, especially the ones made of leather.
4.14: Alexander, the metalworker, has hurt me in many ways. But the Lord will pay him back for what he has done.
4.15: Alexander opposes what we preach. You had better watch out for him.
4.16: When I was first put on trial, no one helped me. In fact, everyone deserted me. I hope it won't be held against them.
4.17: But the Lord stood beside me. He gave me the strength to tell his full message, so that all Gentiles would hear it. And I was kept safe from hungry lions.
4.18: The Lord will always keep me from being harmed by evil, and he will bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom. Praise him forever and ever! Amen. Final Greetings
4.19: Give my greetings to Priscilla and Aquila and to the family of Onesiphorus.
4.20: Erastus stayed at Corinth. Trophimus was sick when I left him at Miletus.
4.21: Do your best to come before winter. Eubulus, Pudens, Linus, and Claudia send you their greetings, and so do the rest of the Lord's followers.
4.22: I pray that the Lord will bless your life and will be kind to you.

1.1: From Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ. I encourage God's own people to have more faith and to understand the truth about religion.
1.2: Then they will have the hope of eternal life that God promised long ago. And God never tells a lie!
1.3: So, at the proper time, God our Savior gave this message and told me to announce what he had said.
1.4: Titus, because of our faith, you are like a son to me. I pray that God our Father and Christ Jesus our Savior will be kind to you and will bless you with peace! What Titus Was To Do in Crete
1.5: I left you in Crete to do what had been left undone and to appoint leaders for the churches in each town. As I told you,
1.6: they must have a good reputation and be faithful in marriage. Their children must be followers of the Lord and not have a reputation for being wild and disobedient.
1.7: Church officials are in charge of God's work, and so they must also have a good reputation. They must not be bossy, quick-tempered, heavy drinkers, bullies, or dishonest in business.
1.8: Instead, they must be friendly to strangers and enjoy doing good things. They must also be sensible, fair, pure, and self-controlled.
1.9: They must stick to the true message they were taught, so that their good teaching can help others and correct everyone who opposes it.
1.10: There are many who don't respect authority, and they fool others by talking nonsense. This is especially true of some Jewish followers.
1.11: But you must make them be quiet. They are after money, and they upset whole families by teaching what they should not.
1.12: It is like one of their own prophets once said, "The people of Crete always tell lies. They are greedy and lazy like wild animals."
1.13: That surely is a true saying. And you should be hard on such people, so you can help them grow stronger in their faith.
1.14: Don't pay any attention to any of those senseless Jewish stories and human commands. These are made up by people who won't obey the truth.
1.15: Everything is pure for someone whose heart is pure. But nothing is pure for an unbeliever with a dirty mind. That person's mind and conscience are destroyed.
