3.15: Don't forget that the Lord is patient because he wants people to be saved. This is also what our dear friend Paul said when he wrote you with the wisdom that God had given him.
3.16: Paul talks about these same things in all his letters, but part of what he says is hard to understand. Some ignorant and unsteady people even destroy themselves by twisting what he said. They do the same thing with other Scriptures too.
3.17: My dear friends, you have been warned ahead of time! So don't let the errors of evil people lead you down the wrong path and make you lose your balance.
3.18: Let the wonderful kindness and the understanding that come from our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ help you to keep on growing. Praise Jesus now and forever! Amen.

1.1: The Word that gives life was from the beginning, and this is the one our message is about. Our ears have heard, our own eyes have seen, and our hands touched this Word.
1.2: The one who gives life appeared! We saw it happen, and we are witnesses to what we have seen. Now we are telling you about this eternal life that was with the Father and appeared to us.
1.3: We are telling you what we have seen and heard, so that you may share in this life with us. And we share in it with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.
1.4: We are writing to tell you these things, because this makes us truly happy. God Is Light
1.5: Jesus told us that God is light and doesn't have any darkness in him. Now we are telling you.
1.6: If we say that we share in life with God and keep on living in the dark, we are lying and are not living by the truth.
1.7: But if we live in the light, as God does, we share in life with each other. And the blood of his Son Jesus washes all our sins away.
1.8: If we say that we have not sinned, we are fooling ourselves, and the truth isn't in our hearts.
1.9: But if we confess our sins to God, he can always be trusted to forgive us and take our sins away.
1.10: If we say that we have not sinned, we make God a liar, and his message isn't in our hearts.

2.1: My children, I am writing this so that you won't sin. But if you do sin, Jesus Christ always does the right thing, and he will speak to the Father for us.
2.2: Christ is the sacrifice that takes away our sins and the sins of all the world's people.
2.3: When we obey God, we are sure that we know him.
2.4: But if we claim to know him and don't obey him, we are lying and the truth isn't in our hearts.
2.5: We truly love God only when we obey him as we should, and then we know that we belong to him.
2.6: If we say we are his, we must follow the example of Christ. The New Commandment
2.7: My dear friends, I am not writing to give you a new commandment. It is the same one that you were first given, and it is the message you heard.
2.8: But it really is a new commandment, and you know its true meaning, just as Christ does. You can see the darkness fading away and the true light already shining.
2.9: If we claim to be in the light and hate someone, we are still in the dark.
2.10: But if we love others, we are in the light, and we don't cause problems for them.
2.11: If we hate others, we are living and walking in the dark. We don't know where we are going, because we can't see in the dark.
2.12: Children, I am writing you, because your sins have been forgiven in the name of Christ.
2.13: Parents, I am writing you, because you have known the one who was there from the beginning. Young people, I am writing you, because you have defeated the evil one.
2.14: Children, I am writing you, because you have known the Father. Parents, I am writing you, because you have known the one who was there from the beginning. Young people, I am writing you, because you are strong. God's message is firm in your hearts, and you have defeated the evil one.
2.15: Don't love the world or anything that belongs to the world. If you love the world, you cannot love the Father.
2.16: Our foolish pride comes from this world, and so do our selfish desires and our desire to have everything we see. None of this comes from the Father.
2.17: The world and the desires it causes are disappearing. But if we obey God, we will live forever. The Enemy of Christ
2.18: Children, this is the last hour. You heard that the enemy of Christ would appear at this time, and many of Christ's enemies have already appeared. So we know that the last hour is here.
2.19: These people came from our own group, yet they were not part of us. If they had been part of us, they would have stayed with us. But they left, which proves that they did not belong to our group.
2.20: Christ, the Holy One, has blessed you, and now all of you understand.
2.21: I did not need to write you about the truth, since you already know it. You also know that liars do not belong to the truth.
2.22: And a liar is anyone who says that Jesus isn't truly Christ. Anyone who says this is an enemy of Christ and rejects both the Father and the Son.
2.23: If we reject the Son, we reject the Father. But if we say that we accept the Son, we have the Father.
2.24: Keep thinking about the message you first heard, and you will always be one in your heart with the Son and with the Father.
2.25: The Son has promised us eternal life.
2.26: I am writing to warn you about those people who are misleading you.
2.27: But Christ has blessed you with the Holy Spirit. Now the Spirit stays in you, and you don't need any teachers. The Spirit is truthful and teaches you everything. So stay one in your heart with Christ, just as the Spirit has taught you to do. Children of God
2.28: Children, stay one in your hearts with Christ. Then when he returns, we will have confidence and won't have to hide in shame.
2.29: You know that Christ always does right and that everyone who does right is a child of God.

3.1: Think how much the Father loves us. He loves us so much that he lets us be called his children, as we truly are. But since the people of this world did not know who Christ is, they don't know who we are.
3.2: My dear friends, we are already God's children, though what we will be hasn't yet been seen. But we do know that when Christ returns, we will be like him, because we will see him as he truly is.
3.3: This hope makes us keep ourselves holy, just as Christ is holy.
3.4: Everyone who sins breaks God's law, because sin is the same as breaking God's law.
3.5: You know that Christ came to take away sins. He isn't sinful,
3.6: and people who stay one in their hearts with him won't keep on sinning. If they do keep on sinning, they don't know Christ, and they have never seen him.
3.7: Children, don't be fooled. Anyone who does right is good, just like Christ himself.
3.8: Anyone who keeps on sinning belongs to the devil. He has sinned from the beginning, but the Son of God came to destroy all that he has done.
3.9: God's children cannot keep on being sinful. His life-giving power lives in them and makes them his children, so that they cannot keep on sinning.
3.10: You can tell God's children from the devil's children, because those who belong to the devil refuse to do right or to love each other. Love Each Other
3.11: From the beginning you were told that we must love each other.
3.12: Don't be like Cain, who belonged to the devil and murdered his own brother. Why did he murder him? He did it because his brother was good, and he was evil.
3.13: My friends, don't be surprised if the people of this world hate you.
3.14: Our love for each other proves that we have gone from death to life. But if you don't love each other, you are still under the power of death.
3.15: If you hate each other, you are murderers, and we know that murderers do not have eternal life.
3.16: We know what love is because Jesus gave his life for us. That's why we must give our lives for each other.
3.17: If we have all we need and see one of our own people in need, we must have pity on that person, or else we cannot say we love God.
3.18: Children, you show love for others by truly helping them, and not merely by talking about it.
3.19: When we love others, we know that we belong to the truth, and we feel at ease in the presence of God.
3.20: But even if we don't feel at ease, God is greater than our feelings, and he knows everything.
3.21: Dear friends, if we feel at ease in the presence of God, we will have the courage to come near him.
3.22: He will give us whatever we ask, because we obey him and do what pleases him.
3.23: God wants us to have faith in his Son Jesus Christ and to love each other. This is also what Jesus taught us to do.
3.24: If we obey God's commandments, we will stay one in our hearts with him, and he will stay one with us. The Spirit that he has given us is proof that we are one with him.

4.1: Dear friends, don't believe everyone who claims to have the Spirit of God. Test them all to find out if they really do come from God. Many false prophets have already gone out into the world,
4.2: and you can know which ones come from God. His Spirit says that Jesus Christ had a truly human body.
4.3: But when someone doesn't say this about Jesus, you know that person has a spirit that doesn't come from God and is the enemy of Christ. You knew that this enemy was coming into the world and now is already here.
4.4: Children, you belong to God, and you have defeated these enemies. God's Spirit is in you and is more powerful than the one that is in the world.
4.5: These enemies belong to this world, and the world listens to them, because they speak its language.
4.6: We belong to God, and everyone who knows God will listen to us. But the people who don't know God won't listen to us. That is how we can tell the Spirit that speaks the truth from the one that tells lies.
4.7: My dear friends, we must love each other. Love comes from God, and when we love each other, it shows that we have been given new life. We are now God's children, and we know him.
4.8: God is love, and anyone who doesn't love others has never known him.
4.9: God showed his love for us when he sent his only Son into the world to give us life.
4.10: Real love isn't our love for God, but his love for us. God sent his Son to be the sacrifice by which our sins are forgiven.
4.11: Dear friends, since God loved us this much, we must love each other.
4.12: No one has ever seen God. But if we love each other, God lives in us, and his love is truly in our hearts.
4.13: God has given us his Spirit. That is how we know that we are one with him, just as he is one with us.
4.14: God sent his Son to be the Savior of the world. We saw his Son and are now telling others about him.
4.15: God stays one with everyone who openly says that Jesus is the Son of God. That's how we stay one with God
4.16: and are sure that God loves us. God is love. If we keep on loving others, we will stay one in our hearts with God, and he will stay one with us.
4.17: If we truly love others and live as Christ did in this world, we won't be worried about the day of judgment.
4.18: A real love for others will chase those worries away. The thought of being punished is what makes us afraid. It shows that we have not really learned to love.
4.19: We love because God loved us first.
4.20: But if we say we love God and don't love each other, we are liars. We cannot see God. So how can we love God, if we don't love the people we can see?
4.21: The commandment that God has given us is: "Love God and love each other!"

5.1: If we believe that Jesus is truly Christ, we are God's children. Everyone who loves the Father will also love his children.
5.2: If we love and obey God, we know that we will love his children.
5.3: We show our love for God by obeying his commandments, and they are not hard to follow.
5.4: Every child of God can defeat the world, and our faith is what gives us this victory.
5.5: No one can defeat the world without having faith in Jesus as the Son of God. Who Jesus Is
5.6: Water and blood came out from the side of Jesus Christ. It wasn't just water, but water and blood. The Spirit tells about this, because the Spirit is truthful.
5.7: In fact, there are three who tell about it.
5.8: They are the Spirit, the water, and the blood, and they all agree.
5.9: We believe what people tell us. But we can trust what God says even more, and God is the one who has spoken about his Son.
5.10: If we have faith in God's Son, we have believed what God has said. But if we don't believe what God has said about his Son, it is the same as calling God a liar.
5.11: God has also said that he gave us eternal life and that this life comes to us from his Son.
5.12: And so, if we have God's Son, we have this life. But if we don't have the Son, we don't have this life. Knowing about Eternal Life
5.13: All of you have faith in the Son of God, and I have written to let you know that you have eternal life.
5.14: We are certain that God will hear our prayers when we ask for what pleases him.
5.15: And if we know that God listens when we pray, we are sure that our prayers have already been answered.
5.16: Suppose you see one of our people commit a sin that isn't a deadly sin. You can pray, and that person will be given eternal life. But the sin must not be one that is deadly.
5.17: Everything that is wrong is sin, but not all sins are deadly.
5.18: We are sure that God's children do not keep on sinning. God's own Son protects them, and the devil cannot harm them.
5.19: We are certain that we come from God and that the rest of the world is under the power of the devil.
5.20: We know that Jesus Christ the Son of God has come and has shown us the true God. And because of Jesus, we now belong to the true God who gives eternal life.
5.21: Children, you must stay away from idols.

1.1: From the church leader. To a very special woman and her children. I truly love all of you, and so does everyone else who knows the truth.
1.2: We love you because the truth is now in our hearts, and it will be there forever.
1.3: I pray that God the Father and Jesus Christ his Son will be kind and merciful to us! May they give us peace and truth and love. Truth and Love
1.4: I was very glad to learn that some of your children are obeying the truth, as the Father told us to do.
1.5: Dear friend, I am not writing to tell you and your children to do something you have not done before. I am writing to tell you to love each other, which is the first thing you were told to do.
1.6: Love means that we do what God tells us. And from the beginning, he told you to love him.
1.7: Many liars have gone out into the world. These deceitful liars are saying that Jesus Christ did not have a truly human body. But they are liars and the enemies of Christ.
1.8: So be sure not to lose what we have worked for. If you do, you won't be given your full reward.
1.9: Don't keep changing what you were taught about Christ, or else God will no longer be with you. But if you hold firmly to what you were taught, both the Father and the Son will be with you.
1.10: If people won't agree to this teaching, don't welcome them into your home or even greet them.
1.11: Greeting them is the same as taking part in their evil deeds. Final Greetings
1.12: I have much more to tell you, but I don't want to write it with pen and ink. I want to come and talk to you in person, because that will make us really happy.
1.13: Greetings from the children of your very special sister.

1.1: From the church leader. To my dear friend Gaius. I love you because we follow the truth,
1.2: dear friend, and I pray that all goes well for you. I hope that you are as strong in body, as I know you are in spirit.
1.3: It makes me very happy when the Lord's followers come by and speak openly of how you obey the truth.
1.4: Nothing brings me greater happiness than to hear that my children are obeying the truth. Working Together
1.5: Dear friend, you have always been faithful in helping other followers of the Lord, even the ones you didn't know before.
1.6: They have told the church about your love. They say you were good enough to welcome them and to send them on their mission in a way that God's servants deserve.
1.7: When they left to tell others about the Lord, they decided not to accept help from anyone who wasn't a follower.
1.8: We must support people like them, so that we can take part in what they are doing to spread the truth.
1.9: I wrote to the church. But Diotrephes likes to be the number-one leader, and he won't pay any attention to us.
1.10: So if I come, I will remind him of how he has been attacking us with gossip. Not only has he been doing this, but he refuses to welcome any of the Lord's followers who come by. And when other church members want to welcome them, he puts them out of the church.
1.11: Dear friend, don't copy the evil deeds of others! Follow the example of people who do kind deeds. They are God's children, but those who are always doing evil have never seen God.
1.12: Everyone speaks well of Demetrius, and so does the true message that he teaches. I also speak well of him, and you know what I say is true. Final Greetings
1.13: I have much more to say to you, but I don't want to write it with pen and ink.
1.14: I hope to see you soon, and then we can talk in person.

1.1: From Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ and the brother of James. To all who are chosen and loved by God the Father and are kept safe by Jesus Christ.
1.2: I pray that God will greatly bless you with kindness, peace, and love! False Teachers
1.3: My dear friends, I really wanted to write you about God's saving power at work in our lives. But instead, I must write and ask you to defend the faith that God has once for all given to his people.
1.4: Some godless people have sneaked in among us and are saying, "God treats us much better than we deserve, and so it is all right to be immoral." They even deny that we must obey Jesus Christ as our only Master and Lord. But long ago the Scriptures warned that these godless people were doomed.
1.5: Don't forget what happened to those people that the Lord rescued from Egypt. Some of them did not have faith, and he later destroyed them.
1.6: You also know about the angels who didn't do their work and left their proper places. God chained them with everlasting chains and is now keeping them in dark pits until the great day of judgment.
1.7: We should also be warned by what happened to the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah and the nearby towns. Their people became immoral and did all sorts of sexual sins. Then God made an example of them and punished them with eternal fire.
1.8: The people I am talking about are behaving just like those dreamers who destroyed their own bodies. They reject all authority and insult angels.
1.9: Even Michael, the chief angel, didn't dare to insult the devil, when the two of them were arguing about the body of Moses. All Michael said was, "The Lord will punish you!"
1.10: But these people insult powers they don't know anything about. They are like senseless animals that end up getting destroyed, because they live only by their feelings.
1.11: Now they are in for real trouble. They have followed Cain's example and have made the same mistake that Balaam did by caring only for money. They have also rebelled against God, just as Korah did. Because of all this, they will be destroyed.
1.12: These people are filthy minded, and by their shameful and selfish actions they spoil the meals you eat together. They are like clouds blown along by the wind, but never bringing any rain. They are like leafless trees, uprooted and dead, and unable to produce fruit.
1.13: Their shameful deeds show up like foam on wild ocean waves. They are like wandering stars forever doomed to the darkest pits of hell.
1.14: Enoch was the seventh person after Adam, and he was talking about these people when he said: Look! The Lord is coming with thousands and thousands of holy angels
1.15: to judge everyone. He will punish all those ungodly people for all the evil things they have done. The Lord will surely punish those ungodly sinners for every evil thing they have ever said about him.
1.16: These people grumble and complain and live by their own selfish desires. They brag about themselves and flatter others to get what they want. More Warnings
1.17: My dear friends, remember the warning you were given by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ.
1.18: They told you that near the end of time, selfish and godless people would start making fun of God.
1.19: And now these people are already making you turn against each other. They think only about this life, and they don't have God's Spirit.
1.20: Dear friends, keep building on the foundation of your most holy faith, as the Holy Spirit helps you to pray.
1.21: And keep in step with God's love, as you wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to show how kind he is by giving you eternal life.
1.22: Be helpful to all who may have doubts.
1.23: Rescue any who need to be saved, as you would rescue someone from a fire. Then with fear in your own hearts, have mercy on everyone who needs it. But hate even the clothes of those who have been made dirty by their filthy deeds. Final Prayer
1.24: Offer praise to God our Savior because of our Lord Jesus Christ! Only God can keep you from falling and make you pure and joyful in his glorious presence. Before time began and now and forevermore, God is worthy of glory, honor, power, and authority. Amen.
